story:
Hi there!!  We are The Cabaret Project – a production house and entertainment company located in Chicago. We’ve been incorporated since 2007 and have been stimulating audiences since then all over the city, suburbs and have recently expanded into Wisconsin, Michigan, Missouri and even Puerto Vallarta, MX. We are running this campaign to raise capital to open our own piano bar and cabaret here in Chicago, to continue producing these amazing shows and to support all the amazing entertainment professionals here in the city who are looking for somewhere to share their talents.

Let’s break it down in more detail:

  • We need to raise $50,000 to put towards opening our piano bar and cabaret.
  • This money will help with securing the lease, decorating the space, buying cabaret tables, chairs, lighting, building and stocking the beautiful bar, designing a lounge area and getting this space ready for shows.
  • We’ll have 3 different donation packages, giving you the option to choose what is best for you. With your gracious donation of $1,000 you will get an invite to our Private Grand Opening Night Party, full year access to pre-sale and advanced sale ticketing, complimentary VIP upgrades (when available) and a custom tote bag. With a donation of $500 you will get full year access to pre-sale and advanced sale ticketing, complimentary VIP upgrades (when available) and a custom tote bag. And a donation of $100 helps us so much, and you'll get a custom tote bag. Every dollar helps, so any amount is great appreciated.
  • Without your contribution it will surely stall the opening of our cabaret. We are hoping for your support to help us realize our goal and bring this amazing opportunity to Chicago.

Some people can't contribute and we understand that - but it doesn't mean you can't help:

  • We would be so grateful if you could ask people you know to get the word out and share our campaign with them.
  • Please share this with your friends!

story:
Hi - I'm Tom Dyer. I'm a musician. Recording guy. Art guy. Politically resistant guy. I run a dinky label in Olympia, WA - Green Monkey Records - which puts out mostly obscure  Pacific Northwest artists. The best selling band on the label is the Green Pajamas; the worst selling is probably me. I do not let that slow me down one little bit. Beside my thirteen recent albums, I did some in the 80's and I've released a bunch of digital singles. Usually my mom likes 'em. Thanks, Mom.

In my life I've mostly been compared to two musicians, Springsteen and Zappa. That used to really annoy me. I long ago quit worrying about that.  I will say that Frank (and Beefheart) probably headed me down the road to some of the things that have shaped my musical brain: Edgard Varese leads to Karlheinz Stockhausen leads to Harry Partch Leads to Tod Dockstader.  Ornette Coleman leads to Blood Ulmer leads to Funkadelic leads to Public Enemy. And of course everyone loves Kraftwerk, right? 

That is not to say I sound like any of those people. I don't, but you wander down a path that is littered with dissonance and maybe you end up in this neighborhood.

Most of my albums involve bands, some are 100% solo. This however, is different bird. Songs on "1+1" go back as far as 2008 and with the exception of 2 songs (1 solo, 1 trio) they are all duets.  Me and one other person get in a room (or two) with little-to-no preparation and put our hearts into making a glorious racket. I am most grateful to all the talented folks that have been willing to record a tune with me.  This is not really a rock/pop record - it is pretty firmly outsider stuff. That makes me happy.

If you'd like a sneak preview, here's a couple links: 

https://greenmonkeyrecords.bandcamp.com/track/song-of-frogs

https://greenmonkeyrecords.bandcamp.com/album/death-on-mounts-road

This music might not be the most mainstream, but I still want to give it a public life - send it on out to find its way in the world. That's where you come in. I recorded this music in my house in my studio - don't need nothin' there. However, I am looking to raise $1,200 to press this thing (CDs) and then send it around the world to wherever I can get it heard and reviewed. Mailing promotional CDs to Europe costs about 15 bucks a pop, so it adds up quick. 

What do you get for contributing? Well, I, like everyone else on Indie Go Go, have the greatest perks of all time. Plus you get a warm and fuzzy feeling deep down knowing you have made the world slightly more artistic. Who doesn't want that?

That's basically it. Of course you are welcome to share this with all your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, email (gasp!) pals and tell them what a delightful thing this shall be. Use the dandy IndieGoGo sharing tool thingy and share away.

Thanks!

story:
Hi, my name is Dustin Ransom.  I have the great privilege of making music for a living with the purpose of inspiring you to live a life full of love, peace, and joy. 

On August 16th, I am releasing a new record called Frontiers.  It's a record about learning how to be our true authentic selves by letting go of the past and the future in order to live in the present moment.  For me, it is the most important message I could possibly convey to anyone, and I need your help to share it. 

I'm offering a ton of exclusive, one-of-a-kind packages that all have something to hopefully inspire you, including:

- Hanging with me in my studio in Nashville for two hours
- Lunch with me at one of Nashville's best restaurants  (I'll pick up the check)
- Attending the exclusive listening party for Frontiers on August 11th, where parts of the album were recorded.
- An hour-long one-on-one music lesson with me at my studio on piano, drums, guitar, or bass
- A 25-minute or 50-minute concert over FaceTime or Skype just for you
- An autographed vinyl copy of Frontiers
- Handwritten lyrics of two new songs from Frontiers

And lots more!  There are only a handful of these items and opportunities available, so get them before they're gone.

I have never been more excited to share what I do with people than this record and the message behind it.  I sincerely hope you'll join me on this journey.

Lots of love,

Dustin

story:
(HE DOESN'T KNOW THAT I AM DOING THIS) Hey good people, my name is Cami Robinson.  I am truly blessed to be married to one awesome man of God!  Reggie Robinson lives his life poured out.  Yes, he is the epitome of a true giver.  Whether his time,  gifts/talents, whatever he has; he is willing to share.  He is a Worshipper, loving husband, father, and mentor to countless middle school-aged kids and adults alike.  He works tirelessly to help every one that he possibly can.  

With that said, Reggie writes Christ centered Music that the world needs to hear y'all. It is his dream, and his purpose to share the love of Jesus globally.  Just being transparent, our current finances do not allow us to move forward with recording.  We need your help. If everyone gives $25 (It is not limited to this amount, we are truly grateful for any amount given), it will be enough to reserve studio time, musicians, and bgv's (back ground vocal artist).  Yes, there is still audio engineers and so forth, but I am trusting God with this.  He will provide.

What... no fancy editing? Its funny, I woke up with all of this on my heart.  Those of you who know me, you know that I am a video editor.  I didn't add a bunch of flair to this because its just not needed.  The video is raw, I am speaking directly from my heart.  I trust that God will do something great with little.  

Why is it a secret?  I know my husband.  He is a humble dude.  He would much rather be in the know and helping instead of asking for anything.  God placed this on my heart and I want to be obedient and go for it.  It has always been awe-inspiring to watch those that freely give when the act is reciprocated. The person is usually in a trance of overwhelming gratitude.  I can't wait to see this testimony unfold for him.  With this campaign, I pray that you will walk in faith/agreement with me by donating.  I will be sure to personally thank you.  And those that give $100+, expect a personal thank you, an autographed copy of the project, and an autographed copy of our book.  I realize this is huge, please try to keep it a secret.  I will be sure to update, and when I present it to him, I will go live/or post on all of our social media handles for you all to see.  SHHHH!

 

Thank you all in advance,

God bless you.

story:
The Scoop

My name is Kylie Fox. I'm a songwriter in Canada's East Coast. I am crowdfunding to support the recording and release of my debut, full length album. The compelling, introspective nature of my poetry, as well as my emphasis on Canadiana throughout my music, is reminiscent of Joni Mitchell and Alanis Morissette. The eleven tracks are thematically diverse, unpacking topics like teaching, climate change and motherhood, and confronting reality with humour and sincerity. 

I've been writing songs my entire life, but it wasn't until I was exposed to a group of peers keen on pushing each other to share and write music at Mount Allison University that I started writing every day. I began playing at the open mics held around the small town of Sackville when I wasn't practicing classical singing, (what I had originally enrolled in school to pursue). Soon enough, I dropped out of school to record a small compilation of songs called "BalconyEP".

Eventually, I returned to Mount Allison and graduated with a degree in Drama Studies and Music. There, I found an incredible band- we would rehearse in the music conservatory and tour during the weekends and Spring break. Since graduating, I've embarked on three tours that have allowed me to share my music all over the country. I am constantly improving as a musician and a writer and it is time to take the collection of songs I have worked hard to craft, and create quality recorded work representative of the artist I have become. 

When I am not touring or writing music, I am supply teaching or bartending at Moosehead Breweries.  I come from the small, sweet city of Saint John, New Brunswick, the type where you will recognize a familiar face every time you visit Tim Hortons.

 

Where the "Green" is going..

 

  • The producer and audio engineer at Farmhouse Studios in Nova Scotia. I spent a great deal of time researching studios and a team and am confident that my choice to collaborate with Dale Murray will grant my music the leverage it needs to advance my career and attract new listeners. 
  • The session players. Jordi Comstock and Jason Vautour are seasoned studio musicians, as reliable as they are creative and innovative. 
  • The mastering of the eleven tracks at Archive Mastering by J. Lapointe. 
  • The promotions and publicity of the project, involving a photographer, a graphic designer and a publicist.
  • The manufacturing of CDs and the pressing of vinyl.
  • The online release of the project which will allow the album to be streamed on platforms such as Spotify, Apple Music, Google Play and iTunes. 

 

The Result..

Apart from releasing updated work for my fans, the album also benefits me by granting opportunities that will advance my career and increase the possibilty that the development of my next album will be supported by an external agent. This album will grant me opportunities to export my music to new markets, to find myself on bigger stages with higher ticket sales, and allow me to participate in artist residencies that will help sharpen my creative process. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

A great way to demonstrate support is by sharing this campaign on social media, liking my content, sharing my music with your friends, and coming out to one of my shows!

Let's make some noise!

story:
Overview

Hi there

I’m Marcus Anderson, a contemporary jazz, R&B, and pop artist that has been recording for 14 year. I’ve released 12 albums as an independent which gave me the creative freedom to pursue whatever direction I felt. 

Earlier this year I started writing new music inspired by the many Marvel and DC movies released. My entire life I’ve always had an affinity for Superhero’s and Music. So, the past few years I’ve been toying with the idea of combining the two together not just for my amusement but to also inspire the younger generation of Creatives. The Creatives can include musicians, dancers, painters, or anyone with an imagination using this to express ones self.  The name of this album will be announced at a later date, but the Project will be released Summer of 2020. 

You may be asking yourself, why do I (an established artist) need to hold an Indiegogo fundraising campaign to make this album? Well, here are the three major benefits as I see it:

  1. The money raised here will go directly towards the making of this album and comic concept and video animation. Since I’m an indie, this is all out of pocket. It’s just me. What is raised will be poured directly back into the making and marketing of this project.
  2. The more we raise, the more money I’ll have to ‘get it out to the world and inspire the younger generation.’ My costs include (musician fees, mixing fee, mastering costs, studio rental recording fees, publicist, radio promotion, photo shoot, music videos, artwork design, printing, other marketing expenses, etc. which all add up to well over $15,000 and could go up to $25k+ depending on the amount spent on marketing).  
  3. Lastly, at the $25 level and up, I’m going to include an EXCLUSIVE BONUS TRACK that only YOU will get via digital download. This song will NOT be released to the public, ever! 

 

My goal is to raise $15,000 here on Indiegogo, however the net from that after Indiegogo and Credit Card fees plus fulfillment costs will be around $3,000 which will leave a remaining$12,000. Therefore, if we could raise more, that would be amazing! 

This is my 1st Indiegogo campaign

And if you are unable to contribute at this time, you can still help ‘spread the word’ via your social media (Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, etc.). Any mention would be sincerely appreciated!

If we Hit our Goal, I will take the first 300 copies of the Finished Album and Comic Book and give to a deserving Fine Arts Program in the US. I’m very excited about this new project and can’t wait to share it with you.

 

Let’s Be Creative, 

~Marcus

 

This is where WE can use YOUR help...

 

In order for me to pay for the rest of the ‘Project’ costs (I’ll break it down for you shortly), I really need your financial support to finish it. Our projections show an additional $15,000 is needed to complete everything (my goal here on Indiegogo is $15k which cover the rest of the cost of Studio Recording, Paying session Musicians, Producers, Graphics, Comic book Printing, Animated Video, mixing, mastering. Since I remain an independent artist, I simply don’t have the deep pockets of the major record labels to do projects like this.  Any and every dollar given will greatly be appreciated and used to the completion of this Project.

 

Here’s the breakdown of where the money raised is going:

• Mixing of the music.

• Mastering of the music.

* Comic Book Pressing and design cost.

* Video Animation Creation to match the Cartoon. (including the editor and post-production.)

• Artwork & Design (for both the Album and Comic Book and CD/Comic packaging).

• Manufacturing & Shipping cost.

•Marketing Expenses. 

*Musician studio cost.

*Producer cost.

• and more... 

 

This is all on top of what has already been done and paid for, including:

• Pre- Production for music.

* Studio Session Musician recording.

* Pre-Artwork and Characters design.

* Sample Printing for Comic.

* Pre-Video Animation.

 

As you see, this is a lot into completing a finished commercial release. Obviously, there is a lot more to it than just putting out another album. 

However, I’m up to the task and committed to making it great and inspiring the next generation of CREATIVES!

YOU can help contribute to this project via the many ‘Perks’ available to choose from. Starting at just $25 all the way up to $8,000 :)

And if you can't contribute monetarily, you can still help get the word out. Please tell your friends, family, and co-workers about this campaign and feel free to use the 'share' tools right here on the Indiegogo site. It would be so appreciated.

I sincerely thank you for any and all support and can’t wait to get this done.

 

Let’s Talk Perks:

  1. Thank You Listed in the Album+Video Credits: $100 (50)
  2. $10 Exclusive only track. (Not limited)
  3. Signed Two Disc Audio CD: $25 (sent to you two weeks before everyone else) (100 of these)
  4. Signed Two Disc Audio CD +Comic Book: $35 (sent to you before everyone else) (100 of these)
  5. Come sit in and witness the Studio Session in Action and lunch with Marcus: $750 (10 total) (in RTP, NC scheduled in November 2019. Travel and lodging not included). Autographed cd+comic book+listed in the scrolling credits+cd liner notes. Time for session (11am-6pm)
  6. Associate Producer studio session: $1500k (5 of them) (also includes studio session+new album+comic book. Studio session from 11am-5pm).
  7. Write a Song inspired and named for you and feature on the next album: $2500k. (2 of these)also includes studio session+new album+comic book. Studio session from 11am-5pm)..
  8. Record and make a special Video of your favorite love song. $750 (4) Must request by Dec. 1 for delivery by Feb. 1st. (includes album+comic book)
  9. Hang with Marcus for a Day and share my life career stories also my time touring with Prince, and much more!!! 11am-5pm with lunch included in the RTP, NC area (travel and lodging not included). ($1,000) (2 of these)(includes album+comic book)
  10. Two VIP Tickets to the MAJACE 2020 (includes Friday also explore Asheville, NC with Marcus. ($3,000) (2 tickets). They get wine service. Private Welcome dinner with Marcus Band and Select Artist (TBD) the Thursday before. Several events include wine and coffee service.)
  11. Be Written in the Comic Book as a guest. $1,000. (4 )(includes album+comic book)
  12. 2 Concert Tickets to a Marcus Anderson concert $75 (based on availability)
  13. Signed Marcus Anderson (12) CD’s, Vinyl, DVD and Tour Book Collection. $150 (10)(includes album+comic book)
  14. AND Coffee Bags Collection (10 bags Total) $150 (5)
  15. Play one round of Golf with Marcus in Asheville, NC during MAJACE week. $250 with lunch (3)(includes album+comic book)
  16. Private show for you and your Friends. ($8k) (Full Band) Based on schedule and availability (2 of these). (Airfare not included)(includes album+comic book;20 total)
  17. Private show for you and your Friends. ($4k) (Acoustic duo) Based on schedule and availability (2 of these)(includes album+comic book; 20 total)

The more we raise, the more money I’ll have to ‘get it out to the world and inspire the younger generation.’ My costs include (musician fees, mixing fee, mastering costs, studio rental recording fees, publicist, radio promotion, photo shoot, music videos, artwork design, printing, other marketing expenses, etc. which all add up to well over $15,000 and could go up to $25k+ depending on the amount spent on marketing).  
Lastly, at the $25 level and up, I’m going to include an EXCLUSIVE BONUS TRACK that only YOU will get via digital download. This song will NOT be released to the public, ever! 
 My goal is to raise $15,000 here on Indiegogo, however the net from that after Indiegogo and Credit Card fees plus fulfillment costs will be around $3,000 which will leave a remaining$12,000. Therefore, if we could raise more, that would be amazing! This is my 1st Indiegogo campaignAnd if you are unable to contribute at this time, you can still help ‘spread the word’ via your social media (Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, etc.). Any mention would be sincerely appreciated!If we Hit our Goal, I will take the first 300 copies of the Finished Album and Comic Book and give to a deserving Fine Arts Program in the US. I’m very excited about this new project and can’t wait to share it with you. Let’s Be Creative, ~Marcus This is where WE can use YOUR help... In order for me to pay for the rest of the ‘Project’ costs (I’ll break it down for you shortly), I really need your financial support to finish it. Our projections show an additional $15,000 is needed to complete everything (my goal here on Indiegogo is $15k which cover the rest of the cost of Studio Recording, Paying session Musicians, Producers, Graphics, Comic book Printing, Animated Video, mixing, mastering. Since I remain an independent artist, I simply don’t have the deep pockets of the major record labels to do projects like this.  Any and every dollar given will greatly be appreciated and used to the completion of this Project. Here’s the breakdown of where the money raised is going:• Mixing of the music.• Mastering of the music.* Comic Book Pressing and design cost.* Video Animation Creation to match the Cartoon. (including the editor and post-production.)• Artwork & Design (for both the Album and Comic Book and CD/Comic packaging).• Manufacturing & Shipping cost.•Marketing Expenses. *Musician studio cost.*Producer cost.• and more...  This is all on top of what has already been done and paid for, including:• Pre- Production for music.* Studio Session Musician recording.* Pre-Artwork and Characters design.* Sample Printing for Comic.* Pre-Video Animation. As you see, this is a lot into completing a finished commercial release. Obviously, there is a lot more to it than just putting out another album. However, I’m up to the task and committed to making it great and inspiring the next generation of CREATIVES!YOU can help contribute to this project via the many ‘Perks’ available to choose from. Starting at just $25 all the way up to $8,000 :)And if you can't contribute monetarily, you can still help get the word out. Please tell your friends, family, and co-workers about this campaign and feel free to use the 'share' tools right here on the Indiegogo site. It would be so appreciated.I sincerely thank you for any and all support and can’t wait to get this done. Let’s Talk Perks:
Thank You Listed in the Album+Video Credits: $100 (50)
$10 Exclusive only track. (Not limited)
Signed Two Disc Audio CD: $25 (sent to you two weeks before everyone else) (100 of these)
Signed Two Disc Audio CD +Comic Book: $35 (sent to you before everyone else) (100 of these)
Come sit in and witness the Studio Session in Action and lunch with Marcus: $750 (10 total) (in RTP, NC scheduled in November 2019. Travel and lodging not included). Autographed cd+comic book+listed in the scrolling credits+cd liner notes. Time for session (11am-6pm)
Associate Producer studio session: $1500k (5 of them) (also includes studio session+new album+comic book. Studio session from 11am-5pm).
Write a Song inspired and named for you and feature on the next album: $2500k. (2 of these)also includes studio session+new album+comic book. Studio session from 11am-5pm)..
Record and make a special Video of your favorite love song. $750 (4) Must request by Dec. 1 for delivery by Feb. 1st. (includes album+comic book)
Hang with Marcus for a Day and share my life career stories also my time touring with Prince, and much more!!! 11am-5pm with lunch included in the RTP, NC area (travel and lodging not included). ($1,000) (2 of these)(includes album+comic book)
Two VIP Tickets to the MAJACE 2020 (includes Friday also explore Asheville, NC with Marcus. ($3,000) (2 tickets). They get wine service. Private Welcome dinner with Marcus Band and Select Artist (TBD) the Thursday before. Several events include wine and coffee service.)
Be Written in the Comic Book as a guest. $1,000. (4 )(includes album+comic book)
2 Concert Tickets to a Marcus Anderson concert $75 (based on availability)
Signed Marcus Anderson (12) CD’s, Vinyl, DVD and Tour Book Collection. $150 (10)(includes album+comic book)
AND Coffee Bags Collection (10 bags Total) $150 (5)
Play one round of Golf with Marcus in Asheville, NC during MAJACE week. $250 with lunch (3)(includes album+comic book)
Private show for you and your Friends. ($8k) (Full Band) Based on schedule and availability (2 of these). (Airfare not included)(includes album+comic book;20 total)
Private show for you and your Friends. ($4k) (Acoustic duo) Based on schedule and availability (2 of these)(includes album+comic book; 20 total)

story:
Cette campagne de socio-financement a pour but la création de mon premier album (EP). Les fonds amassés m'aideront pour les différentes étapes de ce projet, et vos dons me seront d’une aide précieuse pour rendre ce projet réel et pour être en bénédiction pour la francophonie par le message que Dieu a déposé sur mon coeur. 

 

Je me présente : 

Je m’appelle Will Abriel et je suis fou de Dieu, passionné par la louange et passionné par les églises de la francophonie. Depuis ma conversion en 2010, je savais que la louange ferait partie de mon identité. Je me suis converti sur les chants de Luc Dumont et la louange est devenue une empreinte profonde sur mon coeur. Depuis 2011 j’ai composé des dizaines de chants et 9 ans plus tard je m’apprête à enfin partager ce que Dieu a mis sur mon coeur. Voici le chemin par lequel Dieu m ‘a permis de passé jusqu’à ce projet aujourd’hui. 

 

J’ai commencé à m’impliquer dans le service de louange en 2011 dans une église à  Reims, c’est là que tout a commencé. Je suis devenu leader de Louange en 2012. En 2015 je me suis marié avec ma merveilleuse femme : Déborah ! Nous avons quitté la ville de Reims pour aller à Tours où j’ai pu perfectionner mon ministère auprès de supers leaders (mention spécial à Mickaël Adèle qui a juste renforcé ma passion envers Dieu et le ministère). 

En 2017, nous avons quitté la France pour le Québec (Canada), pourquoi ? J’ai entamé une formation biblique sur 3 ans à l’institut de théologie pour la francophonie. J’ai, par la même occasion, rejoint l’église Nouvelle Vie sous la direction de Pasteur Claude Houde, où je sers activement jusqu’à aujourd’hui.

J’ai pu encore une fois acquérir de l’expérience dans le leadership, je fais parti de l’équipe des leaders de louange:  j’assiste Mylen Query (Responsable du département Louange) et Sandra Kouame (Pasteur louange Impact jeunesse) dans le développement de ces différents départements liés à la louange.  

 

Pourquoi Un album EP ?

1- Comme je le disais plus tôt, lors de ma conversion j’ai eu cette conviction qu’un jour je sortirai des projets pour les églises. Je ne savais ni comment et ni pourquoi mais cette promesse était gravée sur mon coeur. Aujourd’hui je comprend pourquoi et je vois la main de Dieu sur mon parcours. Je suis plus que convaincu que c’est le temps de partager ce qui a été semé dans mon coeur. 

2- Dans nos Eglises, nous sommes en manque de compositions françaises. Je voudrais par cet album, ajouter ma voix et agrémenter le répertoire de la louange francophone. 

3 - Libérer un son, une louange authentique et une louange collective. Sans prétention et avec humilité, je crois que Dieu a déposé des mots et des chants spécifiques qui pourront toucher les âmes et les coeurs de ceux qui aspirent à une louange profonde et sincère. 

4- Cet album sera un outil afin de pouvoir visiter les églises, les encourager et former des musiciens et leaders de louange dans les églises qui ont des besoins et qui veulent développer leur ministère d’adoration. 

 

Mon Projet : 

Tout d'abord un "EP" est en fait un album, contenant moins de titres. Me concernant, il se nommera « Te Servir », et contiendra 6 titres différents. Ces titres seront congrégationnels et actuels. 

Ces chants parleront de plusieurs sujets importants dans l’Église et pour la vie du chrétien (Saint- Esprit, guérison, consécration et adoration) et aideront à connecter plus facilement au coeur de Dieu qui mérite la première place. 

Je suis très reconnaissant et vous remercie pour chaque support et pour votre soutien durant cette campagne. 


Vos dons serviront surtout :

Au mixage et mastering

Arrangement et Réalisation artistique 

Duplication et impression

Et toute la réalisation de mon album

Pour contribuer et m'aider dans ce projet, cliquez simplement sur le bouton "SOUTENEZ CE PROJET" (en haut à droite) et indiquez le montant de votre choix.

Merci pour tout

J'ai vraiment hâte de pouvoir vous faire découvrir cet album, et je prie que ces chants puissent vous bénir et vous permettre de vivre des temps avec Dieu, dans sa présence. 
Merci encore pour vos dons et n'hésitez pas à  partager les publications en lien avec ma campagne.

En parler autour de vous

story:
Short Summary

Hey everyone! MilaDawn here! I'm starting this campaign because a lot of you always ask when I'm headed to your city. Well, here's your chance to help me get to you! A lot of you know me as a comedic content creator, but music is my first passion and I want to share it with everyone I can. I have great support from all over the U.S for what I love to do, and I'm ready to branch out to some of the surrounding states to put on an amazing show for you. 

What I Need & What You Get

Music is a BIG part of Who I Am. It's what I love to do and it's incredibly gratifying to be able to do what you love everyday. That being said it can also be extremely difficult to support yourself on music alone. But that doesn't stop me from pouring my blood, sweat and tears into what I love to do. With your generous contributions and support, I will be able to take my dreams to the road, bringing me one step closer to turning these lifelong dreams into a reality. 

Your contributions will provide me with safe places to sleep, rehearsals, dancers, band, venue costs, airline and or bus fare, security and FOOD! I can't forget that :) This is hundreds of hours of work, and I certainly want the entire team to be paid for their time, talents, and dedication. 

I plan on bringing a couple other people along that are comedians so it's all types of entertainment. Also, each city will have a different special guest comedian join for the show to be apart of this crazy ride.

That being said, I don't expect you to give something for nothing so I am giving back just the same. In return for helping me I have some great perks that I'm sure you'll enjoy!

I'm hoping and praying that I reach my goal of $25,000 but in the event that the numbers fall short (heaven forbid) all contributions will still go towards the same travel expenses and MORE MUSIC. Every little bit goes a long way and the giving is a two-way street. Consider your gift not as a hand out but as a Hand Up! 

States I'm Considering But Not Limited To:

California (San Diego, LA, the Bay)*Georgia (ATL)*New York*North Carolina*Pennsylvania*Virginia*Washington D.C*Texas (Dallas or Houston)* Florida*Ohio* 

Other Ways You Can Help

No worries if you're in no position to help financially - there is a lot you can still do to help! Share my campaign on social media! Instagram, Facebook, anywhere you scroll. Stream my music, share with your friends. Your support means the world.

story:
Oogee Wawa Back In The Studio For New LP

Oogee Wawa is an Alternative Reggae, HipHop band based out of Long Island, NY. We have been apart of the east coast reggae touring circuit for 6 years playing over 200 shows each year around the country. After parting ways with long time members at the start of 2018 we took that year to rebuild and refine ourselves with new talent, and it is awesome. 

We are starting a crowd funding campaign to help raise the necessary funds to complete our biggest studio album yet. We are extremely excited to be working with Mike Watts, owner of Vudu Studios (Glassjaw, The Dillinger Escape Plan, etc). We are really focused on bringing the good vibes of Oogee Wawa to the next level with a dynamic studio album that our fans deserve. The past year was a real struggle and test of our strength but with the outpouring of love and support from our ever-growing fan base we were able to re-build and get back to doing what we love and do best and that is create feel good music with a positive message. 

With all the changes in technology and how that has effected the industry it has become difficult to fund studio work without a major backer. We in Oogee Wawa has prided ourselves in doing everything in house with the help of friends and likeminded individuals who have the same common goal of spreading positive, conscience music. The take over of "stream based" music services have left us artists with stacks of CD's and empty wallets and no way to fund the next project. This is where your generosity and contributions come into play. 

 

We have set a goal of 10K to finish tracking, mixing, producing and mastering our next full length album. We have put together some pretty cool perks for your contribution ranging from Merch packs to Spending the day in the studio with the band. 

Any overage will be used for increased marketing in an attempt to reach a wider base of music lovers and aid in the inevitable album release tour. 

 

We can't thank you all enough for the years of support and encouragement. Any contribution is very much appreciated as this will greatly help in moving forward on this dream chasing journey. We understand that times are tough for all and if you can not contribute with currency a simple SHARE on social media would be equally as helpful. 

"Be kind to one another and do great things"

story:
‘THE DEEP END’ DEBUT ALBUM by JOSEPH MOORE! 

Family & friends! I'm going into the studio to record my full length debut album! It will be a collection of 11 original songs called 'The Deep End'. I've spent the last several years writing & collaborating with some amazing writers and producers & I can't wait for you to hear them!

The album is based on personal experiences that have catapulted me into ‘The Deep End’ of life. As you listen, I hope you will find lyrics, melodies, and production elements that resonate within & move you. 

‘THE DEEP END’ COST BREAKDOWN:

Recording a full length, professional quality album as an independent artist, and without a label's backing, is expensive. So, I've decided to do a crowd-funding campaign through INDIEGOGO where people can pre-order the album & receive other perks to help fund the record. The budget for this project is $35,000.00. This includes:

-The cost for each song (which is roughly $2500 per song). Recording a song involves session musicians & instrumentalists, session backup vocalists, producers & arrangers, audio engineers & mixing and mastering engineers, etc. -- all of whom need to be paid for their time and talents. This also includes paying for studio time.

-Album photography, cover art & graphics.

-Marketing & branding.

-Physical CD printing & distribution.

-Travel costs to the studio in Massachusetts.

-INDIEGOGO service fee (INDIEGOGO takes a cut from the overall amount).

RECORDING:

I will start recording in July 2020 (NEXT MONTH). Recording will be split between Ghost Hit Recording Studios in Massachusetts (https://www.ghosthitrecording.com/) & Soularium Studios in Utah (https://www.soulariumstudios.com/). I am fortunate to record in these studios which have recorded Grammy Award-winning & world-renowned recording artists such as Anderson Paak., Josh Dun of Twenty One Pilots, Taylor & Griffin Goldsmith of Dawes, Nigel Hall of Lettuce, Watsky, GARTH., David Archuleta, The Piano Guys, Lexi Walker, Afika, Alex Sharpe of Celtic Women, Gentri & Madilyn Paige. 

ALBUM PRE-ORDER & PERKS:

Whatever you contribute, you will be pre-ordering & receive a digital copy of the album. If you’d like to contribute more, there are other perks you can check out. These include:

-Signed Physical CD

-Exclusive Unreleased Bonus Track

-Tickets to the release show

-Special mention in album notes

-Behind The Scenes footage & updates of album recording process

-Online Voice Lessons

-Homemade Mac & Cheese Dinner (made by yours truly) & a private concert. (for Utah residents only).

-House Show (for you and 50 of your friends & family)

-Online Show 

-Be credited as a Co-Executive Producer for sponsoring half of a song

-Be credited as an Executive Producer for sponsoring an entire song for as many songs as you'd like.

WHAT IF I CAN'T CONTRIBUTE OR PRE-ORDER THE ALBUM RIGHT NOW? WHAT ELSE CAN I DO TO HELP?

Aside from funds, contributions come in many forms! If you're unable to pledge at this time, please consider these other ways you can spread the word or support my music:

*Share this campaign on your Instagram, Facebook or other social media channels! (Make sure to use the INDIEGOGO share tools!)

*Follow me on Instagram at @JosephMooreMusic & tag me when sharing the campaign.

*Follow me on Facebook here: https://www.facebook.com/josephdavismoore & tag me when sharing the campaign.

*Follow me on Spotify! Go to my profile and click the ‘FOLLOW’ button right next to the ‘Play’ button. Here’s a link to my Spotify page: https://open.spotify.com/artist/28KifjpxcjmLG8A...

*Add my current singles to your playlists on Spotify or Apple Music!

MUCH LOVE & GRATITUDE!

Thank you so much for being a part of my life & my musical journey. It means the world and I can't thank you enough in advance for pre-ordering & helping to fund my debut album! WE CAN'T DO THIS WITHOUT YOUR HELP! Much love!

I am fortunate to record in these studios which have recorded Grammy Award-winning & world-renowned recording artists such as Anderson Paak., Josh Dun of Twenty One Pilots, Taylor & Griffin Goldsmith of Dawes, Nigel Hall of Lettuce, Watsky, GARTH., David Archuleta, The Piano Guys, Lexi Walker, Afika, Alex Sharpe of Celtic Women, Gentri & Madilyn Paige. ALBUM PRE-ORDER & PERKS:Whatever you contribute, you will be pre-ordering & receive a digital copy of the album. If you’d like to contribute more, there are other perks you can check out. These include:-Signed Physical CD-Exclusive Unreleased Bonus Track-Tickets to the release show-Special mention in album notes-Behind The Scenes footage & updates of album recording process-Online Voice Lessons-Homemade Mac & Cheese Dinner (made by yours truly) & a private concert. (for Utah residents only).-House Show (for you and 50 of your friends & family)-Online Show -Be credited as a Co-Executive Producer for sponsoring half of a song-Be credited as an Executive Producer for sponsoring an entire song for as many songs as you'd like.WHAT IF I CAN'T CONTRIBUTE OR PRE-ORDER THE ALBUM RIGHT NOW? WHAT ELSE CAN I DO TO HELP?Aside from funds, contributions come in many forms! If you're unable to pledge at this time, please consider these other ways you can spread the word or support my music:*Share this campaign on your Instagram, Facebook or other social media channels! (Make sure to use the INDIEGOGO share tools!)*Follow me on Instagram at @JosephMooreMusic & tag me when sharing the campaign.*Follow me on Facebook here: https://www.facebook.com/josephdavismoore & tag me when sharing the campaign.*Follow me on Spotify! Go to my profile and click the ‘FOLLOW’ button right next to the ‘Play’ button. Here’s a link to my Spotify page: https://open.spotify.com/artist/28KifjpxcjmLG8A...*Add my current singles to your playlists on Spotify or Apple Music!MUCH LOVE & GRATITUDE!Thank you so much for being a part of my life & my musical journey. It means the world and I can't thank you enough in advance for pre-ordering & helping to fund my debut album! WE CAN'T DO THIS WITHOUT YOUR HELP! Much love!

story:
ABOUT BUSK IT

Hi! My name is Mina Alali. You may know me from my music - I’m a pop singer/songwriter, and music producer. Being an artist, I know the struggle of trying to make money from music, which is why I’m creating a revolutionary app that will digitalize the concept of busking, when a street musician or an artist plays for money. The app is called Busk-It, and it will launch in Fall 2020.

Here’s how it works: any artist or musician is able to live-stream to music lovers across the world. It’s just like busking on the street, but now online, accessible anytime and anywhere, whether it’s from home, at a practice session, or even during a public performance.  These are exclusive performances only available on the app.

For music lovers, this is truly live music at your fingertips. You’ll be able to choose your favorite genres of music, and artists performing those genres will show up on your app. If you become a fan of an artist and you like their music, you can support them through donations.  They need your help to be known and thrive.

For every musician who becomes discovered and is able to make a living, there are thousands of equally talented musicians who go unnoticed. By using Busk It, your dollar goes towards these musicians, and their ability to continue doing what they love. You are contributing towards a new and easy way for artists to reach global audiences and generate income. 

Busk It is an application, created by an artist and musician, for artists and musicians. 

WHY I NEED YOUR HELP

But, I need your help. The costs to make this app as smooth, polished, and ready for independent artists as possible, requires a lot of time, commitment, and decent funding. I (Mina) was able to work enough to fund the development of the app for iOS ($11,500), but of course there are many Android users who would benefit from using this app as well. 

This is why I’m asking you to help me fund the costs to develop and launch the app for Android users and to cover the legal costs to ensure a successful start for the company, that will in turn that benefit both music lovers and music makers. If you are able to donate, here are the tiers of incentives! *Every tier includes the reward below, as well.*

$25: Bumper/Laptop Sticker: “I Was a Mini Angel Investor for Busk It”

$50: Personalized Thank You Note from CEO

$100: Busk It T-Shirt

$300: Lifetime Recognition on Busk It Website as an Angel Investor

$500: Early Access to app before official launch (first dibs on account names, etc!)

$1,000: Invite to Official App Launch Party in Northern CA (Date TBD)

 

(Example: Donate $300 and receive:

1) Lifetime Recognition on Busk It’s Website as Angel Investor

2) Busk It T-Shirt

3) Personalized Thank You Note from CEO, and

4) Bumper/Laptop Sticker: “I Was a Mini Angel Investor for Busk It”)

 

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this. If you wish to learn more and/or be among the first to know when Busk It launches, follow us @officialbuskit on Instagram and/or submit your email to the mailing list on officialbuskit.com. Thank you again, and stay safe.

story:
We are raising funds for SONGS OF LOVE & DEATH - to make and promote an album of traditional songs - Reg Meuross with Harbottle & Jonas 


Songs of Love & Death is the new collaborative album from two of this country’s finest and most engaging folk/acoustic acts: Reg Meuross and Harbottle & Jonas

Born from a remote collaboration for Harbottle & Jones’s highly successful (400,000 views and counting!) #savingthegoodstuff video series, Songs of Love & Death has now evolved into a stark yet beautiful album of traditional songs.

Described as “a mighty songwriter” by Martin Carthy, Reg Meuross has been a constant presence in the nation’s folk clubs and venues throughout his thirty-year career. 

With thirteen solo albums to his name, songs such as ‘England Green & England Grey’ and ‘And Jesus Wept’ have entered the modern folk canon, but, until now, he has never delved into the traditional songs that have so influenced his writing.

“Over the years I have played with some of the finest folk musicians in Britain. Karen Tweed, Phil Beer, Jackie Oates, Martin Carthy etc yet I had never considered doing an album of traditional songs before, but during lockdown I began to look more closely at the songs of these islands, songs that were ever-present at clubs where I played” Reg explains.

“Songs I knew in my breath and my blood like they were in my DNA. Although these songs inhabited me, I realised I’d never inhabited them and I took the chance to explore, eventually settling on ten songs, and the idea of recording an album started to form in my mind.

When I got the call from Harbottle & Jonas asking if I was interested in a collaboration, my first thought was one of my favourite folk songs, Lord Franklin, which I’d loved since hearing John Renbourn’s version when I was 15 or so and first learning to play guitar. I loved what we did together so much that we decided to continue work on all ten songs.” 

Harbottle & Jonas, husband and wife duo David and Freya, are “one of the finest folk duos in the country” according to Folking.com, and have made an impressive mark on the UK’s folk and roots scene in a short period of time.  Their most recent album The Beacon was written and recorded (as a trio album with fiddle player Annie Baylis) at home during the summer of 2020 and heralded as “magnificent” by Folkradio.co.uk. They have made appearances at the legendary Sidmouth Folk Week, were chosen to take part in Global Music Match 2020 by English Folk Expo, and were invited to participate in the 2020 Folk Alliance International Showcase.

Matching Reg’s talent for conveying the true meaning behind a song in his delivery, with David and Freya’s exceptional arrangement and accompaniment skills, Songs of Love & Death tackles some of the most enduring songs from the English tradition, beautifully recorded by Josh Best-Shaw in a 15th Century church that sits on the edge of Dartmoor.

David, Freya, and Reg are so proud of these recordings, and with your help they believe they can release something wonderful and special that will make a mark in the folk landscape that is truly lasting.

The songs:
She Moved Through The Fair
Barbary Allen
Lord Randall
Lord Frankin
Oxford Girl
As I Roved Out
I Wish The Wars Were All Over 
Adieu Sweet Lovely Nancy
Anachie Gordon
The Trees They Do Grow High 

photos: Rachel Snowdon, cover art Joey Meuross

 

HOW YOU CAN HELP

Recording, mixing, and mastering; artwork design; CD manufacturing; promotional campaigns; photoshoots; there are many costs involved in producing an album and we are asking for your help.

We are part way through the recordings and they sound superb. We need your help raising funds to pay for all the expenses.

We will be offering pre-order links in a while but  initially are asking if you would like to:

- Book a trio concert or house concert (which will feature solo and trio sets)

- Buy a trio song commission or an arrangement of a traditional song of your choice (outside the album)

- Make a kind donation and receive a personal thank you card and signed lyric of your choice from Reg, Freya and David

- See your name in the album credits under, ‘thank yous’

If you can't contribute, we 'd be grateful if you would help us by sharing this campaign.

Thank you 

Reg, David and Freya

story:
Summary

Do you like Classic Rock, Blues, and Soul music? For years now, people of all ages have been saying to me, "There's no more good music, like back in the day". Well there is new music that you would like, but it's hard to find. If you got past the first sentence, then I think you'll like the new music that I'm going to record.

Much of the old music that a lot of us like  was recorded in Muscle Shoals Alabama, and we're going back there. We've enlisted some of the original Muscle Shoals musicians to record a new "Modern Electric Blues" album, and the sound will be familiar, like an old friend. 

***Before I go any further, I'd like to mention that some people want to be a part of helping to create some new good music, but want to tailor their own "Perk". Just click the red "Back it" button. You can put in any amount and email me at tony@tonysarno.com with what you would like to receive.

 

Legendary keyboard man Clayton Ivey and his awesome rhythm section; bass player and original "Swamper" David Hood, and drummer Ed Green will help me create a new classic "Muscle Shoals" album. We'll be recording at East Avalon studios with Mark Maynard producing. Mark produced my first blues album "It's a Blues Thing", which we recorded in Memphis, and this one will be called "It's a Blues Thing Too" (Muscle Shoals Edition).

Thank for letting me create some new music for you, and I know that you'll enjoy it!  Tony 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

For those not familiar with my music, here are some excerpts of reviews of my last blues album:

"He sings with a searing intensity that recalls the early bluesmasters and plays with a terse urgency that invite comparisons to Albert King and 60's Clapton. "Crybaby blues" is an instant classic that makes you wonder just when the hell Stevie Ray Vaughan jammed with Steve Marriott"

-VIC GARBARINI, MUSICIAN MAGAZINE

"If the mainstream is presently in the market for its next straight-blues act (à la Stevie Ray Vaughan, Robert Cray etc.) don't be surprised if it turns out to be a Tony Sarno Thing". 

-RICHARD JOHN CUMMINS- BLUES REVUE MAGAZINE

"One serious barnburner is It's a Blues Thing by Tony Sarno and the Screamin' Blue Demons. Music this good comes in a strong third-just behind bikes and babes- on the list of things that make life worth living". 

-EASYRIDERS MAGAZINE

"Sarno is a flame-throwing guitarist whose chosen weapon of destruction is a Fender Telecaster". It is with this weapon that he wreaks havoc throughout this disc. He does this without coming off as the next guitar god Stevie Ray Vaughan imitator and displays a firm command of blues guitar.

RIT SHERIDAN- THE BLUES HOUND

"From the first day we played it, listener response has been amazing. Tony Sarno's "It's a blues thing" has become a staple at IQ Radio". 

-CHUCK WALLACE- WWIQ, MACON,GA

"The closer, "Screamin' blues demon (It's a blues thing)" provides one last opportunity for Sarno to let loose with some of the most emotionally volatile, electrifying fretwork ever committed to tape. The hairs on my neck practically stand on end every time I hear this cut." It's one CD you must hear, he's the samurai warrior of blues guitar. 

-BOB CIANCI- THE RIVER REPORTER

 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Some excerpts from my older recordings:

 

 You may have seen the Netflix documentary "Muscle  Shoals". The Rolling Stones' "Brown Sugar" and "Wild Horses", The Staple Singers' "I'll Take You There" and "Respect Yourself", Wilson Pickett's "Mustang Sally", and "Funky Broadway", Percy Sledge's "When a Man Loves a Woman", Bob Seger's "Old Time Rock and Roll" and "Main Street", Boz  Scaggs' "Dinah Flo", Clarence Carter's "Patches" and so many other great records were cut there with the great session musicians, engineers, and studios in the area. They achieved  a "sound" and a definite "vibe" that translated to many hit records. There were great Blues records cut there too, by artists like Otis Rush, Little Milton, and Bobby "Blue" Bland.

Thanks so much for your consideration in being a part of this project and I can't wait for you to hear the finished product. Thanks for coming along!            

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We're going to raise $24,700, which will allow us to rent the studios, pay the musicians and engineers, pay for the cds, t-shirts and other perks, and pay to fulfill the orders. If we exceed our goal, we will have the resources to promote the new music to other blues-lovers and if there's enough, we can press a run of LPs if there's any interest. (we will also be asking for suggestions of new products).  
  • Besides the perks listed, we will be posting exclusive pictures and video clips to a special page for backers, on www.tonysarno.com, for you to see as we go.
  • If we don't reach our goal, we will still put out a great product, but we will have to record fewer songs.
 
Besides the digital download and new cd, here's what else you can get;
 
My catalog cds.
 

.........the "Blues Thing" T-Shirt:

 

.....the "Blues Thing" T-shirt (That's The Rolling Stones' Chuck Leavell with Bob Levite)

 

 

.....and you can get this one in Navy blue too, just let us know: 

..

 

This is the guitar that I played on Felix Cavaliere's 2015 Christmas Tour (He didn't like Teles!) 

 

.... and for a few super-contributors:

Below is my Robinson Custom Telecaster. Brian Robinson was a corporate lawyer for many years, and despite his heavy workload for the firm, he did a lot of Pro Bono work for the underprivileged. Feeling that he wanted to serve our country after the horrendous attack on 9/11/01, Brian joined the Coast Guard, and ended up at the State Department in Washington. He really liked my music, and he had built me a custom guitar back in 1997, which I used as a spare for many years, since my main guitar was a 1968 Fender Telecaster. After my Fender was stolen, I decided to play my Brian Robinson Telecaster exclusively in his honor, as he tragically passed away in 2015. It’s a wonderful instrument built by a really great guy, and I’m proud to be playing it. As an amazing perk, I'm offering brand new guitars built exactly like this mine, to four very generous contributors.  

 

 

 

We've got two last giant Perks which will really help us get to, and surpass our goal. The first is the "Angel Sponsor" which will let two lucky people attend a day of our sessions in Muscle Shoals. You'll get to hang out with "The Cats" and see how it all works.

The second is the "Musician's Angel". Since us musicians make the majority of our income playing live, it's been very hard this year. Myself and my fellow musicians have been extremely limited in our ability to work, so I've added a perk which will do a little to make up for that. We'll bring the large band to your house, or any venue you want, and you'll have an awesome concert or party.  Scare up a bunch of your friends and have a "House Concert" at your place. Your guests will be thrilled to have "world-class" musicians come to their neighborhood to perform an intimate concert or dance-party just for them! We'll be sure to bring lot of cds and t-shirts to give to your guests. 

 

...Tony and Clayton Ivey in front of Clayton's old "Wishbone" studios in Muscle Shoals June '20

 

 

...my view from the producer's chair on the Rusty Gear sessions at Blackbird Studios, Nashville, August '20. Ed Greene on drums (he's played on everything, Barry White, Hall & Oates,Steely Dan)

..and to my right is the legendary David Hood (he played bass on "I'll take you there" drop the mic)

  

 

 

 

 

 

 


 

Risks & Challenges

  As I've produced numerous records for myself and other artists, I know how to do it; from pre-production, through mastering and pressing. I know that having the right musicians is paramount to getting things done efficiently, and that the Muscle Shoals musicians lead by Clayton Ivey are the epitome of professional. I've booked the studio and the band for December 19th through the 23rd. In between the dates, I will get the basic tracks and horn charts to the horn section for overdubs. We'll have a few days to do final tweaks, then mastering and pressing.  Artwork is already in the works with my old friend Dennis Hermanson, who has done designs and flyers for me since the beginning, and I've spoken with vendors for the t-shirts and my catalog cds, and everything is readily available.  I'll be sending you the advance digital download and .pdf liner notes, by wetransfer.com, where you'll download it from your email, the minute we have finished the project. The cds and t-shirts will go out the week of January 18 (If you want the "Holiday Gift Package", I'll send out the catalog cds and T-shirts so that you have them in time for Christmas gifts). You will be able to stream the new record on Spotify, Apple Music, and all other digital services starting on or near the release date of February 9th.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Money isn't the only contribution you can offer. It is really important to get the word out and let like-minded blues people know about this campaign. I could really use some blues ambassadors around the world to let their friends and family know about our campaign. You can use the Indiegogo share tools to do this. Thanks!

If we exceed our goal, we will have the resources to promote the new music to other blues-lovers and if there's enough, we can press a run of LPs if there's any interest. (we will also be asking for suggestions of new products).  
Besides the perks listed, we will be posting exclusive pictures and video clips to a special page for backers, on www.tonysarno.com, for you to see as we go.
If we don't reach our goal, we will still put out a great product, but we will have to record fewer songs.


 
Besides the digital download and new cd, here's what else you can get;
 
My catalog cds.




 
.........the "Blues Thing" T-Shirt:


 
.....the "Blues Thing" T-shirt (That's The Rolling Stones' Chuck Leavell with Bob Levite)

 
 
.....and you can get this one in Navy blue too, just let us know: 

..
 
This is the guitar that I played on Felix Cavaliere's 2015 Christmas Tour (He didn't like Teles!) 

 
.... and for a few super-contributors:
Below is my Robinson Custom Telecaster. Brian Robinson was a corporate lawyer for many years, and despite his heavy workload for the firm, he did a lot of Pro Bono work for the underprivileged. Feeling that he wanted to serve our country after the horrendous attack on 9/11/01, Brian joined the Coast Guard, and ended up at the State Department in Washington. He really liked my music, and he had built me a custom guitar back in 1997, which I used as a spare for many years, since my main guitar was a 1968 Fender Telecaster. After my Fender was stolen, I decided to play my Brian Robinson Telecaster exclusively in his honor, as he tragically passed away in 2015. It’s a wonderful instrument built by a really great guy, and I’m proud to be playing it. As an amazing perk, I'm offering brand new guitars built exactly like this mine, to four very generous contributors.  
 


 

 
We've got two last giant Perks which will really help us get to, and surpass our goal. The first is the "Angel Sponsor" which will let two lucky people attend a day of our sessions in Muscle Shoals. You'll get to hang out with "The Cats" and see how it all works.
The second is the "Musician's Angel". Since us musicians make the majority of our income playing live, it's been very hard this year. Myself and my fellow musicians have been extremely limited in our ability to work, so I've added a perk which will do a little to make up for that. We'll bring the large band to your house, or any venue you want, and you'll have an awesome concert or party.  Scare up a bunch of your friends and have a "House Concert" at your place. Your guests will be thrilled to have "world-class" musicians come to their neighborhood to perform an intimate concert or dance-party just for them! We'll be sure to bring lot of cds and t-shirts to give to your guests. 
 
...Tony and Clayton Ivey in front of Clayton's old "Wishbone" studios in Muscle Shoals June '20


 
 
...my view from the producer's chair on the Rusty Gear sessions at Blackbird Studios, Nashville, August '20. Ed Greene on drums (he's played on everything, Barry White, Hall & Oates,Steely Dan)

..and to my right is the legendary David Hood (he played bass on "I'll take you there" drop the mic)
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Risks & Challenges
  As I've produced numerous records for myself and other artists, I know how to do it; from pre-production, through mastering and pressing. I know that having the right musicians is paramount to getting things done efficiently, and that the Muscle Shoals musicians lead by Clayton Ivey are the epitome of professional. I've booked the studio and the band for December 19th through the 23rd. In between the dates, I will get the basic tracks and horn charts to the horn section for overdubs. We'll have a few days to do final tweaks, then mastering and pressing.  Artwork is already in the works with my old friend Dennis Hermanson, who has done designs and flyers for me since the beginning, and I've spoken with vendors for the t-shirts and my catalog cds, and everything is readily available.  I'll be sending you the advance digital download and .pdf liner notes, by wetransfer.com, where you'll download it from your email, the minute we have finished the project. The cds and t-shirts will go out the week of January 18 (If you want the "Holiday Gift Package", I'll send out the catalog cds and T-shirts so that you have them in time for Christmas gifts). You will be able to stream the new record on Spotify, Apple Music, and all other digital services starting on or near the release date of February 9th.
 

 
Other Ways You Can Help
Money isn't the only contribution you can offer. It is really important to get the word out and let like-minded blues people know about this campaign. I could really use some blues ambassadors around the world to let their friends and family know about our campaign. You can use the Indiegogo share tools to do this. Thanks!

story:
The Promise ~ an Ebenezer Special Project

A heart to worship and a desire to pray into the return of HIS people to the Land of Israel -Aliyah is something important to us all. 

Recently a group of young adults have come together with this same heart and desire. 
Out of this they have felt to produce a compilation album of worship songs which has a focus on what God is doing through the fulfilment of His word, specifically relating to the Aliyah of the Jewish people in these days.

We want to make this project readily available to the Ebenezer network Internationally and also the wider public, creating worship which can be combined with intercession and prayer, taken into prayer groups and used to bring an atmosphere of worship and honour to God in all the nations.

Back to where it all began....

In 2018, there was an Ebenezer conference in Jerusalem Israel, the theme was "A Time to Favour Zion". During the conference, some of the worship team spontaneously gathered and recorded (somewhat unintentionally) a song called Time to Favour Zion, which had been written as a prayer/worship song for the conference that year. 

Some months later, this song was put with instrumental backing, and released. The response was overwhelmingly positive, and people wrote in commenting on its impact, saying how it brought focus as they were in a prayer meeting wanting to focus on Aliyah. (You can view it here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R2fXuUo5a7g) 

It was out of this place that we felt the calling to create more along these lines. 

The Financial side

Each song on the album "The Promise" has been donated by the artist to the CD. Songs have been written by young adults, Ebenezer prayer partners and supporters around the world. The album cover and design are also donated.

We hope to record the album by the end of 2020 (if travel is permitted), and all personal travel costs and accommodation will be covered by the individual artist. It was important to the team behind this project that it is publicly known that there is no financial gain on a personal level to any member. ALL PROCEEDS/PROFIT made from the CD will go directly to supporting the ministry of Ebenezer Operation Exodus. 

So why are we fundraising? 

Initial upfront costs for this kind of project are significant, and not all things can be donated. The cost of hiring a recording studio, mixing and mastering the songs for both CD and digital release, as well as printing the CDs. The team has specifically not asked for any funds from those already donated to the ministry of Ebenezer.

A few individuals heard about the project and stepped forward with offers of support, and it was decided by Ebenezer leadership to create a special project to fundraise directly for this Album - so here we are!
We have set a funding goal based on conservative estimated upfront costs of recording, including things like

  • Recording Studio hire
  • Mixing/mastering of songs
  • Printing of CD's for sale

The Impact of your Gift

**please note, although listed in GBP, this site is international and all currencies accepted with a small credit card fee**
Your gift will enable this project to move forward. Not only that but a large component of the heart behind this project is to see worship and prayer combine and increase in the nations of the world for what the Lord is doing in His people in these days.

Join with us by being a part of The Promise Project 2020!

We are making every effort possible to minimise the costs of production, and the quicker we are able to cover these costs, the sooner we see profit and therefore funds donated to Aliyah!

 

So how can I help? 

It's not just about donating! Tell your friends & family, share this on Social media channels, and talk it up! Word of mouth is a powerful tool!!

story:
Picking up where Songs One Through Twelve left off, Checkpoint Charley's Pomp, Twaddle, and Bombast (Songs Thirteen through Twenty Four) promises to be a Power Pop tour-de-force full of classic hooks and epic production. 

Recorded in Nashville, Chicago, and Salt Lake City, the album's 12 tracks will feature performances from Jon Schmidt (The Piano Guys,) Ian Fowles (The Aquabats, Gerard Way,) Jim Riley (Rascal Flatts,) a who's-who cast of Music City's finest musicians, and the Mixing and Co-Production talents of Jay Tooke (The Steel Woods.) 

s

Our Indiegogo funding goal covers the cost of mixing, production, and replication of the album on Vinyl and CD.

Backers can choose from a host of custom-crafted Perks; including physical Vinyl and CD-editions of the album, seats on our Record Company board, the commission of a personally-penned Checkpoint Charley song, and personal concert performances.

As a BONUS, if we can exceed our goal by 20%, we will re-record all four of our Star Wars Pop songs and include a personal CD of them in each gifting mix.

We’re not promising you the moon, just a soundtrack you can listen to knowing you helped inject some life’s blood into the pop music lexicon!!  Pick up the baton, go march out on your lawn, or the Parade might just pass you by!

Check us out at:

www.facebook.com/checkpointcharleyrocks

www.checkpointcharley.rocks

story:
Short Summary

Canticum

kan-ti-kuhm]noun,plural cantica  /ˈkæn tɪ kə/

Much of what we try to accomplish as instrumentalists is to achieve the lyricism, the nuance, the authenticity of the human voice.  We strive towards “singing tone,” we take “breaths” between phrases, and we shape lines in a way that would seem only natural were we powering that line with our very lungs.  And in truth we approach all music in this way, because that is simply good musicianship.

But now and again we instrumentalists stumble upon those gems in the repertoire; we find a perfect vehicle for striving towards vocal nirvana.  And it’s often because the composer had the human voice in mind.  In our collection the pieces themselves are either direct transcriptions from vocal repertoire, or were inspired by that genre.  The Negro Spirituals are based upon the songs that brought immense comeraderie and respite to the enslaved people in America.  The Trío Romántico draws heavily upon Ponce’s experience as a song-writer, with beautiful soaring lines in the strings, and a piano score that closely resembles vocal accompaniments, particularly in the first two movements.  The Suite Hausteca explores tunes that not only provided a Latin-American backdrop for song, but also dance.

So join us—and let us sing you a song. 

~Trio Nova Mundi  (full artists bios and info at www.trionovamundi.com)


What We Need & What You Get

As you might imagine, producing a CD is not free!!  We've set our initial fund-raising goal against the figure of $5367.50, but our real goal is $11,362.50 (keep readin').   In an effort towards transparency (so it's clear that we're not just getting a lot of trips to Starbucks out of all of this!) we're laying it all out so you can see exactly where the funds are going.  Here's how the cost of creating a CD breaks down.....

Sound engineering/studio fees
   -Studio time (4 sessions at $150/session)  $600
   -Sound engineering  $750		  $  1,350.00
Graphic design and layout  $  850.00
Mastering   $  500.00
Oasis CD manufacturing  $  2,000.00
CD Baby Pro digital distribution  $  50.00
UPC Barcode  $  20.00
Licensing fees  $  297.50
Crowdfunding platform fees (approximate)  $ 300.00
*Album promotion by Pheonix Classical  $  4,995.00
*CD release event expenses  $  500.00
*Administrative costs (mailings, printing, ads, etc.)  $  500.00

Up top we've included the parts of the project that are non-negotiable.  In other words, we can't produce a CD without these expenses.  Just below we've included a few additional phases of the project (*) that we very much want to incorporate, but will only do so if our funding reaches appropriate levels.  The most notable of these "extras" is promotion of the CD through Phoenix Classical.  Phoenix Classical works with radio stations and top music publications worldwide, encouraging extensive radio play of the album, as well as eliciting written reviews.  This is a critical phase that will make the recording visible on an international scale.  All things included, the total reaches $11,362.50.

We are asking for $25 contributions--essentially the purchase of 1 CD ($20), plus $5 for shipping.  If you would like more than a single CD (it would be a great gift for your music-loving friends and family....), feel free to double the amount, triple it, or multiply by ten!  

We have a single high-level perk for those interested in supporting our project as a donor.  For contributions upwards of $1000 we will send a DVD of Trio Nova Mundi as well as a beautiful hard cover book featuring highlights from the trio's recent concerts and tours (in addition, of course, to a copy of the new CD).  The book will be dedicated to our donors, and contributors' names will be listed in the book.

The Impact

Because we are including premiere recordings on this disc, we are confident that our work will be an important contribution to the general discography.   We trust the recording will make its way into music libraries around the world as well as create a wonderful addition to personal recording collections.  We are also excited about the professional impact the recording will have for us as musicians, and the possibilities it will open up for us for future engagements.  And of course we're also happy to have a recording available for our supporters who've been asking about it for awhile now.

Risks & Challenges

Our main concern is meeting the basic costs of producing the CD.  The first cost we'll encounter is that of studio fees.  If our first round of fund-raising doesn't cover the full project, the first bit we raise will go towards this expense. If necessary, we'll then launch a new campaign to cover the next bit, and we'll continue to chip away at the project until we get there.  We've been working out possible contingency plans in case we can't fund one or another aspect of the project.  The most disappointing will be if we are not able to fund promotion through Phoenix Classical once the CD is produced.   

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether or not you're in a position to buy a CD from us or make an additional contribution, you can still be a huge help to us by sharing our campaign through social media, and telling your friends about our project.  Indiegogo has a share feature that makes it easy for you to help us get the word out.  Thanks so much for your support!

story:
Click the arrow in the picture above for a music video preview of our CD


This campaign has closed but we fell short of our goal -- we have opened a second campaign at http://igg.me/at/NOHMolokai


Read on for more background...


Help Na Ohana Hoaloha - your family of friends - bring the spirit and message of aloha
to a world stage this summer


Here's what your contribution will do --

  • Support the production of "Kai Moku - The Changing Tide" -- our new CD
  • Support  the band's European Tour launching the CD, June 30 - July 17, 2015
  • Support our gift of aloha to senior diplomats from over 170 countries on July 7


Scroll down to see and hear our progress on the Kai Moku CD


Mo'olelo Ko Makou - "Our Story"

Front Row: Julia Hoe, center - Pat Benda, left - DJ Pelekai, right

Back Row:  left to right - Uncle Willy Aki, Bully Aki, Scotty Schaefer, George Benda

Photo by Dewitt Jones


Julia Hoe in performance at Paddlers Inn, Molokai, Hawaii -- Photo by Marta Evry


Uncle Willy Aki, the band crooner mesmerizing the audience -- Photo by Marta Evry

Spreading Aloha Every Sunday Afternoon

Na Ohana Hoaloha, a Hawaiian Music band based on Molokai, Hawaii, has always had one basic goal: spread the aloha.  Playing a live performance every Sunday afternoon, Na Ohana Hoaloha has entertained thousands of local residents and visitors since its inception in 2004.  The music, hula, and audience involvement offered by the band make its weekly performance a “must attend” event for many.

The founder of the band was Ku’ulei Perez, a respected kupuna (elder) of the Molokai community.  She set a high bar for band members of respecting Hawaiian tradition and keeping a positive, constructive attitude with a constant focus on sharing the spirit of aloha in ways that engaged as well as entertained the audience.

Led today by Julia Hoe, one of the founding members and a respected kupuna in her own right, Na Ohana Hoaloha carries on those important precepts. 
The band is not paid for its performances. 
Tips are used to keep the band operating with any balance used to support local charitable concerns.  The band frequently volunteers at fundraising events on Molokai and makes other contributions.

Quality of performance is important to Na Ohana Hoaloha.  This has manifested in an upwelling of creativity from band members, expressing themselves in original music and hula choreography.  In 2013, band member DJ Pelekai shared his wisdom about the traditions of hula in a video by PF Bentley.  In 2010, the Band released a DVD, “Pretty Old for Our First Time”, as a fundraising project for Akaula School, an important contributor to education on Molokai.

Each Sunday, Na Ohana Hoaloha continues to welcome all who come to hear and participate.  The tradition of sharing Hawaiian aloha perpetuates.

Pahu Hope Ko Makou - "Our Goal"

Spreading Aloha on a World Stage

Presently the band is producing a CD, “Kai Moku - The Changing Tide”, for release during the Na Ohana Hoaloha 2015 European tour, where the band will share Hawaiian culture, music, and hula on a world stage.  The tour, beginning in England and continuing throughout Continental Europe, will reach thousands of people from around the world.  The anchor events will occur in Geneva, Switzerland:

  • On July 7, the band will perform to an audience of over 1,000 diplomatic represenatives of over 170 missions to the United Nations in Geneva
  • On July 8, the band will perform for several hundred representatives of island nations in a cultural exchange

Scheduled events will reach an audience from around the world.  The combination of the band's performances and the gift of "Kai Moku" to the international community will engage and embrace audiences to leave a lasting message of aloha.

It will be Hawaiian Music for the world.

Arriving in London and staying in Bristol, the band plans to tour small venues in England.  These will include pubs and other informal places of gathering, where “Hawaiian Night” will draw local residents to listen and participate in the sharing of the band’s aloha. 

The band plans to travel through Paris to Geneva, Switzerland.  There, scheduled events centered around the extensive international community will bring Hawaiian music and cultural practices to the world stage.  Na Ohana Hoaloha is  partnering with Ka ’Imi Switzerland, a Swiss Hula Halau, organized independently but under the international roof of Ka ’Imi Naauao O Hawaii Nei Institute. With dancers from Switzerland, Germany and Austria  – all students of Maui-based Kumu Hula Roselle Keli’ihonipua Bailey– it will be a truly international celebration of Hawaiian culture.

Ka 'Imi Switzerland Hula Halau performs with chant and ancient forms of dance 

After the anchor event, the band plans to remain on the continent to perform additional events.  These events will again offer local residents a glimpse of Hawaiian culture.  Additionally the relationship between the band and the local halau will demonstrate that the spirit of aloha can stay alive and well in the context of inland, continental communities.

Arcing from the spark of these events, the spirit of aloha offered by Na Ohana Hoaloha may spread to countries around the world.  It will reach diverse audiences and influential leaders in the global community.  It will bring Hawaiian culture, music, and hula to the world.

All contributions graciously donated to our Indiegogo campaign will be used for the following:

  • Record and produce the "Kai Moku" CD
  • Share the CD as a gift of Aloha to the world diplomatic community
  • Travel expenses associated with getting our band to the world stage

Watch the Tide Rise on "Kai Moku"

Join us on the adventure of recording and producing Kai Moku – The Changing Tide as we put together our ideas for sharing aloha on a world stage.  See how an old fashioned Hawaiian band brings its music to life with a combination of ancient instruments and modern recording technology.

Here’s the play list, and you can listen to drafts as they progress…


Track


Song Title


Story


Link to Listen Now

1

Mokio Sunrise

Band original, inspired by the land and work of the Molokai Land Trust on the North Shore of Molokai

Mokio Sunrise

2

Na Mele Ohana Hoaloha

Band original, the story of DJ's paternal & maternal grandparents and an homage to all our kupuna (elders)

Na Mele Ohana Hoaloha

3
