story_txt:
Click the arrow in the picture above for a music video preview of our CD This campaign has closed but we fell short of our goal -- we have opened a second campaign at http://igg.me/at/NOHMolokai
Read on for more background...Help Na Ohana Hoaloha - your family of friends - bring the spirit and message of aloha to a world stage this summer Here's what your contribution will do --
Support the production of "Kai Moku - The Changing Tide" -- our new CD
Support  the band's European Tour launching the CD, June 30 - July 17, 2015
Support our gift of aloha to senior diplomats from over 170 countries on July 7
Scroll down to see and hear our progress on the Kai Moku CD
Mo'olelo Ko Makou - "Our Story"



Front Row: Julia Hoe, center - Pat Benda, left - DJ Pelekai, right
Back Row:  left to right - Uncle Willy Aki, Bully Aki, Scotty Schaefer, George Benda
Photo by Dewitt Jones
Julia Hoe in performance at Paddlers Inn, Molokai, Hawaii -- Photo by Marta EvryUncle Willy Aki, the band crooner mesmerizing the audience -- Photo by Marta EvrySpreading 



Aloha Every Sunday Afternoon
Na Ohana Hoaloha, a Hawaiian Music band based on Molokai,
Hawaii, has always had one basic goal: spread the aloha.  Playing a live performance every Sunday
afternoon, Na Ohana Hoaloha has entertained thousands of local residents and
visitors since its inception in 2004. 
The music, hula, and audience involvement offered by the band make its
weekly performance a “must attend” event for many.

The founder of the band was Ku’ulei Perez, a respected
kupuna (elder) of the Molokai community. 
She set a high bar for band members of respecting Hawaiian tradition and
keeping a positive, constructive attitude with a constant focus on sharing the
spirit of aloha in ways that engaged as well as entertained the audience.

Led today by Julia Hoe, one of the founding members and a
respected kupuna in her own right, Na Ohana Hoaloha carries on those important
precepts.  
The band is not paid for
its performances.  Tips are used to
keep the band operating with any balance used to support local charitable
concerns.  The band frequently
volunteers at fundraising events on Molokai and makes other contributions.

Quality of performance is important to Na Ohana
Hoaloha.  This has manifested in an
upwelling of creativity from band members, expressing themselves in original
music and hula choreography.  In 2013, band member DJ Pelekai shared his wisdom about the traditions of hula in a video by PF Bentley.  In
2010, the Band released a DVD, “Pretty Old for Our First Time”, as a
fundraising project for Akaula School, an important contributor to education on
Molokai. 

Each Sunday, Na Ohana Hoaloha continues to welcome all who come to hear and participate.  The tradition of sharing Hawaiian aloha perpetuates.

Pahu Hope Ko Makou - "Our Goal"


Spreading Aloha on a World Stage
Presently the band is producing a CD, “Kai Moku - The
Changing Tide”, for release during the Na Ohana Hoaloha 2015 European
tour, where the band will share Hawaiian culture, music, and hula on a world stage.  The tour, beginning in England and continuing throughout Continental Europe, will reach
thousands of people from around the world.  The anchor events will occur in Geneva, Switzerland:
On July 7, the band will perform to an audience of over 1,000 diplomatic represenatives of over 170 missions to the United Nations in Geneva
On July 8, the band will perform for several hundred representatives of island nations in a cultural exchange
Scheduled events will reach an audience from around the world.  The combination of the band's performances and the gift of "Kai Moku" to the international community will engage and embrace audiences to leave a lasting message of aloha.
It will be Hawaiian Music for the
world.
Arriving in London and staying in Bristol, the band plans to
tour small venues in England. 
These will include pubs and other informal places of gathering, where
“Hawaiian Night” will draw local residents to listen and participate in the
sharing of the band’s aloha.  
The band plans to travel through Paris to Geneva,
Switzerland.  There, scheduled
events centered around the extensive international community will bring
Hawaiian music and cultural practices to the world stage.  Na Ohana Hoaloha is  partnering with Ka ’Imi Switzerland, a Swiss Hula
Halau, organized independently but under the international roof of Ka ’Imi
Naauao O Hawaii Nei Institute. With dancers from Switzerland, Germany
and Austria  – all students of Maui-based Kumu Hula Roselle Keli’ihonipua Bailey– it
will be a truly international celebration of Hawaiian culture.Ka 'Imi Switzerland Hula Halau performs with chant and ancient forms of dance 
After the anchor event, the band plans to remain on the
continent to perform additional events. 
These events will again offer local residents a glimpse of Hawaiian
culture.  Additionally the
relationship between the band and the local halau will demonstrate that the
spirit of aloha can stay alive and well in the context of inland, continental
communities.
Arcing from the spark of
these events, the spirit of aloha offered by Na Ohana Hoaloha may spread to
countries around the world.  It
will reach diverse audiences and influential leaders in the global
community.  It will bring Hawaiian
culture, music, and hula to the world. All contributions graciously donated to our Indiegogo campaign will be used for the following:  Record and produce the "Kai Moku" CD 
Share the CD as a gift of Aloha to the world diplomatic community  Travel expenses associated with getting our band to the world stage    Watch the Tide Rise on "Kai Moku"


Join us on the adventure of recording and producing Kai Moku
– The Changing Tide as we put together our ideas for sharing aloha on a world
stage.  See how an old fashioned Hawaiian
band brings its music to life with a combination of ancient instruments and
modern recording technology.
Here’s the play list, and you can listen to drafts as they
progress…

story:
My vision for Peacemaker is a rock CD album that is inspired and influenced by Native American life and music. These songs are not all traditional Native music, but a blend of cultures that includes all "tribes" of humanity. An expression of the present and the past as well as of the timeless beauty of nature. It's about the peacemaker that is inside all of us, and the people who choose that peace. What Peacemaker will emote is a deep love for humanity, including respect for women, and a sacred appreciation for creation.

I have worked with a lot of other people over the years, and now I am inspired to produce my own work of art. The goal of this project is to produce an EP Album with 5 songs, hopefully setting the foundation for a Full Album release with 10 songs in the future.

To get a sense of my music style, check out My Music Portfolio.




I'm very fortunate to be working with outstanding musicians and technicians like Paul Kraushaar, Nora Nausbaum, and Anni McCann. Terry Carleton (who plays drums with the English band "Camel") is drumming on several songs. We also have Kit Baliey playing incredible drums on "Cool Breeze", and "Turtle Island Blues". There's a host of other great musicians and singers contributing to the project as well. Please help me bring this work out to the world, as I pour my heart into it!

Where will the money go?

What You Get

Here’s what I’ll offer you for your support:

story:
Summary

The new EP "Our Side" is starting to make waves with fans, but we want to give everyone something a little more "visual" to go along with it! So we're filming a music video for "I Met A Beautiful Girl Today".

What We Need & What You Get

Our costs to film the video (and film it right) are going to be about $3000. Most of that will go to Miesner Media, who will be producing the video. Other costs include travel to a from our location (Belzoni, MS) and casting.

For each amount you give, you get something in return. This ranges from a simple thank you to a chance to be an extra in the video itself...all the way to us putting on an acoustic concert in your home. Check out what perks you get for helping out!

The Impact

The goal of this video is primarily to entertain fans. But personally, I'm hoping this video will show people a goofier side of me and my band. If you've seen one of our live shows, you know we like to jump around and have a lot of fun. This video will capture the personalities of me and some of my best friends in a fun and entertaining way. In other words, you're giving us a chance to act like complete idiots on camera. And that's a good thing.

story:
My (short) story

Frustrated of only being labeled “the drummer” for bands and singer/songwriters, I took it upon myself to step into the stage lights, becoming a vocalist and frontman for my own music.

I'm in the middle of recording my first record with producer (and my drummer) Jordan McCree, entitled "Space Fire" and like everybody finds out, recording a record gets pretty pricey! That's where you phenomenal people come in.

What I Need & What You Get

I'm asking for donations, but you're actually ordering preorders for the record, and other fantastic deals! Deals that you can ONLY get here! 

  • The money you guys donate will go straight to funding the record production, paying the band, the mixing and mastering, and the first order of MERCH!! And all I'm asking for is...$1,500.  That's IT!

Other Ways You Can Help

I realize that many people I know are starving artists and can't help me out financially for this project. I totally understand! I have been there too. If you'd like to help, but have no money, please just share this project with your friends in whatever way you can. Thank you, thank you, thank you for any support you can give!

story:
I will burn my guitar in flames of 'Friendly Fire'.

As suggested by Stan Walker from X-Factor NZ's Season Two, I should burn my beloved guitar. (For Real).

Funds raised will be used to hire proper session musicians on my 3rd independent EP, mastering for new EP, a music video, to buy a new guitar, and to film the whole ceremony of burning said guitar. Internet loves fire, so let's burn this mofo burn.

Oh but wait - some say - let the guitar live?

Well, the choice is yours, the most votes lead towards desired outcome. Time is ticking for the precious guitar - like the days of Rome, do you thumbs up or thumbs down?

Updates on my 3rd EP: www.thisflighttonight.com

story:
If you support local music then this is your chance to make a difference. 

This year, Tour Worthy is excited to announce that we will be sending two deserving bands from San Diego, Soft Lions and Hills like Elephants, to SXSW for two unofficial showcases at Stay Gold and The Aquarium On 6th. The showcases will take place on Thursday, March 19th and Saturday, March 21st and promise to be major events during the week of the festival. 

Please help us raise funds to offset the bands’ travel expenses, lodging and gear rental. 100% of the funds raised will go to the bands. If we meet our goal, we'll be able to promote more deserving bands like this in the future. The price of the trip is as follows:

  • Airfare 8 persons:  $3,800
  • Lodging 3 nights:  $1,050
  • Gear Rental: TBD

If we raise more than our goal, the surplus funds will be given to the musicians to help pay for food and other daily expenses.  If 200 people donate $20 then our goal will be met, and some very talented musicians will get the exposure they deserve.

Everything helps!  Your support is greatly appreciated!

Tour Worthy (tourworthy.com) is a free online resource to discover talent in the music industry worldwide, and for musicians to promote their music, trade gigs, and get press at home and on the road.  Our mission is to provide musicians from across the world with convenient access to venues, other bands, music fans, and industry experts, to increase their exposure and take control of their music careers.

story:
Who We Are

We are Image Of, a heavy metal band from Colorado Springs, CO. We have been together now for over 5 years and are making headway to becoming the musicians, song writers, and individuals we want to be.

All the time we have been together we have strictly focused on writing, performing, and making sure that anyone who listens to our music will not only understand where we have come from but also where we are going. Music is our life and we want our music to be a part of yours as well. Our songs offer epic riffs, complex rhythms, and provoking lyrics of every emotion. This is metal music with a mission!

We have put in the effort to record a single as a free download to show we are serious. By your contributions, we will be able to release our first EP and light the fire of our journey in 2015!

What We Need & What You Get

We will need $3,000 to get the ball moving. For about the price of a local concert ticket, you can fund an EP that you'll be able to own! (See Perks below.)

All the funds will cover actual recording time, mixing, distribution, and travel expenses.

Don't miss your opportunity to be a direct contributor to breaking Image Of into the metal scene with a refreshing sound! For a taste of what you will be supporting, click on our website link below (www.reverbnation.com/imageof) and listen to "Born In Blood". Imagine more songs of this quality and caliber!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate - share our campaign and maybe someone else can!

story:
Hi everyone and welcome to my indigogo campaign.


This album came from my deepest vulnerable place. I had been told I had Six months to live due to liver cancer. I had to find the courage to believe something else was possible. At first I thought I was going to die .The upset for me was not in the dying but in the leaving my children behind and my beautiful granddaughter who was two at the time. I couldn't bear the thought of it. Something in me rose up and fought for my life. The songs started to emerge as I was clinging on through the chemo through the pain and through the fear of the unknown. They gave me hope and a place to rest and tune in to the healing inside me. They also gave me the courage to be with past pain and release it. I began to see that all this was happening for a purpose and my soul was waking up to another level. I know now my purpose is to share my experience and these songs so that people know that no matter what medical road we take we can find peace, love for the self and healing.

Anyone who has ever been given similar news please take a look  at is "The Penny Brohn Cancer Care Centre in Bristol UK" It was a life line for me. The approach there is to look at the body, mind and spirit and I was so hungry for care and nurturing. No one until this point had asked me if I knew why I had cancer. That question set me on a path that was to radically transform my health. You can go there on a living well course for the weekend and it is all free. Unfortunately one of their main funders have been lost and some of their courses have been cut, so a percentage of sales from the album will go to helping keep this healing place accessible to people. Lots of the songs were written in this wonderful place including a song For Pat Pilkington after she passed away. She was one of the founders and one of the most amazingly inspiring people I have ever met. We had the privilege to play her song at her book launch of "The Golden Thread" there was lots of tears and lots of smiles and lots of angels.

So here I was with an albums worth of songs and didn't have a clue about the next move . I was beginning to have a bit of energy return so I decided to go to Brighton to do a course in EFT (Emotional Freedom Technique). Which was also a huge part of me healing.

I asked my friends Steve Lovell and his family if I could stay with them. What I didn't know was that Steve had been a music producer and had worked with Blur, Holly Johnson and Julian Cope, among others. His wife Rachel was a member of Dolly Mixture. Although they are no longer in the main stream music business they still record from home. They asked me if I would like to sing on a couple of tracks. I shared my story, they listened to the songs and Steve said "I want to produce them"! Rachel has sung backing vocals and I am so grateful for all the input from both of them. I truly feel I am being guided by angels to make this happen. It has taken us 8 months to recorded the songs. The next step is to get them out in to the world. That is where we need your help.

All of the tracks on Breathe are from the healing realm, there are only positive uplifting vibrations in this music. It has been three years now since I was diagnosed with the tumour. I have learned to take each day at a time with Gratitude and Love.

Forgiveness and tuning in to the source, these are the things that led to my own healing. The message in the songs is, that healing the self is totally possible. I go in to nature and listen. I smile, I cry, I connect to the beauty of this wonderful world and know the same beauty and potential is inside myself and all of us. It has been three years now since I was diagnosed with the tumour.I take each day at a time 

In pledging any amount or purchasing a perk, you will make a profound difference to people whether they are ill, well, or living with cancer. It will give them access to something that helps and instructs them how to tune in and relax to the healing within them.
Everyone benefits from relaxing and tuning in to health.


Our goal is for the campaign to raise £5000.
Any capital raised beyond this will go towards media distribution and touring the UK.


I want to say the biggest thank you to everyone that has been a part of my journey. You have given me hope and joy in my darkest times and I am sure that all your love has helped me to stay alive.


What We Need your help for


CD manufacture

Marketing and PR 

Professional video  

Work on website  

Equipment to tour


If we don't reach the funding goal. We will still get the perks you have purchased to you by the end of June. I appreciate your trust and good spirit.

I warmly invite you to be part of this wonderful  project.

If you are inspired and would just  like to make a contribution "Thank you" and if you would like to purchase a perk please check on the right side for the donation amounts to the corresponding gifts. Thank you everyone.

If you have any questions regarding the music or perks do not hesitate to contact me at nmclear@yahoo.com


Other Ways You Can Help


If you are unable to donate at this time, no worries there are many other ways you can help this vision to be manifested 
Direct people to my indiegogo page
Share the campaign video on your facebook page
Email your friends and family around the world.

Tell your friends and family directly
If you have access to, music magazines, websites, radio, newspapers or other relevant professionals tell them about my project.
story_txt:
Hi everyone and welcome to my indigogo campaign.

This album came from my deepest vulnerable place. I had been told I had Six months to live due to liver cancer. I had to find the courage to believe something else was possible. At first I thought I was going to die .The upset for me was not in the dying but in the leaving my children behind and my beautiful granddaughter who was two at the time. I couldn't bear the thought of it. Something in me rose up and fought for my life. The songs started to emerge as I was clinging on through the chemo through the pain and through the fear of the unknown. They gave me hope and a place to rest and tune in to the healing inside me. They also gave me the courage to be with past pain and release it. I began to see that all this was happening for a purpose and my soul was waking up to another level. I know now my purpose is to share my experience and these songs so that people know that no matter what medical road we take we can find peace, love for the self and healing.


Anyone who has ever been given similar news please take a look  at is "The Penny Brohn Cancer Care Centre in Bristol UK" It was a life line for me. The approach there is to look at the body, mind and spirit and I was so hungry for care and nurturing. No one until this point had asked me if I knew why I had cancer. That question set me on a path that was to radically transform my health. You can go there on a living well course for the weekend and it is all free. Unfortunately one of their main funders have been lost and some of their courses have been cut, so a percentage of sales from the album will go to helping keep this healing place accessible to people. Lots of the songs were written in this wonderful place including a song For Pat Pilkington after she passed away. She was one of the founders and one of the most amazingly inspiring people I have ever met. We had the privilege to play her song at her book launch of "The Golden Thread" there was lots of tears and lots of smiles and lots of angels.


So here I was with an albums worth of songs and didn't have a clue about the next move . I was beginning to have a bit of energy return so I decided to go to Brighton to do a course in EFT (Emotional Freedom Technique). Which was also a huge part of me healing.


I asked my friends Steve Lovell and his family if I could stay with them. What I didn't know was that Steve had been a music producer and had worked with Blur, Holly Johnson and Julian Cope, among others. His wife Rachel was a member of Dolly Mixture. Although they are no longer in the main stream music business they still record from home. They asked me if I would like to sing on a couple of tracks. I shared my story, they listened to the songs and Steve said "I want to produce them"! Rachel has sung backing vocals and I am so grateful for all the input from both of them. I truly feel I am being guided by angels to make this happen. It has taken us 8 months to recorded the songs. The next step is to get them out in to the world. That is where we need your help.

All of the tracks on Breathe are from the healing realm, there are only positive uplifting vibrations in this music. It has been three years now since I was diagnosed with the tumour. I have learned to take each day at a time with Gratitude and Love.


Forgiveness and tuning in to the source, these are the things that led to my own healing. The message in the songs is, that healing the self is totally possible. I go in to nature and listen. I smile, I cry, I connect to the beauty of this wonderful world and know the same beauty and potential is inside myself and all of us. It has been three years now since I was diagnosed with the tumour.I take each day at a time 

In pledging any amount or purchasing a perk, you will make a profound difference to people whether they are ill, well, or living with cancer. It will give them access to something that helps and instructs them how to tune in and relax to the healing within them.Everyone benefits from relaxing and tuning in to health.

Our goal is for the campaign to raise £5000.Any capital raised beyond this will go towards media distribution and touring the UK.

I want to say the biggest thank you to everyone that has been a part of my journey. You have given me hope and joy in my darkest times and I am sure that all your love has helped me to stay alive.

CD manufacture
Marketing and PR 
Professional video  
Work on website  
Equipment to tour

story:
V2 is recording it’s first album and proud to feature guitar legends Eric Johnson, Adrian Belew, and George Tomsco. The album will include contemporary versions of classic instrumentals originally made popular by such groups as The Fireballs, The Chantays, The Tornadoes, and of course The Ventures. The album will also feature new compositions, written by V2.

V2 is committed to preserving and advancing the “Art of the Rock Instrumental”. The visibility and exposure to classic as well as contemporary instrumental music has diminished and V2 believes that keeping this music alive and available to those that share that attraction is important. Certainly today’s instrumental artists share this belief as Eric Johnson’s support proves with contemporary versions of Pipeline and Out of Limits. Adrian Belew with a legacy of Frank Zappa, King Crimson, David Bowie (among many others) is excited about collaborating with V2 on Telstar. V2 is also honored to have one of the innovative artists of classic instrumental music Mr. George Tomsco, founder of The Fireballs and composer of such classics as Bulldog appearing as a guest on the debut album. 

The album will be recorded in Austin, Texas and Nashville, Tennessee at various studios including The Bubble, Eric Johnson's Saucer Studio, Adrian’s Studio in Nashville, and BigDog/LittleDog Studio. Tracking for the album will begin in May, 2015 under the direction of Grammy-Nominated producer, Chris “Frenchie” Smith and schedule for a summer 2015 release.

Utilizing crowdfunding is an excellent way for an independent group, such as V2, to obtain the resources it needs to complete and distribute the best possible album. It is also a great way to connect with fans and supporters. You can be a part of this project simply by backing this campaign. For your support V2 has developed many interesting perks for your contribution, including many limited edition items created solely for those who donate.  If you have any questions about the campaign, album, perks, donations, or anything else please feel free to contact us directly at V2Instrumental@gmail.com

V2 is Bob Spalding on lead guitar and Leon Taylor drums, both noted for their work with the best-selling instrumental group of all time, The Ventures. Rounding out the group is Ian Spalding and Luke Griffin adding their multi-instrumental guitar, bass, and keyboard talents.

story:
Welcome to the

MORDRED

 Summer Tour Indiegogo Campaign 2015!


We just wanted to start off by extending a HUGE thank you to all of you that donated in our first Indiegogo campaign last year. We were able to bring in enough in contributions and as a result, we had an amazing time on our first tour in 25 years!! 

  • In this years news, we have quite a bit lined up for Mordred: We’ve announced another tour kicking off July 30 in Dublin, IRELAND again at Fibber Magees. We’ll be traveling through the UK, Holland, and Germany this time and possibly Switzerland as well, we’re almost finished booking now.

  • And this summer we were asked to play… BLOODSTOCK in Derbyshire in the UK ! We’ll be playing Saturday August 8th on the Sophie Lancaster Stage

So we’re asking you for help…again!!


What We Need & What You Get

Here's what we need:

  • Money to record and tour again. As you may or may not know by now  know it’s expensive to fly 6 musicians over to Europe from the US. cart them around and feed them for 3 weeks. We’ll need TRANSPORTATION, VISAS, EQUIPMENT RENATL and PRESS to let everyone know we’re coming over. 

  • We’re also releasing a brand new album, the first one in 25 years. The E.P from last year has now turned into a full blown album and will be given to those who contributed last year, and is also a perk this year.The album will be done by tour time July 30, 2015! We’ve got 7 new songs completely written and 4 more in various stages of finishing so we’ll have it ready in time. We want to book STUDIO TIME to record drums. The guitars, vocals, bass and DJ can be recorded pretty much anywhere but drums need a special place to get great sounds.

  • We're looking for $5,000 right now to help buy the plane tickets and put a deposit down to hold the transportation we'll need over in Europe and lay down drum tracks for the new record.
  • Once we secure the tix and transpo, we'll see if we need help with anything else. In the meantime you get PERKS! Including a tour video from last year’s summer 2014 tour!! The DVD was shot mainly in Belfast, Ireland but includes footage from other shows throughout the tour, it's shaping up to look awesome, check out the INDIEGOGO VIDEO at the top of the page!
Here's what you get:

  • We’ve restocked our hoodies, t shirts and tour shirts, which were huge hits in last year’s campaigns. 

  • We have posters, vinyl, Skype lessons and a few other surprises in store as well. 

So please, check out the list of perks and help us record our new Record and Tour again this summer!!


  • and don't forget to share this with EVERYONE YOU KNOOOOOOOW......

story:
Redhot & Blue has won national recognition for its innovative arrangements of jazz standards that blend American songbook classics with the fresh, upbeat flair of the collegiate a cappella tradition. The group’s sixteen members have brought their classic, award-winning sound to venues all over the world: from snowy Montreal to the Golden Gate Bridge; from the sunny plazas of Madrid to the bustling streets of London; and from the White House to the halls of our own, beloved, Yale University.

Our goal in making our summer tours is not just to visit a foreign country but to use it as an opportunity to connect with children, students and a broad cross-section of citizens to spread our love of music and promote friendship between our country and theirs. We plan to perform at Japanese schools and hold workshops with students. The Japanese and U.S. governments have established an ambitious goal of doubling the number of Japanese and U.S. students studying in each other’s country by 2020 and we hope by interacting with Japanese high school and college students we can encourage them to study in the U.S. We also hope to partner with non-profit organizations and use our concerts as a means to promote and raise money for their causes. Finally, we are planning venues for the general public.

Your support will help us to reach out to the people of Japan. As a completely self-supporting organization, we depend on your generosity. Any amount to help us make this project a reality is welcome. If possible, spreading the word about our project to those who may be interested would also be greatly appreciated. If you have any questions, please feel free to ask.

Visit our website, http://www.redhotandblueofyale.org, and our youtube channel,https://www.youtube.com/user/yaleredhot, for a more substantial taste of our sound!

Updates about our activities in Japan will be posted throughout the tour on our website and Facebook page, https://www.facebook.com/yaleredhot.

story:
Breve reseña

Hola amigos,

Somos un grupo de miembros de la Iglesia Presbiteriana y Reformada de Tepeyec, ubicada en San José, Costa Rica. Nos hemos dado la tarea de proveer a la comunidad cristiana en Latinoamérica, una producción musical profesional que incluya canciones e himnos cristianos clásicos 100% apegados a principios bíblicos.

¿Y esto por qué? Se preguntarán.  Nos hemos dado cuenta de que la mayoría de las producciones musicales cristianas en español, se enfocan en coros modernos con buen ritmo; sin embargo, las canciones e himnos clásicos con mensajes apegados a la Biblia, se han ido perdiendo lamentablemente a través de los años.

Queremos retomar dichos cánticos con este proyecto, y hacérselo llegar a todos los hermanos en Latinoamérica que sientan esta necesidad.

Los músicos son:

Allan Gómez - Guitarra y voz

Choi Kim - Piano

Gabriel Moreira - Voz

Sergio Martínez - Bajo

Alejandra Sáenz - Saxofón alto


Lista de canciones a agregar al CD


1- Dios descendió
2- Brilla en mí
3- Yo Te doy las gracias
4- Estamos reunidos
5- Escudriñemos
6- Cerca más cerca
7- Que mi vida entera esté
8- En Jesucristo Fuente de paz
9- Grande es Tu Fidelidad
10- Santo Santo Santo
11- Aquel que es Poderoso - Judas 1: 24-25 (Doxología)
12- Creced en Gracia y Conocimiento - 2 Pedro 3: 18 (Doxología)


Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Estamos buscando obtener $3000 para financiar la pre-producción, grabación, mezcla, masterización y diseño del disco.

Los gastos se dividen de la siguiente manera:

- $500 para pre-producción. Esto incluye la realización de los arreglos musicales por parte de un músico profesional.

- $1400 para la grabación.

- $500 para la masterización.

- $600 para el diseño e impresión arte del disco. La primera impresión sería de 600 copias, y se estima un costo de $1 por disco.

¿Qué obtiene si realiza su donación?

Por $10, obtiene como recompensa la copia del disco digital o disco físico ¡antes de su lanzamiento!

Por $25, obtiene las siguientes recompensas:
1. El disco digital o disco físico antes del lanzamiento oficial.
2. Boletín Reforma Siglo XXI de la Confederación Latinoamericana de Iglesias Reformadas (CLIR - www.clir.net)
3. El libro Adoración bíblica impreso por la CLIR.

Por $50, obtiene las siguientes recompensas:
1. El disco digital o disco físico antes del lanzamiento oficial
2. Boletín Reforma Siglo XXI de la CLIR (www.clir.net)
3. El libro Adoración bíblica y un libro más de su escogencia impreso por la CLIR.

Por $100, obtiene lo siguiente:
1. El disco digital o disco físico antes del lanzamiento oficial.
2. Boletín Reforma Siglo XXI de la CLIR (www.clir.net)
3. El libro Adoración Bíblica y 4 libros más de su escogencia impresos por la CLIR.

Por $250, obtiene las siguientes recompensas:
1. El disco digital o disco físico antes del lanzamiento oficial.
2. Boletín Reforma Siglo XXI de la CLIR (www.clir.net)
3. El libro Adoración bíblica y 9 libros más de su escogencia impresos por la CLIR.
4. Y el libro Institución de la Religion Cristiana por Juan Calvino.

Por $500, obtiene las siguientes recompensas:
1. El disco digital o disco físico antes del lanzamiento oficial
2. Boletín Reforma Siglo XXI de la CLIR (www.clir.net)
3. El libro Adoración bíblica y 14 libros más de su escogencia impresos por la CLIR.
4. El libro Institución de la Religion Cristiana por Juan Calvino.
5. Y el libro Teología Sistemática de Louis Berkhof.

Es decir, además de obtener el disco, ¡va a tener toda una biblioteca teológica del más alto nivel!

¿Qué pasa si no logramos la meta total?

En caso que no lográramos recaudar el dinero por este medio, se buscaría el restante del dinero por otros medios, ya que creemos que este proyecto va a ser de bendición para muchos cristianos hispanohablantes.

Los donantes igualmente obtendrán su recompensa, una vez hayamos completado el proyecto.

Tiempos de ejecución del proyecto

Diciembre 2014 - Pre-producción y arreglos musicales

Enero 2015 - Inicio de los ensayos de las canciones arregladas

Febrero 2015 - Inicio de la grabación en el estudio e inicio de la etapa diseño gráfico

Marzo 2015 - Fin de la grabación e inicio de la etapa de post-producción, edición, mezcla y masterización

Abril 2015 - Reproducción de las primeras 600 copias de los discos

Abril 2015 - Envío de los discos y las recompensas ganadas

El impacto

Realmente creemos que la comunidad cristiana hispanohablante va a obtener música de excelente calidad que traerá de vuelta las canciones e himnos clásicos, los cuales ayudarán a nuestra comunidad a adorar y revenciar a Dios con cánticos solemnes y apegados a la manera que Él quiere que lo alabemos.

Riesgos y desafíos

Un riesgo que podemos enfrentar es no lograr la meta planteada. Si esto pasara, buscaremos otras alternativas para que el proyecto se logre efectuar.

Por otro lado, el proyecto se puede ver afectado por el compromiso de los participantes; sin embargo, todos los miembros han demostrado su compromiso en las etapas iniciales de preparación y ensayos; por lo que vemos poco probable que esto afecte la conclusión del proyecto.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

En caso que no pueda colaborar, le agradeceríamos en gran manera que difunda esta campaña y que genere eco entre los hermanos de su comunidad.

Puede utilizar las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo para que llegue a todos sus contactos.

Muchas bendiciones

El disco digital o disco físico antes del lanzamiento oficial.2. Boletín Reforma Siglo XXI de la Confederación Latinoamericana de Iglesias Reformadas (CLIR - www.clir.net) 3. El libro Adoración bíblica impreso por la CLIR.Por $50, obtiene las siguientes recompensas: 1. El disco digital o disco físico antes del lanzamiento oficial 2. Boletín Reforma Siglo XXI de la CLIR (www.clir.net) 3. El libro Adoración bíblica y un libro más de su escogencia impreso por la CLIR.Por $100, obtiene lo siguiente: 1. El disco digital o disco físico antes del lanzamiento oficial.2. Boletín Reforma Siglo XXI de la CLIR (www.clir.net) 3. El libro Adoración Bíblica y 4 libros más de su escogencia impresos por la CLIR.
Por $250, obtiene las siguientes recompensas: 1. El disco digital o disco físico antes del lanzamiento oficial.2. Boletín Reforma Siglo XXI de la CLIR (www.clir.net) 3. El libro Adoración bíblica y 9 libros más de su escogencia impresos por la CLIR. 4. Y el libro Institución de la Religion Cristiana por Juan Calvino.Por $500, obtiene las siguientes recompensas:1. El disco digital o disco físico antes del lanzamiento oficial2. Boletín Reforma Siglo XXI de la CLIR (www.clir.net)3. El libro Adoración bíblica y 14 libros más de su escogencia impresos por la CLIR.4. El libro Institución de la Religion Cristiana por Juan Calvino.5. Y el libro Teología Sistemática de Louis Berkhof.Es decir, además de obtener el disco, ¡va a tener toda una biblioteca teológica del más alto nivel!¿Qué pasa si no logramos la meta total?

En caso que no lográramos recaudar el dinero por este medio, se buscaría el restante del dinero por otros medios, ya que creemos que este proyecto va a ser de bendición para muchos cristianos hispanohablantes.
Los donantes igualmente obtendrán su recompensa, una vez hayamos completado el proyecto.

Tiempos de ejecución del proyecto
Diciembre 2014 - Pre-producción y arreglos musicalesEnero 2015 - Inicio de los ensayos de las canciones arregladas
Febrero 2015 - Inicio de la grabación en el estudio e inicio de la etapa diseño gráfico
Marzo 2015 - Fin de la grabación e inicio de la etapa de post-producción, edición, mezcla y masterización
Abril 2015 - Reproducción de las primeras 600 copias de los discos
Abril 2015 - Envío de los discos y las recompensas ganadas

El impacto
Realmente creemos que la comunidad cristiana hispanohablante va a obtener música de excelente calidad que traerá de vuelta las canciones e himnos clásicos, los cuales ayudarán a nuestra comunidad a adorar y revenciar a Dios con cánticos solemnes y apegados a la manera que Él quiere que lo alabemos.

Riesgos y desafíos
  Un riesgo que podemos enfrentar es no lograr la meta planteada. Si esto pasara, buscaremos otras alternativas para que el proyecto se logre efectuar.
Por otro lado, el proyecto se puede ver afectado por el compromiso de los participantes; sin embargo, todos los miembros han demostrado su compromiso en las etapas iniciales de preparación y ensayos; por lo que vemos poco probable que esto afecte la conclusión del proyecto.
 
  Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar  En caso que no pueda colaborar, le agradeceríamos en gran manera que difunda esta campaña y que genere eco entre los hermanos de su comunidad. 
Puede utilizar las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo para que llegue a todos sus contactos.
 
  Muchas bendiciones

story:
Waverunner plans to enter the studio in February of 2015 to record our debut album to be released in spring 2015. We are asking for contributions in order to assist with the costs of recording, mastering and printing the release. Contributions will also help the band cover the costs of acquiring merchandise. We are estimating this to cost around 2-3,000 USD and every dollar helps us towards that goal! By contributing you will be helping us create and distribute our music, and we intend on providing contributors with perks that are equivalent to the dollar amount, ranging from copies of our release, merchandise etc… 

We are giving you the chance to preorder the album. We do not expect something for nothing. We are not asking for charity or handouts. We are creative minds with a vision.We are musicians making music. We are Waverunner.

story:
Short Summary


Hey guys!!! 2015 is becoming an exciting year in my music career. I'm in the mist of dropping a new album, new single, and I was asked to perform in Miami!!!!
I truly need all of my family, friends, supporters, and lovebugs to help me get to Miami in May!!!!!! This is the most important gig of my life, to be about to perform in front of 40,000 beautiful people is a great move for my music career and life.
Anything will help even if its a $1, I wouldn't ask if I truly didn't need the help. 


What I Need & What You Get

All funding will be going towards me getting to and from Miami.

If my goals is not reach the money collected will still go towards my plane ticket and Event ticket purchase.

Perks of helping me get to Miami:

EVERYONE WHO DONATES WILL GET MY SINGLE "FAULTY" BEFORE IT DROPS ON ITUNES!!! I WILL ALSO SHOUT YOU OUT WITH A PICTURE ON ALL SOCIAL SITES!!

 
This gig is the biggest gig of my life, This will change everything in my music career for the good and the more exposure i get the more i will be able to take care of my family!

story:
Drive More Drive are on track to recording their first EP. With help from well-known Dallas producer Salim Nourallah, the band is set to record a top quality EP consisting of five original tracks. We plan to finish the recording process in late January and the mixing and mastering process by early February. Unfortunately, this won't come cheap and that's where we need your help. We have a completed a budget projecting a grand total of $1,000 to complete this album, which isn't exactly pocket change. By backing this project, you can help us finally reach our dream of recording our original EP with one of the top producers in Texas. There's no telling how far up we'll be able to go from here! Thank you in advance for all of the help and support! 

Jack, Joe, John, and Ben

story:
January Marie Lapuz was born on April 9, 1986 in Santiago City, Philippines and passed away on September 30, 2012 in New Westminster, B.C.

January was the victim of multiple stab wounds. The incident was covered extensively in the local and national media across Canada. A grassroots, community driven, “Justice for January” march followed shortly afterwards.

January was the Social Coordinator of Sher Vancouver. She was the first transgender person to hold an Executive position with the group. Sher Vancouver is a social, cultural, and support organization for LGBTQ South Asians and their friends, allies, and supporters. Everyone is welcome in Sher.

Being the life of the party, January would make everyone laugh. A kind, caring, generous and loyal friend, January was a great singer and dancer. She was known as our very own "Beyonce."

January had many challenges and struggles as an immigrant, as a person of colour and as a transgender woman living in poverty. Nonetheless, she was a bright light and shining star in Sher Vancouver. She was a fabulous MC on our Pride of Bollywood float in the Vancouver Pride Parade and the Bang Bang Bollywood club nights.

Not a day goes by that January's friends don't think of her. We miss her and we all know that she is watching over us like an Angel in Heaven.

Sher Vancouver and January’s friends are setting up this fund to establish the January Marie Lapuz Youth Leadership Award.

Anyone from anywhere can apply for this annual award which will be bestowed upon a deserving youth, between the ages of 16 to 30, who has demonstrated involvement, commitment, and leadership in the LGBTQ community whether locally, nationally, and/or internationally.

Please note a person of any gender or sexual identity will be welcome to apply for the award, as well as a person of any race, culture, or background. This includes our “straight” friends and allies. Sher Vancouver is an inclusive organization that works hard to build bridges between diverse people and communities.

The interest from this fund will be paid out as a cash prize to the award recipient every January (of course) starting in 2016. To help get this legacy award off the ground, Sher Vancouver will contribute a minimum of $250.00 towards the cash prize every year.

The award recipient will also receive a Certificate signed by the Founder and Moderator of Sher Vancouver and will be profiled on the Sher Vancouver website and social media sites. A press release will be also sent out to local and national media.

We hope you will assist us in helping to establish this legacy award in honour of the fabulous January Marie Lapuz.

For more information on January check out:  http://amherstcremation.com/memorials/lapuz.html

TAX DEDUCTIBLE RECEIPTS 

If you would like to make a large donation of at-least $200.00 or more please email shervancouver@hotmail.com and we will provide you with instructions on how to donate and receive a tax deductible receipt.

story:
We're currently in the studio working on our 2nd CD project with an anticipated release date of May & need your help!  JBSL has been hard at work for some time writing new song and searching for material and WE ARE READY!  

Our first project, Blue Side of Me was released on Mountain Fever Records in July 2013 and has done really well for our debut project.  However, it is past time to get CD #2 out.  We have already completed two studio sessions and are very excited about the progress and feel that ya'll are really gonna like it!

We are pleased to have Wayne Taylor from Blue Highway and Jeff Mathis from Mathis Sound & Recording helping Jeff to co-produce this project.  We are hoping for an anticipated release date of May 2015.

Your donations will help pay for studio time, mastering costs and production of the CD.  If we exceed our goal, the extra funding will go for additional expenses incurred such as artwork & cover design, promotion and distribution.  We have given alot of thought to the perks that you can receive for contributing to our project. 

Thank you ya'll in advance for your support!

story:
Crawling Spider 

The songs of Mike Montgomery


A tribute to the talents of singer-keyboardist Michael John Montgomery, and special salute to the sounds of Paul Kossoff.


Alan Merrill, Bill Leverty, and Terry Wilson talk a bit about the project, why Mike should be honored with a tribute, and why NOW is the time in the video below. 


By recording my Dad's songs with the incredible musicians we have on-board, I hope not only to honor my father’s memory, talent and love of rock and roll, but to connect his past to our present by creating a true musical statement. We will be revisiting the various chapters in my father's career, recording the songs true to their original intent, but with a modern twist for 2015. 

.

 Now is the time! 

* 2015 is the 40th anniversary of Back Street Crawler's album 'The Band Plays On'

* 25 years since my Dad (Mike Montgomery's) passing 

* 40 years since for Paul Kossoff's death 


I look forward to sharing this journey with all of you, culminating with the album's release this summer. 


Grab yourself some incredible tunes and your choice of awesome perks/gifts (found on the right) by making a pledge/pre-order today!


All net proceeds over the final production budget will be donated to the American Cancer Society.




Working album title: "Crawling Spider: A Tribute To The Songs Of Michael Montgomery"  (Dad's nickname was spider, and he was in the band Back Street Crawler.)  This album is a project that is a long time dream that Tony, Terry, and I have been trying to get together for years but the stars have not aligned until now. 
The project is a tribute album to the fantastic songs that were written by my father when he played with Paul Kossoff (ranked the 51st greatest guitar player of all-time by Rolling Stone Magazine) and other amazingly talented musicians and bands . The songs will be re-recorded by former band mates, friends, and those that my Dad may have influenced through his songwriting. 


Mike Montgomery 

Songwriter, Keyboards, Vocals 

Recorded with with Johnny Nash, David Bowie, Blood Sweat & Tears. Moved to London from New York to form Back Street Crawler with Paul Kossoff in 1975. Left Crawler in 1976 and recorded solo album with an all-star cast of friends (Thin Lizzy, Blood Sweat and Tears, Meatloaf, etc...).  Past away in 1991 after a hard fought battle with Lung Cancer. 

Full Bio Available at:

https://www.bandpage.com/crawlingspider


Here's a little taste of the rough mix from the first sessions!

(This is rough, i.e. not mixed or mastered, it's missing keyboards, fixes, etc...)




We are offering a wide-variety of perks to fit all budgets, please take a look at the right to see all of the items that are available with your pledge and pre-order. Here are some of the featured items...




The band that's ready to go into the studio if we meet our funding goals! (final lineup may change)

Tony Braunagel
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tony_Braunagel

Terry Wilson
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terry_Wilson_%28musician%29

Terry Slesser
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terry_Slesser

Teresa James 

http://www.teresajames.com/bio-v2.htm

Robbie Wyckoff

http://www.robbiewyckoff.com/main/?page_id=18

Billy Watts
http://www.allmusic.com/artist/billy-watts-mn0000678930/credits

Johnny Lee Schell
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Johnny_Lee_Schell

Alan Merrill

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alan_Merrill

Bill Leverty

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bill_Leverty

Jimmy Kunes

http://www.reverbnation.com/jimmykunesband

Bruce Kulick
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bruce_Kulick

Bob Kulick
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bob_Kulick



This record is being produced independent of any record label, so every dollar raised by this campaign is going directly towards the budget (with ALL net proceeds going to American Cancer Society). Crawling Spider has been in development for ages and many variables have changed over the years. The diverse locations, timelines, and artists have impacted the overall budget tremendously. We have an incredible group of musicians  that we're really excited about, including original Back Street Crawler members Tony Braunagel, Terry Wilson, and Terry Slesser. We need the money that we’re asking for to make the album we want to make. If we weren’t crowdfunding, we would have to cut out songs and musicians that we feel really need to be on the record. That’s why we’re here on Indiegogo and that’s why 100% of the money raised by this campaign will go towards making this record the best album it can possibly be. 




We estimate the total cost of the project to be $35,000.  

All net proceeds over the final production budget will be donated to the American Cancer Society.

Below is a rough breakdown of expenses:

PHASE 1-  $6,000 (almost 70% there!)

Studio 2 days @ 500 =  $1000
Musicians 4 @ 500 per day - 2 days  =  $4000
Vocalist  @ 500 per day - 2 days = $1000

PHASE 2- NOT FUNDED $12,000

Studio 4 days @ 500 =  $2000
Musicians 4 @ 500 per day - 4 days  =  $8000
Vocalist  @ 500 per day - 4 days = $2000

PHASE 3- NOT FUNDED
$5000 mixing
$1500 Mastering

PHASE 4 - NOT FUNDED
$3000 CD duplication initial run (full color digi-paks with booklet)
$1500 Music Licensing
$6000 fulfillment of rewards, Indiegogo fees, Marketing/PR, Other Misc Costs


Other Ways You Can Help

You say there is no way you can afford to contribute financially but you want to help! YOU CAN! Share, Share, Share! Tell all your friends about this campaign on Facebook, shout out on twitter, make a video about it and we will put it on our social media, lets make some noise! All these things help us get the exposure we need to accomplish our goals! You have no idea how much that means to us! Check out the Indiegogo share tools available for other sharing options


Thank you for your support!


Risks and challenges

This project is especially close to my heart and I feel absolutely confident that we'll succeed in completing the album provided the necessary funding is obtained.

Crawling Spider has been in development for ages and many variables have changed over the years. The diverse locations, timelines, and artists have impacted the overall budget tremendously. We have an incredible group of musicians  that we're really excited about, including original Back Street Crawler members Tony Braunagel, Terry Wilson, and Terry Slesser. We need the money that we’re asking for to make the album we want to make. If we weren’t crowdfunding, we would have to cut out songs and musicians that we feel really need to be on the record. That’s why we’re here on Indiegogo and that’s why 100% of the money raised by this campaign will go towards making this record the best album it can possibly be.

PHASE 4 - NOT FUNDED$3000 CD duplication initial run (full color digi-paks with booklet)$1500 Music Licensing$6000 fulfillment of rewards, Indiegogo fees, Marketing/PR, Other Misc Costs


Other Ways You Can Help
You say there is no way you can afford to contribute financially but you want to help! YOU CAN! Share, Share, Share! Tell all your friends about this campaign on Facebook, shout out on twitter, make a video about it and we will put it on our social media, lets make some noise! All these things help us get the exposure we need to accomplish our goals! You have no idea how much that means to us! Check out the Indiegogo share tools available for other sharing options

Thank you for your support!


Risks and challenges
This project is especially close to my heart and I feel absolutely confident that we'll succeed in completing the album provided the necessary funding is obtained.

story:
It started in the late summer of 2012. Peeling Grey was performing as a trio for a couple shows in Texas. On the way back to California, unknown to us at the time, the seeds were planted for "Our Sky's Falling". 

Roadside memorials seen along the way inspired the first song ("Flowers for the Dead) for "OSF". But, it wasn't a smooth transition to get to where we are now. Putting together this campaign and finishing our second full length album has been no easy task.  Some personal hardships and line up changes would occur before all the pieces were set in place to really move forward.

Brad Hartman (drums) and Dave Skott (bass) answered the call for a much needed reinvention of Peeling Grey in 2013. Now, we were truly ready to get the band back on track and write a new album. Since then we released a self-financed video and single ("Rumors"), played across California, Nevada, reached Chicago and even Germany last year. 

So, why a full length album and not just another EP or single? The answer is very simple; We have an elaborate story to tell and we ask for your help to make that come true. From the drive back from Texas, the degrees of loss we experienced, death, transition, to matters coming full circle with a sense of hope again, the full length route is still relevant. It's the best way of presenting the current batch of songs in a manner that will do them justice. It's a concept album, so to speak. Above all, it is to be enjoyed by our fans, friends, and anyone that can relate. Your contribution will mean the world, and we vow to make it worth every dollar.

Here's a breakdown of the cost in making this album. If you choose to hop on board, you should know how you're helping us.

$2500 - Vinyl (due in the fall of 2015)

$1600 - Production / Engineering Costs

$1200 - CDs (Release date June 25th)

$1000 - Studio time (Surplus Studios)

$800 - Mastering both for CD and Vinyl

$500 - Promotions (internet & print)  

Total= $7600 

As you can see, the cost of vinyl is on top of the list. This will be our first release on that format, and from what we understand many of you have either asked for a PG vinyl pressing or been enthusiastic about the prospect. The vinyl version will offer alternate artwork and a slightly different track listing.

We want to give you what you want. With enough of cash, we can certainly deliver. Due to a backlog / high demand the LP version would be ready in the fall. The CD and digital formats are scheduled to be officially released on June 25th, accompanied by a local record release party. We'll play the entire album in track order and in its entirety that night. 

Since 2008, when Naren and I started this group, you've seen us grow as musicians, performers, and maybe even as people. We always had the intention to do our own thing while connect with the scene and those who listen. We always believed in writing and releasing music that is sincere. Your interest and support in what we do has been key to even having a conversation about a second PG album. Wherever you are, whether you've seen / met us or not, this is the place to show you want to see "Our Sky's Falling" become a reality. 

For a few reasons we feel this is our best work yet, a cliche we know, but we mean it and we feel it. We are still an independent band, and have always financed and been in control of everything we do. However, with the ambition and scope we have in mind for "OSF", we finally need your help. The process of writing and making this album has come a long way with a few sacrifices. It's now your turn to play an important role in what we love doing the most.

   Sincere Thanks,

 ~Andy, Naren, Dave, & Brad

   Peeling Grey
story_txt:
It started in the late summer of 2012. Peeling Grey was performing as a trio for a couple shows in Texas. On the way back to California, unknown to us at the time, the seeds were planted for "Our Sky's Falling". 
Roadside memorials seen along the way inspired the first song ("Flowers for the Dead) for "OSF". But, it wasn't a smooth transition to get to where we are now. Putting together this campaign and finishing our second full length album has been no easy task.  Some personal hardships and line up changes would occur before all the pieces were set in place to really move forward. 
Brad Hartman (drums) and Dave Skott (bass) answered the call for a much needed reinvention of Peeling Grey in 2013. Now, we were truly ready to get the band back on track and write a new album. Since then we released a self-financed video and single ("Rumors"), played across California, Nevada, reached Chicago and even Germany last year. 
So, why a full length album and not just another EP or single? The answer is very simple; We have an elaborate story to tell and we ask for your help to make that come true. From the drive back from Texas, the degrees of loss we experienced, death, transition, to matters coming full circle with a sense of hope again, the full length route is still relevant. It's the best way of presenting the current batch of songs in a manner that will do them justice. It's a concept album, so to speak. Above all, it is to be enjoyed by our fans, friends, and anyone that can relate. Your contribution will mean the world, and we vow to make it worth every dollar.
Here's a breakdown of the cost in making this album. If you choose to hop on board, you should know how you're helping us. 
$2500 - Vinyl (due in the fall of 2015)
$1600 - Production / Engineering Costs 
$1200 - CDs (Release date June 25th)
$1000 - Studio time (Surplus Studios)
$800 - Mastering both for CD and Vinyl
$500 - Promotions (internet & print)  
Total= $7600 
As you can see, the cost of vinyl is on top of the list. This will be our first release on that format, and from what we understand many of you have either asked for a PG vinyl pressing or been enthusiastic about the prospect. The vinyl version will offer alternate artwork and a slightly different track listing.

Since 2008, when Naren and I started this group, you've seen us grow as musicians, performers, and maybe even as people. We always had the intention to do our own thing while connect with the scene and those who listen. We always believed in writing and releasing music that is sincere. Your interest and support in what we do has been key to even having a conversation about a second PG album. Wherever you are, whether you've seen / met us or not, this is the place to show you want to see "Our Sky's Falling" become a reality. 

For a few reasons we feel this is our best work yet, a cliche we know, but we mean it and we feel it. We are still an independent band, and have always financed and been in control of everything we do. However, with the ambition and scope we have in mind for "OSF", we finally need your help. story:
Unsere Geschichte

"12 Yards" ist ein Musik- und Tanztheater welches von uns," Lukulule", einem gemeinnützigen Verein aus Hamburg, präsentiert wird. Zusammen mit fünfzig Hamburger Jugendlichen und jungen Erwachsenen im Alter von 13 bis 25 Jahren wurde das Stück in einem Zeitraum von ca. 18 Monaten entwickelt.

Im Rahmen dieser Arbeit konnten die jungen Talente einen künstlerischen Ausdruck für eigene Erlebnisse und individuelle Konflikte finden. Unter professioneller Anleitung haben sie diese Alltagserfahrungen zu szenischen Texten und Songs verdichtet und einstudiert.

Aufgeführt wird "12 Yards" mit 6 Shows auf Kampnagel im Rahmen des Youngstar Festivals im April 2015, was für die beteiligten jungen Menschen eine Herausforderung und wunderbare Erfahrung auf der "großen" Bühne bedeutet.

Unser Anliegen

Wir starten diese Kampagne um alle Songs, welche über lange Zeit gewachsen sind und allen persönlich sehr am Herzen liegen, nun in einem Studioworkshop zusammen mit der "Kreativwerkstadt Hamburg" aufnehmen und festhalten zu können. Um den Workshop, die Studiokosten sowie die Pressung und Booklet zu bezahlen benötigen wir dringend Unterstützung. 

Mit ihrer Hilfe kann das Team gemeinsam weiter arbeiten und die Songs werden mehr Menschen erreichen als es über die Aufführung möglich ist.

Für alle Beteiligten am Projekt wäre die CD sowohl eine Erinnerung an die gemeinsame Zeit und auch zugleich Motivation für weiteres kreatives Schaffen.

Wir würden uns sehr freuen wenn Sie diese jungen Talente und ihre Ideen unterstützen. Zusammen machen wir es möglich!

Vielen Dank.

story:
Hello friends and potential backers.  My name is George Douglas and I'm in the process of making my first ever album called Music From Big Muddy.  It has been recorded and I believe it is being mastered as I type this. Soon it will be pressed and ready for your listening pleasure.  I never dreamed that I'd do an album and I'm so excited!


     I see (and contribute) to more and more crowdfunding requests as the months go on.  I have been a big supporter of independent music in clubs, halls and folk festivals for years.  I buy a lot of CDs at these shows and many more from websites, and lately from these campaigns.  I'm offering perks that are a good value for your dollar and stuff that I'd be interested in too!

The money contributed will cover the cost of paying the producer, the musicians, mastering and reproduction of the compact discs and the cover.  Brock Zeman made me feel at home in the studio and guided me through the process of laying down the basic guitar and vocal tracks.  I love the sounds he gets on his albums and when I heard Tom House's album: Winding Down The Road a couple years back, I knew if I ever recorded an album, I'd want Brock at the helm.  He used his band: Dylan Roberts on drums and Blair Hogan on guitar, mandolin & piano.  They did a fantastic job!  It is being mastered by Steve Foley at audiovalley and I have yet to choose where it will be reproduced.


   I recorded the album at Big Muddy Studios at Brock Zeman's place in the wilds of Lanark County in Eastern Ontario.  Driving out to his place I was reminded of the roads that lead to Big Pink outside Woodstock, New York, where the Band recorded their seminal album Music from Big Pink.  I was lucky enough to get to a few Midnight Rambles down there before Levon passed and I loved the whole feeling and mojo in that area.  The similarities in the terrain and the way Brock, Blair Hogan and Dylan Roberts added to my songs in the studio at Big Muddy led to the name.  I've spent all my life in Woodstock, Ontario - which is a half hour drive from the hometowns of all The Band members except Levon Helm. 

      I grew up listening to classic rock but am old enough to remember when FM radio was born, before commercials and formats and playlists; when blues and country, prog rock, Celtic  and African drumming would be played one after each other in an eclectic mix.  If I had to label my songs they'd probably fall under the Americana umbrella, which seems to encompass roots, blues and folk.  

   One of the songs on this album was started when I was a teenager, but most were written in the last  18 months..  In October of 2013 I attended Lori Yates' Creative Genius Songwriting Workshop in Hamilton, Ontario.  We wrote songs, recorded them in a studio and performed them in a club, all in six weeks!  I found a diverse group of musicians, a very supportive community, a ton of laughs and fun.  I went back in February 2014 and wrote some more.  

 The Perks -  I have more than enough tee shirts in my cupboard at home so I'm not offering one here, but I am offering a piece of clothing that is cool and Canadian - a toque!  I am going to clean  the closet and offer a few vintage (read pre-worn) tee shirts along with the CD too.  I can't bear to give them to goodwill but I do need to thin out the herd too.  The shirts will be in the descriptions and I'll try to post pictures on my band/musician page on Facebook.  These shirts are one of a kind so take a look.  I am also a sticker ho and have a couple guitar cases and one mandolin case covered with them.  There's nothing I love more than getting a new sticker for them so I'm creating and offering 3 of them as perks.  One of them will feature artwork by my amazing artist friend Pokey Karol.  I have many Fred Eaglesmith tee shirts and posters featuring Pokey's artwork as well as stickers for Audrey Auld and Washboard Hank on the cases.  Speaking of Fred, one of the unique perks is his first album Fred J. Eaglesmith on vinyl.  They didn't make too many of them so it is rare!.  Photos of tee shirts at: 
https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.10153...

 Please feel free to share this with anyone and everyone.
Thanks!

Thanks!

story:
The Las Vegas Jazz Connection under the direction of Nathan Tanouye is eight years old now. It began as an experiment to see if my late husband pianist/composer Russ Freeman's music could be perpetuated in a style that reached out to new and younger listeners. Nathan and I found each other and created our first CD "Crossings" which took Russ' bebop tunes arranged for big band and The Las Vegas Jazz Connection was born. Since then we have released two more CDs "Remembering Russ" and "11".

The Jazz Connection members are all first call musicians and play in many of the shows here on the Strip. We have become a family and are very proud of the work we have produced. Our next project is "the Las Vegas Suite" composed by Nathan in collaboration with Clint Holmes. We need your support for this project. I am so fortunate to be in collaboration with so many great musicians. I feel it is my responsibility to repay all the musicians who have shared their music with me. 

As Russ would say, "Music is forever"...

story:
Be a part of SOA's European tour, documentary & recording!

Hi, this is SOA, the Toronto-based jazz world trio featuring jazz piano, African percussions and soulful vocals.

We've been around since the end of 2011, playing mostly in Québec and Ontario, releasing an EP in 2012 and a first music video in 2013.

2015 is a milestone for us:  we have recorded part one of our first upcoming album and we have the opportunity to bring SOA to Europe to play in some exciting venues, to record the second part of the album and to become the subject of a documentary.

Those are huge steps for the band which is why we need your support to be able to make it happen! 

REFLECTIONS, the tour

The tour will bring us to Germany and France. For now, we have confirmed dates in Vannes in Britanny, Paris, Heilbronn, Stuttgart, Berlin. We will be joined by amazing French jazz pianist Sylvain Ransy, whom we know from his time in Montreal.

REFLECTIONS, the recording

Touring is always the best opportunity to get a good creative vibe together as well as to sharpen the sound. This is the reason why we want to use the energy of the tour to record the second part of the album with Sylvain Ransy in Europe.

REFLECTIONS, the documentary

We were thrilled when film-maker Andreas Krätschmer, our long-time collaborator, proposed to join us on the tour and make us the subject of a short documentary. The film will be screened in Montreal and Toronto in the fall 2015 and we plan to submit it to festivals.

Your support goes to...

We take a giant leap of faith and are setting out to raise enough money here to cover expenses for the trio and our filmmaker. Here's what your contributions will go to:

  • Travel expenses (international and domestic)
  • Accommodation: crew gotta sleep!
  • Food: crew gotta eat!
  • Equipment and music instruments rental
  • Recording studio

Even your smallest contribution can make a big difference for us!

What you get out of it

First of all, you get a good feeling of helping an independant Canadian jazz band ;-) Then, of course, we have perks: check them out on the campaign page! There is something for everyone.

Other Ways You Can Help

Money makes the world go round but sharing and communication make our world brighter! Even if you can’t afford to pledge monetarily, your help is still very much needed and appreciated. Please talk about the SOA crowdfunding campaign and share the link to this page everywhere you can. Tell your friends on Facebook, Twitter, or in person during coffee breaks and evening drinks (lunch and brunch work as well)!

We, SOA, have been doing many things since we started in 2011 but nothing has ever been as EXCITING as this! Together with the help of each and every one of you, we will make REFLECTIONS, the tour, the documentary and the album a reality.

We can only do this with you!  Thank you so much for your support!

story:
OUR STORY

Opera Project Columbus (OPC) is a 4-year old company dedicated to keeping opera alive for future generations. Under the baton of our Maestro Alessandro Siciliani, opera stars of the future are given the opportunity to train and perform with one of the world's preeminent opera conductors to prepare them for performance with larger more established companies. 

Maestro Siciliani is the son of one of the great opera impressarios of all time, Francesco Siciliani of the La Scala opera house in Milan, Italy, and he has travelled the world conducting operas beginning in his native Italy and continuing on to the Met in New York City, and circling the globe. 

OPC has made all of the difference for our local performers. As Coral Owdum who you see in the photo below (and who you heard in our video above) says, "OPC was the encouragement I needed to make singing a top priority in my life again. A chance to learn and grow musically with great artists while allowing me to share the gift of music with others. "

So why support saving opera? As a cultural phenomenon, opera has existed in one form or another for over a thousand years. It has relevance for our everyday life helping us to better understand the eternal joys, triumphs, and absurdities of life. It is up to us to save this beautiful art form for the audiences of the future and not let it die on our watch!!! And YOU have the opportunity along with us to help pass opera on to the next generation by supporting OPC in our efforts to #SaveOpera!!!!


How You Can Help

We are in the process of funding season 5. While most opera companies have multimillion dollar budgets, we are keeping our costs way down. Our budget for season 5 is $100,000, and we have raised part of that, but we need another $40,000 to finish the job. 
Our operas will include The Barber of Seville by Rossini, Amahl and the Night Visitors by Menotti, and MacBeth by Verdi. We will perform at various venues around Columbus, OH including the beautiful McCoy Center in New Albany which will cost $6500. We will employ a variety of professional musicians along with college and high school students who will get paid on a sliding scale totalling around $20,000 per Opera. Our Artistic Director and Music Director also factor into our budget as do music rental, costumes, sets, advertising costs. All of this adds up to our annual budget, and all of this money will be spent locally here in Columbus, OH
 Working with OPC is a great resume builder, and our performers have gone on to employment in regional and national companies. With your help, we are turning our city into a major opera hub in the midwest.
You can read more about us on our website at
www.operaprojectcolumbus.org
But most of all, your support will ensure that opera, our great cultural heritage, will not die but will flourish for generations to come!!! Be part of our team and let's #SaveOpera!!!!

Receive Great Perks

Your generous contributions will receive some pretty exciting perks too, and for all of these levels YOUR NAME WILL BE IN OUR PROGRAMS FOR THE ENTIRE SEASON :
$5-------a thank you and updates
$10-----an "I helped #SaveOpera" button
$25-----a pastry from Laughlin's Bakery and an "I helped #SaveOpera" button
$50-----2 tickets to either the June 26 or 28, 2015 performance of Cavalleria Rusticana and an "I helped #SaveOpera" button
$100---a gift certificate to "Hair by Jeff Stuckey"
$250---a "Got Maestro" t-shirt, two tickets to either the June 26 or June 28 performance of Cavalleria Rusticana, admission to the cast party
$500---2 season tickets to the 2015-2016 season and all cast parties
$1000--2 season tickets to the 2015-2016 season, all cast parties, and dinner with the Maestro
$2500+--2 season tickets to the 2015-2016 season, all cast parties, and a private performance in your home


A New Model For The Future

In order to survive, the arts organizations of the future will need to be more nimble, more flexible, less top heavy, and must use local talent. In today's world, music education has never been better,  musicians have never been better trained, and there are tons of talented singers and instrumentalists of a caliber never before seen. 
OPC is a prototype of the future being able to produce top notch productions while keeping our costs low allowing us to thrive as we go forward. Not only will your contributions to OPC help us save opera, they will also help all of the arts to survive as we provide an operating template for the future. For all of us who love this art form, an investment with OPC will enable everyone else going forward access to this beautiful music. #SaveOpera with us!!!!


Other Ways To Help

Lastly, there is something else you can do to help our #SaveOpera campaign---------you can help us get the word out!!!! Send the link to this Indiegogo page to all of your friends, your email lists, and put it up on your facebook page, twitter, etc. You can also use all of the Indiegogo share tools. Let's make some noise and send the #SaveOpera campaign far and wide!!!!
