Our Artistic Director and Music Director also factor into our budget as do music rental, costumes, sets, advertising costs. All of this adds up to our annual budget, and all of this money will be spent locally here in Columbus, OH
 Working with OPC is a great resume builder, and our performers have gone on to employment in regional and national companies. With your help, we are turning our city into a major opera hub in the midwest.
You can read more about us on our website atwww.operaprojectcolumbus.org
But most of all, your support will ensure that opera, our great cultural heritage, will not die but will flourish for generations to come!!! Be part of our team and let's #SaveOpera!!!!



Receive Great Perks
Your generous contributions will receive some pretty exciting perks too, and for all of these levels YOUR NAME WILL BE IN OUR PROGRAMS FOR THE ENTIRE SEASON :

$5-------a thank you and updates

$10-----an "I helped #SaveOpera" button
$25-----a pastry from Laughlin's Bakery and an "I helped #SaveOpera" button
$50-----2 tickets to either the June 26 or 28, 2015 performance of Cavalleria Rusticana and an "I helped #SaveOpera" button
$100---a gift certificate to "Hair by Jeff Stuckey"
$250---a "Got Maestro" t-shirt, two tickets to either the June 26 or June 28 performance of Cavalleria Rusticana, admission to the cast party$500---2 season tickets to the 2015-2016 season and all cast parties$1000--2 season tickets to the 2015-2016 season, all cast parties, and dinner with the Maestro$2500+--2 season tickets to the 2015-2016 season, all cast parties, and a private performance in your home



A New Model For The Future
In order to survive, the arts organizations of the future will need to be more nimble, more flexible, less top heavy, and must use local talent. In today's world, music education has never been better,  musicians have never been better trained, and there are tons of talented singers and instrumentalists of a caliber never before seen. OPC is a prototype of the future being able to produce top notch productions while keeping our costs low allowing us to thrive as we go forward. Not only will your contributions to OPC help us save opera, they will also help all of the arts to survive as we provide an operating template for the future. For all of us who love this art form, an investment with OPC will enable everyone else going forward access to this beautiful music. #SaveOpera with us!!!!Other Ways To HelpLastly, there is something else you can do to help our #SaveOpera campaign---------you can help us get the word out!!!! Send the link to this Indiegogo page to all of your friends, your email lists, and put it up on your facebook page, twitter, etc. You can also use all of the Indiegogo share tools. Let's make some noise and send the #SaveOpera campaign far and wide!!!!

story:
Welcome to my campaign. My name is LaShia and I am an R&B artist and songwriter. For years, I have shared my gift and passion for singing for open mics, showcases and other artists as background to help to further their musical career, and I feel that it's time to further my own career. This is my FIRST album, one that has been anticipated for many years, even from myself, so it is important that I produced the best project possible. First impressions are lasting impressions. I need your help in funding my album. 

$3,500 is the goal. With this money, I will:

  • Book studio time
  • Obtain copyrights for the project
  • Enlist the best producers to capture my sound
  • Promote the album
  • Start video production for a few songs from the album
Once the album is done, I will be able to make it available at your fingertips on different digital retailers such as CD Baby, Amazon, ITunes, etc... We have 60 days to make this happen and I'm confident we will. However, if the goal is not achieved by then, no worries. The money raised will go towards the most important aspects of the album which are the studio time and producers.
I want to put out an album to share with all of you the gift that has been given to me. It would be selfish of me to keep it to myself. My mission  is to bring back the "feel" of R&B, meaning I want people to listen my music and actually be able to tap into their own emotions. I put all of me into every song I write and record and want people to feel that. It's so easy to just put out a catchy ballad, but I write from real experiences so every ballad has a story. I titled my project, "From My Pen, To Your Ears" because every song on the album will either be completely written or co-written by me, and, after going through the process of recording and promoting my album, the songs will reach your ears.

I understand the goal may seem like a lot, but I'm not asking for big individual donations. If everyone who believes in my cause contributed at least $5 or $10 each, the goal will be reached in no time. The only obstacle in my way of recording my album is the money to get it done. The songs are written and there are studios and producers on standby. No one works for free. Understand you are not giving me the money, you are investing in my project. When I win, we all win, so what are you waiting for? There are different ways to contribute. Donating money is one way of course but you can also spread the word to friends and family. Thank you for your time.

story:
Dear friends, fans and music lovers!  I have finished writing my third independent studio record, and I’m reaching out for support to help complete it. Here’s your chance to pre-order my new CD and show your support for Indie music!

In 2000 and 2010, I independently released records that connected with blues and blues-rock fans around the world, and for this I am very grateful. These records opened some incredible doors in terms of musical recognition, award nominations, critical success and international touring opportunities.

What I Need & What You Get

To fund this project I need to raise $15,000. The process of recording and creating a finished album is expensive. The costs include musicians’ fees, recording, mixing, mastering, artwork, pressing and packaging the CDs, travel expenses, distribution, tour dates in support of the album and equipment upgrades for my studio and live performances. 

I've put together some awesome perk packages to offer you for your contributions, such as album downloads, signed CDs and vinyls, Paul Black t-shirts, band gear, and a private house concert! Throughout the campaign, I will also be updating contributors on the recording as it unfolds.

The Impact

For me, as an independent artist, your contribution will make all the difference. The music industry has changed dramatically and record deals (especially in blues/blues-rock) are hard to come by. Fan support is critical. Together, we can create some incredible music and push the genre forward into the 21st century.

Anything I raise above the goal will be directed toward additional marketing, touring, and overall promotion of the record. This could include shooting a video, and pretty much anywhere else you will see or hear my music besides social media (e.g., via ads, movies, commercials, or even in bookstores). So the more backers, the better! I’ve had a lot of fun putting these perk packages together, and I can’t wait to see who gets involved.

When you give to this campaign, your funds are directly supporting the recording, mixing, mastering, and marketing of the latest Paul Black ALBUM, and all of the talented people who help make it happen! 

Other Ways You Can Help

I realize that times may be tough and you might not be in a position to make a financial contribution. That's ok, you can still help by sharing the campaign with others on social media.

Thank you for your help and I look forward to sharing the new record with you.

story:
In 2012  I recorded and released my first full length album- Unbreakable -  impressing critics and fans alike with the album's catchy tunes and authentic songwriting. On the strength of that one album I was invited to play Canadian Music Week 2012 and then invited back again the following year to play Canadian Music Week 2013 and North By North East.

Now two years later, and armed with over a dozen new songs I have created that are bound to make your head spin (in a good way), I am gearing up to record my sophomore album!

I've got an amazing band, who I had the pleasure of recording my first album with, and they are keen to help me do my  new songs  justice. We want to take this album up a level by doing bass and drum tracks at a bigger, quality studio.

And guess what – YOU CAN HELP MAKE THAT HAPPEN!


Your contributions will help me pay studio costs, production costs, mastering costs,  manufacturing costs and publicity cost so I can release my sophomore album in an organized and professional manner.  With this new album I hope to tour not only Canada, but to far off destination like London, Glasgow and the Netherlands where I have developed relationships with labels, radio hosts and fans.  With this new album I can approach managers and music festival bookers.  You don't have to worry about this album getting dusty in a cardboard box somewhere! I'm going to put this album to work for me, so your money will be well spent!

AND GUESS WHAT ELSE? The new record is going to be amazing! One reason why? I'm working again with producer  Mitch "King Kong" Girio formerly of the successful sca band King Apparatus.  Don't believe me (about the amazing part)?

You can preview the first single from the new album for free here:

https://soundcloud.com/melanie-peterson/melanie...



If you fancy yourself a fan of good, lyric driven songwriting – then you're gonna want to contribute to this campaign ! For your contribution you will receive a thank you in the album liner notes, and you will be rewarded with the "perk" of your choice- a personally signed copy of the album, a year's supply of bass player Peter Collins famous hummus, your own house concert ...I've developed quite a long list of perks for you to choose from!

You should also know, I'm getting regular airplay on the BBC in London and in Glasgow and have had spins on CBC in Toronto, Kitchener and Ottawa! Not to mention consistent spins on Mediazoic, the best internet radio station in Toronto! One recent on line reviewer said “Melanie Peterson is an authentic and talented woman, and Unbreakable is a solid debut album that clearly suggest tremendous potential. ”

Here is a video of one of those songs:


I hope you will consider making a donation and helping me reach that potential. 

I understand that not everyone has the means to contribute financially but you can still be a huge part of this project by getting the word out and sharing this campaign with your friends. Social media is the new record label and the best tool for exposure and eventual world wide recognition :-)

Hugs and mushy stuff!

Xoxo Melanie Peterson
http://www.melaniepeterson.ca
https://www.facebook.com/misswatermeloni

story:
Short Summary

Hi! I'm Malynda. Singer, Songwriter, Actress, Model, Host, Vegan, Wife, Businesswoman, Creator, Friend and Resident of Los Angeles. Trust me, I'm not bragging, just reminding myself that I do entirely too much!  :)

Thank you for taking time to learn about my Indiegogo campaign. For those of you who know me, you know that my music and performing my music is the most important thing in my life (after my husband of course!). I've had so many opportunities over the years that have given me glimpses of hope, but the truth is I've only succeeded in many areas of my career because of people like you consistently supporting me and pushing me to never give up on my dreams.

Opportunities have also come and gone in the blink of an eye. I could've easily given up and felt defeated or burned, but instead it made me work harder. This is one of those times. 

Making a radio-ready, high quality EP takes time, monetary resources and a lot of knowledge. I want this album to surpass any work that I've done in the past and I know that my current knowledge of the music industry will allow me to get the EP heard on a grander scale and reach a new demographic of fans. I also want the release of the EP to give other artists I support a chance to flourish. Whether I'm singing or creating a company, I want to be able to help and inspire people. Eventually my goal is to have an indie label. A place where I can help develop and build up careers of other indie artists who I believe in. A place where they can have control of their music and shine the way they are meant to. I can't express how much this project as a whole means to me as it truly is the foundation of a bigger dream.

What We Need & What You Get

Creating anything from the ground up takes time and a considerable amount of resources. Many don't know what it takes to create a great EP and have it heard, but I've listed below everything it takes to create, market and distribute a top-notch studio EP.

-Production/Engineering/Mixing/Editing

 It is my goal to work with producers who will bring out the best in my original music and help make my EP the best it can possibly be. The producers/engineers need to be compensated for their time spent bringing my music to life and getting it in the best shape possible.

-Mastering

Mastering is a crucial part to any record completion. It gives each track that final umph to make it sound radio ready, pristine, clean and perfect! I will be hiring one of the top mastering engineers in Los Angeles to master the full EP.

-Distribution

In order to get my music to the right outlets (iTunes, Amazon, Yahoo!, Google, Pandora, etc.), distribution is needed. Getting your music distributed through a qualified distributor is the best outlet. Nowadays most independent artists go through CD Baby or TuneCore to get their music heard but my goal is to get  distribution through a major distributor.

-Public Relations

You create the music, you get it on iTunes, it sounds amazing BUT it can't move mountains if no one knows about it! Which is why PR is a huge investment when it comes to getting music heard. For an EP to be released you need at least 6 months of PR to promote and create a buzz. I've worked with smaller PR firms before and done a bulk of the PR myself, but getting the backing of a PR firm with clout costs a good amount of money and they can make a huge difference in how your music is promoted and heard by the world. 

-Additional Elements

Additional funds will be used to create a music video for one of the songs on the album, as well as merchandise to help promote the EP even more. I will also be purchasing a select amount of download cards and physical CD's to sell at my live shows.

Perks & Rewards

There are 10 special perks and rewards I am offering to my contributors! I hope you will find them to be fun, exciting and worth it! 

I'm beyond grateful for any donation. I appreciate so much you taking an interest in my vision, art and career.

The Impact

Those of you who know me, know that helping people is one of my biggest passions. I will never shield information from others or question supporting someone for any reason. With that being said, music is my outlet and the way I want to reach people and the way I feel I can help the world. Additionally, any success I'm able to procure will only help further the careers of the people I believe in as well.  Being an indie artist is an incredibly difficult and taxing career choice. The uncertainty and the ups and downs can all weigh heavily on you when all you want to do is create music to reach people. If I'm able to do that and build a bigger career for myself, paying it forward is the next step.

Risks & Challenges

Raising a large amount of money in a short amount of time is ALWAYS a challenge and truthfully raising $15,000 for this EP will really only scratch the surface of what I need to make a great product, but it will make a significant difference.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate $5 I get it! There have definitely been times where my last $5 needed to go to a Subway sandwich. But there are still ways you can help that will make a HUGE impact:
  • Simply share my campaign with your friends and family! Sharing goes a long way and you never know who might want to donate to my project
  • "Like" My Facebook page www.facebook.com/malyndahalemusic, follow me on Twitter and Instagram: @malyndahale and subscribe to my YouTube channel www.youtube.com/malyndahale. It's a simple gesture that goes a long way. Engaging in social media is huge for any indie artist and by giving me one click of your time you could make an invaluable difference.
I love you all so much and I'm so incredibly grateful for your continued support of my dreams and aspirations!

Love and Blessings,
Malynda

Simply share my campaign with your friends and family! Sharing goes a long way and you never know who might want to donate to my project
"Like" My Facebook page www.facebook.com/malyndahalemusic, follow me on Twitter and Instagram: @malyndahale and subscribe to my YouTube channel www.youtube.com/malyndahale. It's a simple gesture that goes a long way. Engaging in social media is huge for any indie artist and by giving me one click of your time you could make an invaluable difference.

I love you all so much and I'm so incredibly grateful for your continued support of my dreams and aspirations!

Love and Blessings,
Malynda

story:
About Us

Girls Rock Camp is a weeklong camp where girls of all backgrounds come together to build confidence by creating bands. Spotify and Girls Rock Camp want to make sure every girl has the opportunity to attend, so we’ve sponsored scholarships for girls in seven camps around the US. Together, we can make sure every girl feels like she can rock. 

WHAT WE NEED

We’ve made it possible for 200+ girls to attend camps all over the US this year. Together, we can provide scholarships for another 25 more to attend Southern Girls Rock 'n Roll Camp in Nashville.  

$310 = 1 full scholarship.


THE IMPACT

At Girls Rock Camp, girls explore music, gain confidence, and connect with other girls from all backgrounds. And they do it by forming a band. A rock band (or hip-hop, or metal, or pop, or country). Then they rock hard.

There are camps all over the world, so every girl is invited.


Spotify sponsored eight Girls Rock Camps around the country: in San Francisco, Los Angeles, New York City, Chicago, Atlanta, Boston, Dallas, and now Nashville. We have an ongoing commitment to work with all of these individual camps to raise awareness for the great work they do.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can’t donate, don’t worry. Learn about this cause, and more, at Spotify.com/change. Spread the word about our campaign using Indiegogo’s sharing tools.

story:
ABOUT US

Spotify teamed up with History through Hip Hop (HHH) to use music that empowers the voices of young people in the Tenderloin neighborhood of San Francisco. Hosted in our SF office, young people at HHH take on a topic like gentrification or inequality and learn about multiple sides of the issue. They react to what they’ve learned, using their voices to express their opinions. They write original pieces of music, record them, and perform in front of their community.

WHAT WE NEED

This summer, HHH wants to send 10 of their students to a hip hop bootcamp with a major artist.  Donate below to get involved.

THE IMPACT

At History through Hip Hop, young people from the Tenderloin are given a space to express themselves through hip-hop art and culture: beat-making, lyric-writing, and graffiti art.

Spotify and History through Hip Hop work together in San Francisco to provide an inspiring space for young artists. Our San Francisco office hosts the program in the city and sponsors the students’ final performance at the Warfield Theater. We release an album of their work on Spotify, promote it with a donated media campaign, and all the proceeds are reinvested into the program.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can’t donate, don’t worry. Go to Spotify.com/change to listen to original music created by the young people at History through Hip Hop. Thanks to Rock the Cause Records, when you listen to this album, you support History through Hip Hop. Simply press play.
story_txt:
ABOUT USSpotify teamed up with History through Hip Hop (HHH) to use music that empowers the voices of young people in the Tenderloin neighborhood of San Francisco. Hosted in our SF office, young people at HHH take on a topic like gentrification or inequality and learn about multiple sides of the issue. They react to what they’ve learned, using their voices to express their opinions. They write original pieces of music, record them, and perform in front of their community.WHAT WE NEED
This summer, HHH wants to send 10 of their students to a hip hop bootcamp with a major artist.  Donate below to get involved.

story:
Thank you so much to those who contributed to this campaign. Because we are still far from our fund-raising goal, we have decided to do a 2nd campaign here http://igg.me/at/bennyoke/x/10098889 Please continue to keep us in your prayers.

VIDEO UPDATE #1 - PASTOR ALAN KISAKA

My name is Benny Oke and I am a Nigeria-born and Los Angeles based Worship Leader & Musicianary.

Following the release of my first album, "A Heart For The Nations", I am blessed and excited to have the opportunity of recording my first LIVE WORSHIP ALBUM!


I have already begun writing and arranging songs with an awesome team of producers, musicians and songwriters and we will be recording the album, LIVE on Friday, July 24th 2015 at Hope Chapel in Hermosa Beach.

I am asking for your contribution of any amount that will help me reach the goal of producing a professional-quality worship album.

To say thank you, I have come up with some awesome PERKS just for you!

Your support would mean the world to me and would go a long way in helping me make this awesome live worship project!

I CANNOT do this without YOUR help!

Look out for updates here as we go TOGETHER on this incredible journey!

What We Need & What You Get

Here is how the budget breaks down and the COOL perks you get for your contribution:

Recording (Producer, Singers, Musicians, Engineers, Gear rental, techs, etc.): $26,000

Album Advertising & Promo: $11,500

Mixing & Mastering: $5,000

Video Production: $7,500

Administrative Costs (Lodging, Transportation, Catering): $2,000

Perk Fulfillment (Estimate): $11,000

Indiegogo & Paypal Fees (Estimate): $6,300

Total: $69,300


Perks:

***Please note that T-shirt designs may not be final product***


Soon as we finish recording, we will be in the studio working on overdubs (smoothing out all the rough edges). Then we will start the process of Mixing and Mastering the album. I anticipate that the album will be ready to ship to you (before release, of course) sometime in October, 2015. As with projects of this kind, we may run into unforeseen delays that could push that date back! I promise to keep you in the loop!


    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't contribute, don't worry. You can still make your mark on this campaign by helping us get the word out. Please share this campaign with your family, friends or anyone you think might be interested in participating.
    Please share on Twitter, Instagram, Facebook and beyond! Just click the links on the top right corner to share, please.

story:
Le 25 avril, un puissant tremblement de terre ravageait le Népal, faisant plusieurs milliers de victimes, et plongeait les survivants dans une très sévère précarité. Ma bonne amie Sita est de ce nombre.

On April 25, a powerful earthquake ravaged Nepal, causing thousands of victims and plunged the survivors into a very severe insecurity. My good friend Sita is one of them.

Sita habite à Katmandou, à un jet de pierre de Durbar Square, haut lieu patrimonial et touristique de la capitale, qui a été outrageusement défiguré par le séisme. Avant même la catastrophe, Sita vivait déjà dans une grande précarité. Aujourd’hui, elle couche dans la rue ainsi que sa fille de 15 ans, Prajina. Son misérable logement n’a pas été détruit, si j’ai bien compris. En revanche, sa vétusté et les risques inhérents aux secousses secondaires le rendent trop dangereux pour qu’elle y ait accès.

Sita lives in Kathmandu, a stone's throw from Durbar Square, a high place of of heritage and tourism in the capital, which was outrageously disfigured by the earthquake. Even before the disaster, Sita was already living in very precarious conditions. Today, she and her 15 year old daughter, Prajina, sleep in the street. Her miserable housing was not destroyed, if I understand well. However, its age and the risks inherent to aftershocks risks make it too dangerous for her to access.

J’ai connu Sita en octobre 2008, suite à un premier séjour à Katmandou. Depuis, nous sommes d’excellents amis. En 2009, j’ai commencé à soutenir financièrement Prajina, sa fille, pour que celle-ci puisse continuer à aller à l’école. En plus de devoir vivre dans un des pays les plus défavorisés de la planète, Sita doit également se débrouiller avec moins que rien pour subsister. Son conjoint, qui habite un petit village éloigné de la capitale, ne peut l’aider. Pour y arriver, mon amie se fait vendeuse itinérante et propose des colliers aux touristes, à Durbar Square, en échange d’une maigre pitance.

I knew Sita in October 2008, following a first stay in Kathmandu. Since we are very good friends. In 2009, I began to financially support Prajina, her daughter, to ensure that she can continue to go to school. Besides having to live in one of the poorest countries in the world, Sita must also get along with less than nothing to survive. Her husband, who lives in a small town far from the capital, cannot help. In order to survive, my friend is an itinerant saleswoman and offers necklaces to tourists in Durbar Square, in exchange for a pittance.

Il est à peu près indéniable que le séisme va avoir des répercussions financières très néfastes pour Sita, car si ce n'est pas à court terme (besoin d'une nouvelle habitation), ce le sera à moyen et long terme, puisqu'elle est appelée à perdre son maigre gagne-pain, en plus de devoir survivre dans une ville et un pays en proie à une situation financière et sociale qui seront mises à rude épreuve dans les prochains mois et années.

Mon ami a toujours vécu durement et avec peu. Aujourd’hui plus que jamais…

Alors, si vous comptiez soutenir les victimes du Népal, puis-je vous inviter à le faire en prêtant assistance à mon amie Sita ?

Avec toute ma reconnaissance,

Daniel

There is almost no doubt that the earthquake will have very adverse financial implications for Sita, because if it is not for the short-term (need a new housing), it will be for medium and long term, since she is expected to lose his meager livelihood, in addition to having to survive in a city and a country plagued by a financial and social situation that will be severely tested in the coming months and years.

My friend has always lived hard and with little. Today more than ever.

So if you intended to support victims of Nepal, may I invite you to do it by assisting my friend Sita?

With all my gratitude,

Daniel

story:
The "First Picture"

The posting of the Cernettes picture on the web is a milestone, without which the web may not have been what it is today. In 1992, the baby Web was all about Physics. It contained formulas, engineering plans, official documents and other boring stuff. Until the Cernettes got on it!

This is the picture that opened the web to art/music/life.

25 years on, you have a chance to help the Cernettes get together again for a special Anniversary Gig.

The Cernettes and YOU

Five years ago, The Cernettes said good-bye to their fans. The band members went separate ways, and they are now scattered around the four corners of the world. We are raising funds to get them back together in Geneva, where the picture was posted, for a special anniversary concert that will be webcast live to all their fans.

Your contribution will be rewarded with anything between an autographed  Thank You note, a BlueRay Cernettes CD, or even a backstage invitation to the concert at CERN, in Geneva, and to the cocktail party to meet the band, plus an exclusive, dedicated video of their concert.

The Media Impact

The 20th anniversary of the posting of their picture triggered a media avalanche, resulting in thousands of articles and TV shows around the World. Google them to find out the extent of their fame in the Media. This reunion will have an even bigger impact, since the press is excited about their comeback. You can be part of this!

Tweet it, FB it, shout it!!

Shout out loud that "The Cernettes are coming back!" This is not just about music. It's about History, and you can be part of it!

Who are the Cernettes

The band beginnings is a true love story.

﻿﻿Once upon a summer there was a girl. She was a CERN secretary tired of waiting day and night for her permanently-on-shift physicist boyfriend, and so she decided to attract his attention by stepping on stage during the CERN Hardronic Festival to sing about her lonely nights in front of the entire CERN population. She asked her musician friend Silvano to write a song about her heartbreake, and a couple of girlfriends to back her up on stage. A few weeks later the Cernettes were on stage for the first time, for the delight of thousands of happy Physicists, singing Collider , the song that since that day became the National Anthem of the High Energy Kingdom.

In the years to come, the popularity of the Cernettes grew out of the valley of Geneva, to reach other nations and continents, as they performed in events such as International Physics conferences and The World'92 Expo in Seville. Silvano wrote many more songs and many singers and musicians came in and out of the band, each bringing a sligtly different flavour and taste, but the style of the band is solid and unique, and their fame grew larger and larger with every new gig, but they still have one problem: their boyfriends still spend their lives in night shifts.

How did their picture end up on the web

The Cernettes were invented at the same time, and a few offices away, from the World Wide Web. 

As the legend has it, one day of 1992, Sir Tim Berners-Lee, at the time a young computer scientist, walked in Silvano's office, with a new version of web server software to be installed onto the central VAX mainframes, which Silvano's team managed. He saw the picture of the CERN girls band on Silvano's mac, and suggested to post it on a new web page about CERN clubs and free time activities, that he was about to publish. The Web at the time counted only a few hundred sites, and a few thousand users, and Silvano was not quite sure how it worked yet, but he handed the gif file to Tim's student, who posted it. 

﻿That website had a high symbolic value, as for the first time a web page contained info about activities other that Physics. That was the page that opened the World Wide Web to music, arts, fun...  life!

story:
Short Summary 

       My name is Katie Buxton, I'm an indie folk singer/songwriter living in Nashville, Tennessee, and I'm recording my first full-length album! 

       These songs encompass things like questioning religion and why people only listen to what looks good. They're about letting go of what's no longer for you, about not taking life so seriously, and about looking inward for happiness first. They are not just for me - I'm putting these songs out into the world with the hopes that they encourage others to share their own truth and talk about the things that are honest and scary. I think people are really starving for music that's raw and intentional, and with this album I want to change that.

       With your help I can get these songs released and heard and make the release the best that it can be! 

*To preview the record and hear two songs that will be on it, check them out here: https://soundcloud.com/katiebuxton/sets/katie-b...

What I Need & What You Get

        My goal for this campaign - which I have to reach BEFORE March 18th - is $8,000. Recording is already underway, but this will evenly cover album artwork, physical copies, promotion costs, and merch, all of which is super important for a good release!

        As both incentive and a "thank you" for donating, I've included perks! Basically the more you give, the more you get in return. For example - if you contribute anything between $15 and $25, you will receive whatever is listed next to $15 on the right of this page. These perks include a copy of the album when finished, merch, a personalized song, and more. :) (*if you want to opt out of these perks and only donate, there is an option at checkout for that as well!)

       Even if I don't reach my entire goal, whatever money I do make will go towards what I can afford with it, whether it's artwork or physical copies - basically whatever I'm most in need of to get the album released!

Risks & Challenges

       If I don't meet my goal, I won't be able to fund all of the remaining parts of the album and release process and won't be able to promote it properly.  

Other Ways You Can Help

       Even if you can't contribute, you can still help! Share this link on social media and tell your friends, your family, your neighbor, your dog, and whoever else you can think of :) Basically, help me make some noise about this campaign!

      (At the top right of this page, there are links to share this campaign through Facebook and Twitter and to copy/embed the link to this campaign for all other sites)

story:
Hello!

I'm currently touring 50 shows in Europe, so I plan to create a campaign video from the road for you in April.   New album updates and short video clips will be available for supporters in the months to come. I'm so excited to share my new album journey with you!

For those of you who don't know me, I’m a Canadian Singer-Songwriter, and I live in an old farm house in Port Howe, Nova Scotia.  I live there with my super talented partner and music collaborator, Mr. Dale Murray.

Growing up my father had a bad-ass vinyl collection. Because of this I was influenced by iconic singers like Tina Turner, Michael Jackson, and Roy Orbison.   When I was 19 I moved to Austin Texas, where I discovered deep and honest kinds of music that were commonly referred to as 'Americana' and 'Alt-Country' (Wilco, The Jayhawks, Patti Griffin, Towns Van Zandt, Steve Earle, Shawn Colvin, Emmylou Harris).  I started on the open-mic scene in Austin until venues gave me and my friends our own gigs.   Since that time, my music has been colored by the places I’ve lived and toured, and the people who have shared their life experiences with me. I write songs inspired by my family, the landscape, and by my own heartache. I write songs about fear, anxiety, loss and other things I don’t really understand.

I’m recording my sixth full-length album with Dale Murray again, because we believe our work together gets stronger. Dale and I have loads of work to do in 2017 to finish this new album. My plan is to release a first single in June 2017, and the new album (10-11 songs) will launch in January 2018.  I wrote the first single ‘Lungs are Burning’ with Dale in the summer of 2017 after reading about our increasing overdose crisis caused by a synthetic opioid called Fentanyl.

Though I'm considered an ‘independent’ artist, and self-managed, I always work with a team of fantastic people to launch a new album.  Your support will be invested in one of the following areas:

Recording Expenses: Producer/Studio Fees

Album Artwork & Design

Marketing Pieces: Posters, Print Ads, and Merchandising

Manufacturing

Hiring Promotional Team in Canada, Germany, and United Kingdom

It’s an incredible opportunity to be able to deliver a new album and tour again.  Finances are the biggest challenge in any small business. Though the internet have opened many opportunities for artists like me, streaming music has made it even more challenging to earn revenue from physically selling music. I believe the BEST way for me to sustain, as a career musician, is to continue creating new music and video content, and to tour as much as possible to build lasting connections.

This new album is really important to me. The responsibility and privilege of being an artist, I do not take lightly.   With ongoing war, substances killing our family members and friends, division between people and nations, and mental and physical suffering, I believe in the healing power of music and stories, preaching about love, and building bridges. 

If you can’t fund the project, you can still help by SHARING this campaign on your social media with family and friends (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, phone call, shouting in the streets!!). Please use the Indigogo SHARE TOOLS!

THANK YOU!

Christina

(Photo By Scott Munn www.photomunn.com)
story_txt: Hello!I'm currently touring 50 shows in Europe, so I plan to create a campaign video from the road for you in April.   New album updates and short video clips will be available for supporters in the months to come. I'm so excited to share my new album journey with you!For those of you who don't know me, I’m a Canadian Singer-Songwriter, and I live in an old farm house in Port Howe, Nova Scotia.  I live there with my super talented partner and music collaborator, Mr. Dale Murray.Growing up my father had a bad-ass vinyl collection. Because of this I was influenced by iconic singers like Tina Turner, Michael Jackson, and Roy Orbison.   When I was 19 I moved to Austin Texas, where I discovered deep and honest kinds of music that were commonly referred to as 'Americana' and 'Alt-Country' (Wilco, The Jayhawks, Patti Griffin, Towns Van Zandt, Steve Earle, Shawn Colvin, Emmylou Harris).  I started on the open-mic scene in Austin until venues gave me and my friends our own gigs.   Since that time, my music has been colored by the places I’ve lived and toured, and the people who have shared their life experiences with me. I write songs inspired by my family, the landscape, and by my own heartache. I write songs about fear, anxiety, loss and other things I don’t really understand.I’m recording my sixth full-length album with Dale Murray again, because we believe our work together gets stronger. Dale and I have loads of work to do in 2017 to finish this new album. My plan is to release a first single in June 2017, and the new album (10-11 songs) will launch in January 2018.  I wrote the first single ‘Lungs are Burning’ with Dale in the summer of 2017 after reading about our increasing overdose crisis caused by a synthetic opioid called Fentanyl.Though I'm considered an ‘independent’ artist, and self-managed, I always work with a team of fantastic people to launch a new album.  Your support will be invested in one of the following areas:Recording Expenses: Producer/Studio FeesAlbum Artwork & DesignMarketing Pieces: Posters, Print Ads, and MerchandisingManufacturingHiring Promotional Team in Canada, Germany, and United KingdomIt’s an incredible opportunity to be able to deliver a new album and tour again.  Finances are the biggest challenge in any small business. Though the internet have opened many opportunities for artists like me, streaming music has made it even more challenging to earn revenue from physically selling music. I believe the BEST way for me to sustain, as a career musician, is to continue creating new music and video content, and to tour as much as possible to build lasting connections.This new album is really important to me. The responsibility and privilege of being an artist, I do not take lightly.   With ongoing war, substances killing our family members and friends, division between people and nations, and mental and physical suffering, I believe in the healing power of music and stories, preaching about love, and building bridges. If you can’t fund the project, you can still help by SHARING this campaign on your social media with family and friends (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, phone call, shouting in the streets!!). Please use the Indigogo SHARE TOOLS!THANK YOU!Christina(Photo By Scott Munn www.photomunn.com)

story:
Seguitemi...

 

  • Sono un compositore, arrangiatore, orchestratore, pianista jazz, cornista
  • Questo album è molto importante per me, poichè rappresenta una rinascita dell'anima e della persona. Non a caso cinque di queste tracce sono dedicate a una donna molto speciale alla quale vorrei fare omaggio di questo mio disco.
    Aiutatemi a realizzare questo mio sogno!
  • Da voi dipende la possibilità di registrare nel migliore studio di registrazione possibile, arginarne i costi e pagare anche le spese a tutti i musicisti.
  • La sala di registrazione costa 800 euro compreso missaggio e mastering, mentre le spese dei musicisti, provenienti da diverse regioni si aggirano complessivamente intorno ai 1400 euro.
  • Avrete il privilegio di ricevere un disco da voi finanziato con il grande Fabrizio Bosso!
  • Non è per me importante ricevere l'intera somma, ma ci terrei molto, così da poter pagare i musicisti e lo studio di registrazione.
  • Il progetto è realizzabile entro l'8 aprile poichè i musicisti sono già pronti e i 13 brani sono già depositati presso la SIAE, pronti per essere incisi in questo nuovo album.
  • Su spotify, Amazon, Google Play, Itunes ed altre piattaforme potrete trovare altri miei progetti musicali realizzati, tra cui, in primis, Another Day Will Come, un album molto differente da questo ma che pure si affaccia al mondo del jazz.
  • Cercando su Google Antonio Molinini troverete tanti lavori da me svolti al sefvizio della musica in collaborazione con diversi altri musicisti ed etichette discografiche varie.
  • Non prevedo ostacoli nell'incisione di questo disco, poichè è la diciannovesima incisione che mi riguarda, da che ho intrapreso questa carriera.
  • Non potete contrinuire economicamente alla produzione del disco? Non c'è problema! fate rumore, parlatene, pubblicizzate la mia missione, fatevi portavoce con amici e parenti!
  • condividete il link indiegogo e ve ne sarò grati!
story_txt:
Seguitemi...
 

Sono un compositore, arrangiatore, orchestratore, pianista jazz, cornista
Questo album è molto importante per me, poichè rappresenta una rinascita dell'anima e della persona. Non a caso cinque di queste tracce sono dedicate a una donna molto speciale alla quale vorrei fare omaggio di questo mio disco.Aiutatemi a realizzare questo mio sogno!
Da voi dipende la possibilità di registrare nel migliore studio di registrazione possibile, arginarne i costi e pagare anche le spese a tutti i musicisti.


La sala di registrazione costa 800 euro compreso missaggio e mastering, mentre le spese dei musicisti, provenienti da diverse regioni si aggirano complessivamente intorno ai 1400 euro.
Avrete il privilegio di ricevere un disco da voi finanziato con il grande Fabrizio Bosso!
Non è per me importante ricevere l'intera somma, ma ci terrei molto, così da poter pagare i musicisti e lo studio di registrazione.

Il progetto è realizzabile entro l'8 aprile poichè i musicisti sono già pronti e i 13 brani sono già depositati presso la SIAE, pronti per essere incisi in questo nuovo album.
Su spotify, Amazon, Google Play, Itunes ed altre piattaforme potrete trovare altri miei progetti musicali realizzati, tra cui, in primis, Another Day Will Come, un album molto differente da questo ma che pure si affaccia al mondo del jazz.
Cercando su Google Antonio Molinini troverete tanti lavori da me svolti al sefvizio della musica in collaborazione con diversi altri musicisti ed etichette discografiche varie.
Non prevedo ostacoli nell'incisione di questo disco, poichè è la diciannovesima incisione che mi riguarda, da che ho intrapreso questa carriera.
Non potete contrinuire economicamente alla produzione del disco? Non c'è problema! fate rumore, parlatene, pubblicizzate la mia missione, fatevi portavoce con amici e parenti!
condividete il link indiegogo e ve ne sarò grati!

story:
MAKE ANY PLEDGE OF $10 OR MORE NOW & GET THE ENTIRE ALBUM TODAY ON MP3!

Don't wait for 2 months to download "Hearts of Fire" on iTunes or stream it on Spotify.

Here's more on the project:

Over the last 27 years our mission has remained the same: "To reach the lost at any cost and make disciples of all nations."  When I started Christafari, my primary mission was to win souls.  And we've been winning souls for years. In fact, in 2016 alone we saw over 132,000 decisions for Christ – glory to God!

For decades our albums were primarily evangelistic.  In 2012 we released "Reggae Worship" and it literally started a "Roots Revival"!  We're so grateful for your support of our recent Worship, Christmas and Greatest Hits projects, but it's time to go back to our roots with what is arguably our rootsiest and most overtly evangelistic project to date.

THE DIFFERENCE:

  • ORIGINAL: What sets this album apart from our recent productions (apart from a bonus track that's our take on a traditional hymn), is it's 100% original.
  • ROOTICAL: On this project we collaborated on some seriously rootsy tracks with Kevin Kinsella (founder and former lead singer of John Brown's Body), Geneman, and Isaac Blackman.
  • VINYL: Hearts of Fire will be our first full-length 12” record.  It will include a vibrant, full-color jacket, all lyrics on the sleeve, and will even be pressed on red, yellow, and green marbled vinyl!
  • EVANGELICAL: This project follows the story of someone who comes to Christ and then slips away from the faith. Through Scripture-inspired roots tracks we follow them from their lowest point to being rescued and coming back to the Lord.
  • UNASHAMED: If you are looking for an album that is full of vague references of the Lord, this is not your project. This album is all about unashamedly proclaiming the name of Jesus Christ and bringing others to Him.
  • OVERT: We've heard of a lot of friends coming to Christ through our gospel presentation on "No Compromise"; this time we're including the Sinner's Prayer on the CD disc itself!
  • CREATIVE: Given all the creative collabs on this project, the sound is distinct and the artwork is incredible!
  • SCRIPTURAL: The main thrust behind these songs is the undiluted Word of God. In fact, many of the songwriting sessions were birthed out of Bible studies.
If I were to use one word to describe this project, it would be "compelling."  Our ultimate goal was to leverage all of our musical, poetic, lyrical, and artistic talents to bring someone to the Lord – to compel them to follow Christ.  The greatest tool for this, of course, is the Scriptures.
 
After Jesus rose from the dead and appeared to two of His disciples on the road to Emmaus they said, “Were not our hearts burning within us while he talked with us on the road and opened the Scriptures to us?”  We know that the greatest tool for setting a heart ablaze is the Word of God.  On "Hearts of Fire" you'll find Scripture quotes galore!  If you have a passion for reggae, reaching the lost, and the Word of God, then this is the perfect project for you.
 

What We Need and Why?:

While the recording is finished, there is still a lot yet to be done on this project. We still need to:
  • Manufacture CDs ($3,000)
  • Press vinyl records ($4,000)
  • Print promotional materials (such as shirts, stickers, posters, etc.) ($6,000)
  • Market and promote the album ($5,000)
  • Anything that we raise above $18,000 will go towards filming, editing and promoting as many music videos as possible.  This is the greatest expense but it's so worth it!  Did you know that our YouTube channel currently garners a million views each month?  This means that YouTube is our greatest platform for reaching the masses, and since we incorporate these videos into our concert presentations, music videos are one of our greatest tools for evangelism.

LET'S MAKE A DIFFERENCE TOGETHER

Do you believe in global evangelism?  Record sales and merchandising are two of the primary fundraising components of our ministry, and they enable us to share the gospel globally. 
 
Will you help us reach as many souls as possible with the good news of Jesus Christ through reggae music?  To help us accomplish this, we've created some awesome perks that we're sure you'll LOVE! And best of all, you'll get the entire album immediately on MP3 with any pledge of $10 or above! Talk about instant gratification!
 
Regardless, please help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign by using our Indiegogo share tools!

story:
The haunting spirit of 50s rock 'n' roll, the attitude and energy of 70s punk, and the melodic poetic sensibility of the 80s new romantics. Strangely reminiscent, guaranteed to strike a few heavy nostalgic chords, and yet at the same time, unabashedly original, unpredictable, and uncompromising. Ladies and gentlemen, we’re The Vigils.

But don't just take our word for it...

"The Vigils — Bursting out of the Los Angeles Rock 'N’ Roll scene with a sound that harkens back to mid-80s Damned (Phantasmagoria album) and Sisters of Mercy, replete with saxophones, night scenes, and sunglasses after dark. Vocalist/visionary/vampire Danny Cieplinski started the band back in 2012 with the intent to combine his love for cinema, punk rock, and new romantic dance music. The Vigils approach their sound not as a retro outfit, but from the heart, pulling from the everlasting influences of their youth." 

-Swedish Columbia                    

“Strongly reminiscent of The Doors, especially in the vocal delivery...The Vigils aren’t metal in the strict sense, but they’re very much the metalhead’s rock band.”

- Metal Assault

“The Vigils are an instinctive quartet with flair for grandiosity that touches upon the more sensible side of post-punk.”

-TheDeliMagazine.com 

"Watching you all play, I felt like I was back in New York City in 1978."

-Some guy in the audience

On April 23rd, 1976, the Ramones released their self-titled debut album for the ages, reigniting Rock ‘N’ Roll with a sonic potency that mined deeply from the past while simultaneously paving the way into the future. It cost Sire Records $6,400 to produce what has gone on to become a timeless and cherished classic, continuing to reach and inspire new audiences to this day. We believe that in 2017, a rock album of this magnitude is long overdue, and that we are just the ones to deliver it. Sure, it's a different time, things aren't what they used to be, and Sire Records ain't knocking on anyone's door these days. That is precisely why, dear folks, we need your help in order to make this happen. So please, for us, for you, for the children, the Ramones, and for the love of Rock 'N' Roll...

Any questions? 

Yeah. Why do you need $6,400?

Our recording and mixing cost is $4,500. $1,275 will cover a limited run of 500 CD’s, and the remaining $625 will help go towards additional production and shipping costs for all the other fine goods that we’re offering as incentives.

Wait, no vinyl? 

This is going to be the kind of record that you’re going to want to hold in your hands, staring at the front and back cover art and reading along to the lyrics the way many of you, like us, did as kids. So yeah, ultimately we definitely intend on a vinyl release. That however is an expensive undertaking and would require a few thousand more dollars for our campaign. We don't like asking for more than we absolutely need.

That said, if by some miracle we exceed our goal, or some high roller makes an extremely generous tax-deductible contribution to the arts (Hint! Hint!) Then yes, we will most certainly put that toward a vinyl release. Otherwise, we’re optimistic that a reputable independent label will be interested in working with us on that one. 

Any more questions? Well, further inquiries are always welcome at: thevigilsrockandroll@gmail.com

P.S. You can listen to our previously completed track off the forthcoming album now, "She's Gone", in the gallery section above. Recorded and mixed by the legendary producer Joseph Holiday. Also, if you enjoyed our pledge video, there will be plenty more of those along the way, so keep coming back.  And keep rocking!

story:
Short Summary

Hi. I am a composer, sound artist, researcher, improviser, and music educator, currently based in Japan. More about my activities here.

Back in 2013, I collaborated with the Korean artist Eunjung Hwang on a video animation entitled Future Creatures. 

After attending a screening of Future Creatures in San Diego, the percussionist Eric Derr asked me to write a piece based upon the audio and visual material of the animation. What followed was the piece fcremaperc, and several subsequent pieces for a diverse array of instruments and media, which would become the fcremap series. ("fc" = Future Creatures; "remap" = "re-mapping" to contrasting performance scenarios.) 

Despite stemming from the same source, the compositions comprising fcremap  tend in multiple directions: from the intimacy of inside of the piano to piezo-activated percussion to the voluminousness of ensemble and multi-channel electronics; from carefully crafted score to graphic/animated notation to improvisation. 

Over the past two years, I have had the privilege to work with a fantastic international group of esteemed performers in bringing these pieces to life. These artists have included the Belgian pianist Frederik Croene; violinst Takao Hyakutome and flautist Laura Faoro; Tokyo-based Taiwanese clarinetist Pei-Lun Tsai; and performer-composer-software designer collective Decibel New Music Ensemble, based in Perth, Australia. 

Fast-forward to 2017: now that the series has reached its completion, fcremap  is planned to be released on the innovative and dynamic artist-led label New Focus Recordings by the end of the year. Given the dominant role of visual media in cycle of pieces, this release will not only bring together spectacular and sensitive live performances, but also provide access to video downloads.

The listener/viewer will be able to experience all dimensions of the project--from the palpable physicality of the players to the immersive and stimulating visuals. 

What We Need & What You Get

 The recording and production for the album--usually the most expensive part of the process-- have already been completed. I am asking for your support in covering the costs associated with mastering, disc design, manufacture, and replication, and distribution (physical and digital). 

In an effort to share this release with as wide an audience as possible, the recording will appear in the Naxos of America catalog, and be available for purchase across most digital distribution platforms, as well as the New Focus website itself.   

Regardless of whether or not the funding goal of $3000 is met, the funds raised through this campaign will be directed exclusively towards the expenses outlined above. To guarantee that the recording is successfully released, any funding shortfall will be covered through personal funds. 

In return for your generosity, you will be offered a fine variety of perks. At every funding level from $10, you will be acknowledged in the liner notes of the recording, and receive a limited edition fcremap postcard. The album will be available for free digital download ($25) and in signed, physical form ($40). At the $60 level, I will also include a copy of my Nominal/Noumenal portrait recording, released in 2012. 

For $100, you get all of the above, plus a 1-hour VIP Skype composition lesson or interview. For top-level contributors ($250 and above), I will compose a new piece, dedicated to you!!

 

The Impact

In 2011, I ran a successful crowdfunding campaign in support of Nominal/Noumenal, my first portrait recording. Thanks to the generosity of the campaign's backers, not only have listeners across the world have been exposed to the pieces on the recording through radio play, digital streaming and downloads, and physical distribution at live events, but the release has also given rise to new projects and collaborations. I hope to achieve similar outcomes with fcremap. 

 Recording projects such as Nominal/Noumenal and fcremap are crucial not only as documentation, or as a means of bringing together internationally-dispersed members of contemporary arts and music communities, but also in broadening the community of listeners. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not in a position to contribute financially to this project, there are other ways in which you can help. Please spread the word about this campaign, and the eventual release. With Indiegogo's share tools, you can reach a broad network of project creators and followers. 

Thank you for your time! 

    Alex Sigman

Despite stemming from the same source, the compositions comprising fcremap  tend in multiple directions: from the intimacy of inside of the piano to piezo-activated percussion to the voluminousness of ensemble and multi-channel electronics; from carefully crafted score to graphic/animated notation to improvisation. 
Over the past two years, I have had the privilege to work with a fantastic international group of esteemed performers in bringing these pieces to life. These artists have included the Belgian pianist Frederik Croene; violinst Takao Hyakutome and flautist Laura Faoro; Tokyo-based Taiwanese clarinetist Pei-Lun Tsai; and performer-composer-software designer collective Decibel New Music Ensemble, based in Perth, Australia. 
Fast-forward to 2017: now that the series has reached its completion, fcremap  is planned to be released on the innovative and dynamic artist-led label New Focus Recordings by the end of the year. Given the dominant role of visual media in cycle of pieces, this release will not only bring together spectacular and sensitive live performances, but also provide access to video downloads.
The listener/viewer will be able to experience all dimensions of the project--from the palpable physicality of the players to the immersive and stimulating visuals. 

What We Need & What You Get
 The recording and production for the album--usually the most expensive part of the process-- have already been completed. I am asking for your support in covering the costs associated with mastering, disc design, manufacture, and replication, and distribution (physical and digital). 
In an effort to share this release with as wide an audience as possible, the recording will appear in the Naxos of America catalog, and be available for purchase across most digital distribution platforms, as well as the New Focus website itself.   
Regardless of whether or not the funding goal of $3000 is met, the funds raised through this campaign will be directed exclusively towards the expenses outlined above. To guarantee that the recording is successfully released, any funding shortfall will be covered through personal funds. 
In return for your generosity, you will be offered a fine variety of perks. At every funding level from $10, you will be acknowledged in the liner notes of the recording, and receive a limited edition fcremap postcard. The album will be available for free digital download ($25) and in signed, physical form ($40). At the $60 level, I will also include a copy of my Nominal/Noumenal portrait recording, released in 2012. 
For $100, you get all of the above, plus a 1-hour VIP Skype composition lesson or interview. For top-level contributors ($250 and above), I will compose a new piece, dedicated to you!!
 

The Impact
In 2011, I ran a successful crowdfunding campaign in support of Nominal/Noumenal, my first portrait recording. Thanks to the generosity of the campaign's backers, not only have listeners across the world have been exposed to the pieces on the recording through radio play, digital streaming and downloads, and physical distribution at live events, but the release has also given rise to new projects and collaborations. I hope to achieve similar outcomes with fcremap. 
 Recording projects such as Nominal/Noumenal and fcremap are crucial not only as documentation, or as a means of bringing together internationally-dispersed members of contemporary arts and music communities, but also in broadening the community of listeners. 
Other Ways You Can Help
If you are not in a position to contribute financially to this project, there are other ways in which you can help. Please spread the word about this campaign, and the eventual release. With Indiegogo's share tools, you can reach a broad network of project creators and followers. 
Thank you for your time! 
    Alex Sigman

story:
Short Summary

I played guitar and sang in old time trio, Triple Chicken Foot for over ten years. We recorded 3 albums all available on CDBaby or Bandcamp (or here as part of a perk!), hosted jams and dances and produced the Los Angeles Old Time Social. The band ended in 2015 when my marriage fell apart and banjo player Mike Heinle moved to Guernville. Born out of this double heartbreak, The Last Kind Word is my first solo record. Originally, I thought it would be a mix of originals and traditionals on the guitar and banjo. But I'm proud to say it's 100% original! There's acoustic guitar and banjo and electric guitar all recorded with Ben Townsend of Questionable Records who engineered and mixed the album. And, something exciting for me is I reconnected with my sound art past and crafted these short Interludes using field recordings of my surroundings, spoken word, electric guitar, synth, a banjo and even my Swedish journalist Uncle Jan's voice, discovered on a film he made in 1975! 

I collect records. I love vinyl and since picking up the guitar I've wanted to make a 12" long-playing, 33 RPM album. When I began thinking about making a solo project, that desire burned bright. I decided to go for it as a way to help pull me out of my blues when my pal Lisa Marr told me about this amazing residency though the Turkey Land Cove Foundation (TLCF) on Martha's Vineyard. "TLCF provides a quiet space for a woman to progress toward a defined goal, complete a project, and develop tools to propel her life in a new direction." That was me! My proposal to finalize songs for a solo album was selected. Thinking it would be a mix of originals and traditionals, I went in October for two weeks with some songs and sound works in progress and ideas for covers and came away with 10 original songs on guitar and banjo and 6 sound interludes.

My dear pal Ben Townsend offered to record it and as he is one of my musical heroes, I jumped at the chance to combine the trip east to go to Louisville, Kentucky where he was living at the time and lay down tracks for the songs. He played and sang on it too and on one of my favorite songs I love we dueted on banjo and that put me over the moon. Cheyenne Mize, an amazing musician in Louisville (she has her own solo stuff and plays with Will Oldham), played and sang on it and my travel buddy and Swiper the Dog's mom Ida Mae Specker (fantastic fiddler and singer from Vermont) was around long enough to add harmonies. Back in LA radical accordion and artist pal Erin Schneider laid down accordion on a track. Finally, I took a fun stringband tune down to 1642 Bar and had a buncha buddies come and lay down a ruckusy chorus. All in all, it's a unique reflection of some unique times and travels and the ups and downs of life and love. You gotta hear it!

By pre-ordering your digital or vinyl copy today, you are enabling me to place the order to press the vinyl and cover my recording costs. I would be so honored to have your support! 

What We Need & What You Get

My goal is to raise $5,895.00 This covers:

  • 500 Vinyl records with a 4 color sleeve and a double-sided 4 color insert that's like a poster, with a collage on one side and the lyrics on the other.
  • Recording and Mastering costs
  • Publishing and digital distribution
  • Photographer's & Musicians' fees (Everyone's contribution is valued.)

One of my favorite things about the LP perk is the insert. There's nothing I like more than listening to a record while looking at the artwork and reading lyrics, so I made this mini poster collage on one side and lyrics on the other. You might wanna hang it on your wall!

Another great perk is you can pick up an extra CD like one of Triple Chicken Foot's records or Ben Townsend and Friends album recorded at Deep End (and that I happen to play on.)

Or, if ya like zines and reading and graphics, get one of the remaining copies of my handbound book In the Service of the Song, a rumination on my love affair with old time guitar.

The most unique perks for you high rollers out West who want me nearby is a house concert in your town! Or your very own personalized sound interlude!

And lastly, there's just one of a kind for The Last Kind Word, the original watercolor painting that graces the cover of the album.

If I do not reach my entire goal, I will use whatever funds I raise towards vinyl production and the photographer and musician's fees.

The Impact

I think The Last Kind Word is worth supporting because I think music is worth supporting. If you believe, as I have learned, that the only way through this life is to surround yourself with Love and Truth (most especially your own) and song and laughter and dancing and furry friends, then you must get yourself a copy of this album for your online or vinyl collection.

Risks & Challenges

The risk and challenge now is getting the vinyl produced and then taking the time to get the songs out there through distribution, live gigs and your support. Putting your own songs into the world is one scary risk, but I feel like with everything I've been through in the last couple of years even just having the record on my own shelf is mighty fine.

Other Ways You Can Help

Times are tight. If you cannot order a copy now, you could help me get the word out about this campaign for The Last Kind Word.  I would be most grateful. (And can reward YOU if you let me know!) Use the Indiegogo sharing tools and social media-it up!

Thank you for your support!

story:
Contributing to this campaign means you will make it possible for us to continue to thrive as a band.  

We live to make music.  As a band, we've been able to get very comfortable onstage from the constant shows we've been playing.  From the every Friday residency we had over the summer at The Confession Box (RIP) playing for at least 3-5 hours a night, to the weeks of 8 shows in 7 days.  On the road, we've been blessed to meet so many incredible people that have taken amazing care of us.  Over Thanksgiving, we finally had the chance to record at a house in Connecticut with our own equipment, engineering it ourselves with industry-standard software.  We'd been talking about recording a new album.  It was a relaxing and great experience.  We had to get this song cycle down on record in order to move forward.  As contributors, you will enable us to release these songs effectively, to reach a wider audience of people who may have never even heard of us.  If you've come to a show of ours, or just enjoy our music, this is the best possible way to show your support and help us grow as a band.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

So basically, because we're independent musicians, we need your help with the costs of all these things.  Here's the breakdown of the costs:

Album Production - We recorded it, but we're having our producer Nick Barnes help us out with mixing, and our friend Nick Ciavatta is helping us out with mastering.  They don't work for free.
Merch Production - We need to buy all of the materials we need to make all of the merch that you can get by contributing (and/or at a show)
Vinyl Pressing - It's coming back, for a good reason, nothing like sitting down and just listening to a record.. but alas, it is not cheap.
Radio Promotion Campaign - We plan to work with a radio promoter who has said that he will send it to AAA & AMA stations across the country.
Travel Costs -  We've put a couple thousand miles on the travel-mobile (Home), and she needs some expensive repairs, which need to happen if we plan to go across the country.

These things are surprisingly expensive, and add up shockingly quickly.  Although all we want to do is make music for you, these are realities that we face as a productive, ambitious band, and we need your help to break through to the next level.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Perks

You get stuff too you know.  We'll be including T-shirts designed by Kyle Hazelton himself.  You'll be able to get a sweatshirt with said designs, or a copy of our first album "The Spaceman Cometh".  If you contribute enough, you could have us at your place, playing you a show and cooking you a meal.  We have two silk screens, with different designs, (which you can check out in the image gallery at the top) and we will be printing these custom shirts ourselves, specifically for you.  As such, you'll be able to choose the size and color of the shirt.  If you'd like a specific color ink for the design, drop us a line.  We want you to feel like you are a part of this, because you are.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

We're trying to do big things

We released our first album in 2015.  For that release, we spray-painted each CD case with a stencil that we made, burned all the CDs, and screen printed shirts ourselves.  We are no stranger to hard work.  This campaign seems like a logical next step, as the stakes are just getting higher.  You can play a part in us being able to produce the album, and share it with the country.  I'm pretty sure music is the thing we Travelers, collectively, care about most.  So you doing this is akin to buying food for a homeless person or something.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

If you want to help, but can't contribute, that's ok.

We get it if you're broke, no worries, but if you want to, you can still help us by spreading the word.  Share our campaign with someone, anyone you think might be interested.  You can also show support by coming to a show.  If you live in the NYC area, come to the double album release party at The Brooklyn Castle (www.facebook.com/TheBrooklynCastle), date TBA.  It will be a double release party with our friend Carissa Matsushima who recorded her material with us at the house in Connecticut.  Any show of support is hugely appreciated, and means the world to us, as it's hard to make a living making art.  All we can ask is that you make it possible for us to do this for you.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

To hear previews of some of the tracks from the new album, check out our website:
www.thetravelers.nyc

story:
Hello! Welcome to our campaign! We are two siblings and we have a band called Caravanchela. The band was born in Bogotá in 2013 and we are planning our first tour with our debut album that is called "Funky Feeling". 

¡¡Hola!! Nosotros somos Caravanchela, una banda Colombiana de Funk, Pop y Rock y necesitamos su apoyo para llevar nuestra música en una gira por México y Estados Unidos. La banda nace en Bogotá en el 2013 como el proyecto de vida de 2 hermanos y hemos tenido la oportunidad de compartir escenario con artistas de talla nacional e internacional, llegando así  a tocar en algunos e los escenarios más importantes de nuestro país.

A few days ago we received the news of being selected from more than 8000 bands around the world to be part of the South By South West festival line up that will happen in March of this year in Austin Texas: It's a very important festival! We want to take this opportunity with the whole band to make the festival our first stop on the tour of our debut album “Funky Feeling” that goes through the United States and Mexico.

Hace unos días recibimos la noticia de haber sido seleccionados entre más de 8000 bandas alrededor del mundo para hacer parte del line up del festival South By South West que va a ser en Marzo de ese año en Austin Texas: ¡¡es un festival muy importante!!

 

We are going to seize the invitations we have and we will be playing in Austin, Los Angeles, Philadelphia, Miami and in Mexico we will be in Mexico D.F, Guadalajara, Tuxtla Gutierrez, Zacatecas and Tijuana.

Queremos aprovechar esta oportunidad con toda la banda para hacer del festival nuestra primera parada del tour de nuestro álbum debut Funky Feeling que irá por Estados Unidos y México. Vamos a aprovechar las invitaciones que tenemos y estaremos tocando en Los Ángeles, Filadelfia, Miami y en México estaremos en México DF, Guadalajara, Tuxtla Gutiérrez, Zacatecas y Tijuana.

Please friends around the world, help us to continue making real this dream that we have built as a family. Every donation that you bring to us, will be received with much love!!

¡Por favor amigos alrededor del mundo, ayúdennos a seguir haciendo realidad este sueño que hemos venido construyendo en familia! Cada donación y cada gotica que puedan aportar, va a ser recibida con muchísimo amor :)

Aquí puedes escuchar más de nuestra música:

 

Estas son algunas de las recompensas que puedes recibir:

story:
Short Summary

Hi! We are TOMBOi, a queer indie electronic band based out of Jacksonville, Florida. We first came together through mutual friends, cementing a deeper bond through music, community organizing and youth advocacy efforts with local non profits like Girls Rock Jacksonville. Last year, on top of touring and balancing life and our “day jobs” we managed to record and self-produce our first full length album, Spectrum.

Spectrum, is an album that is inspired by the social and personal experiences of growing up as queer androgynous women in the south. We pulled inspiration from our hometown’s on-going battle to pass a fully inclusive Human Rights Ordinance, personal relationships and concepts of identity. When coming up with the name of the album we kept circulating around this idea that everything is on a Spectrum.

As an independent band, we heavily rely on our supporters. Now that we have finished writing, recording & producing Spectrum we need help giving our latest work some legs, arms, pinky toes and prissy paws to get out there to the masses. We are reaching out to our community and future friends to be apart of the final phases of releasing Spectrum into the world. Everything we have ever done has only been possible because of the people we aim to entertain and safer spaces we advocate for. We need all the help we can get! Want to be apart of the Spectrum process? Check out all the extra special exclusive incentives we have put together as our way of saying THANK YOU for your contribution and support <3

 

What We Need 

You may be asking, Where will my money go exactly? Here is a break-down of some of our current costs we need help funding. Every little bit helps <3

• Audio mastering

• CD packaging

• Record Pressing & Distro

• Legal fees

• Radio publicity campaign

• Press campaign and tour publicity

• “Rainbow Warrior” music video

• Merchandise

• Packaging and Shipping

• Tour expenses

The Impact

Being three queer women growing up in a less than welcoming and inclusive environment drives everything we do. We aim to create music that shares our story as southern queer women & artists.  Our shows are always put together with the concepts of safe(r) spaces in mind in response to a lack of it where we are from. We hope with your help we can continue to gain momentum towards sharing our music and story in new spaces and in front of new audiences. This is the largest project we have undertaken, but our foundation as a band is almost as strong as our foundation in our friendship. We know with your help we can achieve all the goals we have set for, Spectrum. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't afford to pledge? No sweat! You can support by telling your friends in person or via social media why they should help us take Tomboi even further. Share our campaign and video in as many places as you can! Make sure to check out the Indiegogo share tools to help you post onto social media!

You can connect on social media with us at:

facebook.com/tomboiband

instagram.com/tomboiband

twitter.com/tomboiband
