When coming up with the name of the album we kept circulating around this idea that everything is on a Spectrum.
As an independent band, we heavily rely on our supporters. Now that we have finished writing, recording & producing Spectrum we need help giving our latest work some legs, arms, pinky toes and prissy paws to get out there to the masses. We are reaching out to our community and future friends to be apart of the final phases of releasing Spectrum into the world. Everything we have ever done has only been possible because of the people we aim to entertain and safer spaces we advocate for. We need all the help we can get! Want to be apart of the Spectrum process? Check out all the extra special exclusive incentives we have put together as our way of saying THANK YOU for your contribution and support <3
 

What We Need 
You may be asking, Where will my money go exactly? Here is a break-down of some of our current costs we need help funding. Every little bit helps <3
• Audio mastering
• CD packaging
• Record Pressing & Distro
• Legal fees
• Radio publicity campaign
• Press campaign and tour publicity
• “Rainbow Warrior” music video
• Merchandise
• Packaging and Shipping
• Tour expenses

The Impact
Being three queer women growing up in a less than welcoming and inclusive environment drives everything we do. We aim to create music that shares our story as southern queer women & artists.  Our shows are always put together with the concepts of safe(r) spaces in mind in response to a lack of it where we are from. We hope with your help we can continue to gain momentum towards sharing our music and story in new spaces and in front of new audiences. This is the largest project we have undertaken, but our foundation as a band is almost as strong as our foundation in our friendship. We know with your help we can achieve all the goals we have set for, Spectrum. 

Other Ways You Can Help
Can't afford to pledge? No sweat! You can support by telling your friends in person or via social media why they should help us take Tomboi even further. Share our campaign and video in as many places as you can! Make sure to check out the Indiegogo share tools to help you post onto social media!
You can connect on social media with us at:
facebook.com/tomboiband
instagram.com/tomboiband
twitter.com/tomboiband

story:
Sun Fox has always striven to deliver the highest quality free music to the most people we can.  That will never change!

When I created The Sun Fox Band I did so with no record label or financial backing.  Rather, I just gave myself to the creative muse that led me to record 6 albums including more than 77 songs.

It is my hope that with an Indiegogo campaign I can bring more people into the Indie music community, and help secure a more stable future for the project as a whole.  The money donated here will go to helping create a high quality new album, and stoke the cool trend for myself and other small scale indie musicians hoping to get off the ground without having our wings clipped by corporate backers. 

I love and trust in music and artistic expression.  I love the way it feels to experience.  I most of all love the way it feels to create it. =)

I believe in the dream of a future world where an artist is limited only by his or her own imagination!  Let's make some music.

story:
Not a reader? Watch the video above!

--------------------------------

Short Summary

Hi! We are Paper Shakers (if you google it, sometimes you'll get us confused with a 50's cover band...) but we are a indie/alternative band based in Peterborough, Ontario. We've got songs we'd like to share that have stories about life, hope, love and whatever else is relevant to what we are facing. There's so much we want to do, but there's one thing holding us back -- it's all very expensive.

That's where you come in. We need you, the good people we’ve met along the way, and maybe some who we’ve yet to meet to help fund our music needs. 

Think of it as pre-ordering the music and merchandise and helping us get our feet off the ground! 

What We Need : 

WE need YOUR HELP to achieve some of the things we could only dream of.

We'd like to ask for a total of $5,000, with these funds you will help us cover:

  • 4 song EP Record (including basic tracking, mixing and mastering, artwork) 
  • CD duplication + sleeves
  • Marketing & Promotions( music video, photography, campaigns) 
  • Rehearsal space
  • Merchandise (cotton tees and enamel pins)

Any funds raised beyond $5,000 will go towards the Indiegogo fees and fall touring costs!! (yes, we want to do that too)

We aim to use all local artists/ businesses (Ontario) in the making of our albums, photos and videos. We also aim to use eco friendly supplies for CD duplication and sleeves. And to also invest in sustainable and ethical promotional merchandise. 

What you get: 

The perks vary per donation, but we're offering a variety of cool stuff , check out the boxes on the right and see what you could get per donation group! 

The Impact

We may be a small group of artists, but we want to create original art that touches the world. We believe about bringing attention to things close to our heart from social justice matters to stories of hopeful situations.  We understand the impact that music has on every individual and how it can bring together people in all stages of life. Our hope is that our words, visuals, melodies and us as the band Paper Shakers can inspire a community of people to dream and to love!

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest risk is : We might not make it to the total amount.

But, what are dreams without risks?

We believe greatly in this project, so we believe this project will still go on. (It might just be a bit harder and a bit slower to get finished.) 

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't contribute, doesn't mean you can't help - here are some ways :

  • Get the word out : Share on your social network about our campaign! via. Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Email! Whatever you use, this helps us get the word out!
  • Collaboration: Maybe you're an artist/promoter/photographer /etc. - saw our campaign and want to help with your time or space instead? email : papershakersband@gmail.com
  • Like or Follow Us: Give us a listen & if you like what you hear = Give us a Like or Follow us on our social channels (instagram :@papershakersband + facebook :@papershakersband ) You would be helping us promote our band! 
  • Come to our Shows! :  Your face in the crowd is another way to support the cause & say HI to us afterwards, we love connecting with new people! 

Thanks for your time & support !

Learn more about us + Hear our music : https://www.papershakers.com/

story:
Introduction

Hi, I am Lysee J and I want to thank you for stopping by my Indiegogo page.  Before I get into my campaign I would like to tell you a little about myself, my background, and my mission as a singer/songwriter.

 

Background

I grew up primarily in the bay area and had a challenging childhood as my parents got divorced when I was a baby so I spent my childhood living between two households.  I always loved music and singing, however, I suppressed that part of me until it could no longer be denied.  By the time I was 20, I knew I had to follow my passion and become a singer/songwriter—music called to me and would not accept “no” as an answer. My parents both have advanced degrees (my dad from Harvard and my mom from Stanford) so education is huge in my family and I was nervous about how they would react to my leaving school to pursue music.  Fortunately, my parents both supported me in pursuing my dream so after my second year in college, I dropped out to pursue music full time.  I have had to work hard because I had no musical training and until a few years ago, I had never even had vocal lessons. 

I have been fortunate enough to work with several top music producers in Los Angeles and have created three albums, including a mixtape.  All my music has been self-funded and it has taken 8 years of hard work to get to where I am today.  I am at a crucial juncture in my music career as I have an opportunity to significantly increase my fan base and musical opportunities as a result of being featured on a soon to be released song which also features Snoop Dogg (more on this later).

My Mission

I want to make a difference in the world through my music, especially as it impacts women.  I am very passionate about what it means to truly be a woman in this day and age, a woman who is authentic, honest, real, and connected to her heart.  Imagine if my generation of women grew up with examples in the music industry of women who are not trying to fit into a mold of how they SHOULD look, act, or speak, but women who stand in their truth, who do not let others sway them or make them insecure, and who are unapologetically real. Imagine how the world would evolve into a more loving, peaceful place with positive and powerful feminine leadership. I want to encourage women to love themselves enough to break certain patterns of low self-esteem and unhealthy relationships.

I want to be a positive example for women as to how to be loved, maintain self-love, and be empowered. I want to be a positive example for men as to what to look for and what is truly important in partnership. I want to encourage everyone and teach them how to follow their dreams and create the life they want. Success is a mindset, not a gift randomly bestowed on people who are worthy. WE are all worthy.

Long term I want to be an activist for female empowerment and also conscious music. I want to spread joy, love, celebration AND create music that connects you to your heart and that expresses the full range of human emotion in a healing way.

California Party Song Featuring Snoop Dogg

I have been blessed to receive an opportunity to be featured on an artist named C-TRU's song called California Party with Snoop Dogg.  I Just found out that the song will be on the soundtrack of the new Tupac movie that was released on June 16th.  We just filmed the music video for the California Party song with Snoop Dogg and the music video will be released in a few weeks so this is a huge opportunity for me to leverage the song and the music video in order to grow my fan base. I want to learn from the mistakes of other artists who were not prepared when their big break came along.  This is my big break and I want to be prepared to capitalize off of the momentum and media attention the new song and music video will bring.

The new song and music video will drive new viewers to my website and social media so it is crucial to have my online presence and new music looking polished and on point.  I want to be able to maximize the visual impact when viewers visit my online sites so that I can capture a wider fan base. Justin Timberlake offered me great advice when I met him a few years ago.  He said; “You only get one chance to make a first impression in the music industry.”  This is my one chance and I need your support to make it happen.

My Campaign--What I Need & What You Get

We are releasing the music video in a few weeks and I need funding  for all of the following:  1.  To hire a team to help me build my brand, increase my social media presence, and enhance my website; 2.  For PR so that when the music video is released, I am able to help promote it in order to ensure it reaches the widest possible audience; 3.  To pay for producers, studio time, and mixing and mastering in order to create new music that will undoubtedly reach a wider audience thanks to my being featured in the song/music video with Snoop Dogg.

I am seeking $25,000 because that is the amount I realistically believe will be needed in order to record new music (each song typically costs around $2,500 to produce), promote my music, build my brand, and enhance my social media presence.  I want you to know that I will continue to invest my own hard earned money into my music, however, your contributions will allow me to take my music career to another level and I cannot do it without You! As an independent artist, I cannot compete with the resources of a major label, however, with your support, I can still make an impact. Your support is so important to me because I honestly feel that the music industry needs powerful female leadership comprised of REAL women who are authentic and full of vulnerability and integrity as opposed to packaged artists who are products of the standard music industry mold for female artists.

The Impact

This project is my biggest opportunity to break out in the industry and here’s why:

Most artists either release a song through a major label or they have an A list artist on their song so the fans of the A list artist will listen by default, resulting in new exposure to millions of potential fans if you resonate with them.

For the past few years I have met with agents, record label owners, fans, vocal coaches, and music producers.  They all have said that I am very talented, however, people just need to see me; I simply need exposure in order to break out. Everything is there and I know that as long as I have exposure I will reach my dreams. I am finally on the verge of a breakthrough in my music career. I want to passionately promote the California Party video and I need to create and release new music in order to ride the momentum created by the release of the song and music video in order to elevate my musical profile. This WILL launch me to millions of new potential fans!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not contribute financially PLEASE share my story and this indiegogo with your friends, your following, and post on your social media. Please PERSONALLY CONTACT all influencers you know and friends who care about this cause, to donate and/or put me in touch with someone who can help launch the video through their following or contacts. Please also watch the video when it comes out and share with everyone you know!

Thank you so much for your time and I can’t wait to make this dream a reality!

With love,

Lysee

story:
We've been Chief Perchin in the studio, help us bring the music to your ear holes.

We've been working on our debut album officially for about a year and a half now, but have each been prepping for this moment for our whole lives. We love making music and we think you'll like what we've come up with, we do. 

We've put a lot of work into the album and it's almost done, but now we need help making the release happen.

What We Need & Chief Perks

  • We need $4000 which will be used to: 
    • Fund the pressing and licensing of the album
    • Pay for the promotion and distribution of the album and related content
    • Creating and delivering quality Perch Merch  (shirts, hats, lighters, bottle openers etc.)

Every effort you make is Chief Work!

Some of you just can't contribute but still read the whole way (thanks!) and we love you! It doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Share this Indiegogo with your friends
  • Help get the word out and make some noise about us on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter
  • Come see us play!
  • Get on our Mailing List (see our website!)

Love, 
Chief Perch

story:
The Tour

There are 7 stops on this tour:

  • Hamilton
  • London
  • Guelph
  • Peterborough
  • Toronto
  • Ottawa
  • Montreal

From July 3rd-9th

All are cities with awesome music scenes and avid club goers.

Here's Where YOU Can Help:

  • We're asking for $2000 to help us survive on the road
  • There are  so many perks and prizes to be won including everything from merch-kits to a private party organized by us for you :)
  • Even if we don't reach our goal every dollar helps! 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are plenty of other things to do if you aren't able to donate:

  • We'll be holding fundraising shows from now right up until tour so come on out and dance to help us out!
  • Help us spread the word about this by sharing as well as telling your friends and family

And that's all there is to it!

We plan on going all out for this record, but between recording, hiring string players, mixing, mastering, creating album artwork, manufacturing CDs and vinyl, the costs can really start to accumulate! That's where you come in!

When you contribute to our campaign, you have the option of pre-ordering CDs, vinyl, t-shirts, posters, tickets to our album release show, and even a private concert experience! Even the smallest contribution can go a long way! Please help us make this dream come into fruition!

story:
Mr. Chris & the Gassy Bubbles are a children’s rock & roll band based out of Cambridge, Ontario..

The band is fronted by Mr. Chris (Chris Torti).

Chris has spent the past 17 years invested in learning about children’s minds.  He has received his ECE diploma from Seneca College, and furthered his studies in that realm, by studying Women’s Studies at McMaster University and by obtaining his ECE Honours Degree at Ryerson University.

Since then, Chris has worked with children in a variety of different capacities. Chris has worked as a literacy specialist, a therapist ( for autistic children), a resource teacher, a librarian, an Early Childhood Educator, a support worker, and a teacher for visually impaired children.  Each of these jobs served as a launching pad for Chris’ creativity.  Chris used his direct experiences with children to nurture his craft and talent.

Chris currently runs programs within his community for children and families to attend.  Chris has teamed with a few local businesses (Farmer’s Market/Library) to help provide interactive programs that are free for families to attend.

Chris is an advocate for learning and is genuinely invested in making children feel happy. 

Prior to 2016, The Gassy Bubbles band consisted of childhood friends and hired musicians.  However, in June 2016, Chris was fortunate enough to meet (RECE) Josh Correia (bass), Nathan Farmer (guitar) & Matt Howell (drums), who would go on to become the permanent Gassy Bubbles vibration. (and they're also co-writing the new album with Chris)

Together with the Gassy Bubbles, Chris has intentions of writing many more children’s albums, as well, children’s books and children’s programs for the masses.

The Bubbles brand of children’s music is a bit outside the box.  It’s been created to equally appeal to both children and parents.  If parents enjoy the music, they may feel more inclined to get up and join in some dance with their children.  This is Chris’ method to nurture and foster children’s music.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We're hopeful to raise the funds we need to make the kind of album we envision.

If we don't raise the funds needed, the album will still be made, however, we'll have to cut corners, and hold off on some of the magic.

The funds raised will aid us to pay for:

- mastering costs

- album duplication

- album artwork

- album digital layout

- digital album release

- updated website

- band banner

- public relations help (to help promote album)

If we do not reach our goal, we will most likely categorize each of the above, in order of importance, and pay for that.  For example, we will most likely first pay for the mastering of the music first, to get it radio friendly.

 

 

The Impact

This project is important because we are trying to tear down walls.  We are trying to do what no other bands are not really doing.
Adults are the creators of the children's music genre.  However, we've found, through countless observation & research that children enjoy what their parents like.  For example, if a child sees their parents dance to a song, most likely, that will prompt the children to follow.
We are making a grand attempt, and we believe we've succeeded in drawing the line that separates children music & adult-like music.  Throughout the entire writing process, we've made sure to hover right over that line, to create an album that equally appeals to both children and parents. 
We want to inspire families to get up and dance together

Risks & Challenges

Creating an album with limited-no finances is difficult and a bit soul crushing, however, when you have a tightly knit family that surrounds you, nothing can stand in your way.
We've struggled and have had to cut corners, but we're doing our very best to let our creativity speak and sing for us.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to support our vibrations financially, no worries; we will always love you!

If you'd like to help us out, please share the word about our vibration, our music & our campaign.
story_txt:
Mr. Chris & the Gassy Bubbles are a children’s rock & roll band based out of Cambridge, Ontario..
The band is fronted by Mr. Chris (Chris Torti).
Chris has spent the past 17 years invested in learning about children’s minds.  He has received his ECE diploma from Seneca College, and furthered his studies in that realm, by studying Women’s Studies at McMaster University and by obtaining his ECE Honours Degree at Ryerson University.
Since then, Chris has worked with children in a variety of different capacities. Chris has worked as a literacy specialist, a therapist ( for autistic children), a resource teacher, a librarian, an Early Childhood Educator, a support worker, and a teacher for visually impaired children.  Each of these jobs served as a launching pad for Chris’ creativity.  Chris used his direct experiences with children to nurture his craft and talent.
Chris currently runs programs within his community for children and families to attend.  Chris has teamed with a few local businesses (Farmer’s Market/Library) to help provide interactive programs that are free for families to attend.
Chris is an advocate for learning and is genuinely invested in making children feel happy. 
Prior to 2016, The Gassy Bubbles band consisted of childhood friends and hired musicians.  However, in June 2016, Chris was fortunate enough to meet (RECE) Josh Correia (bass), Nathan Farmer (guitar) & Matt Howell (drums), who would go on to become the permanent Gassy Bubbles vibration. (and they're also co-writing the new album with Chris)
Together with the Gassy Bubbles, Chris has intentions of writing many more children’s albums, as well, children’s books and children’s programs for the masses.
The Bubbles brand of children’s music is a bit outside the box.  It’s been created to equally appeal to both children and parents.  If parents enjoy the music, they may feel more inclined to get up and join in some dance with their children.  This is Chris’ method to nurture and foster children’s music.
 

What We Need & What You Get
We're hopeful to raise the funds we need to make the kind of album we envision.
If we don't raise the funds needed, the album will still be made, however, we'll have to cut corners, and hold off on some of the magic.
The funds raised will aid us to pay for:
- mastering costs
- album duplication
- album artwork
- album digital layout
- digital album release
- updated website
- band banner
- public relations help (to help promote album)
If we do not reach our goal, we will most likely categorize each of the above, in order of importance, and pay for that.  For example, we will most likely first pay for the mastering of the music first, to get it radio friendly.

 
 
The Impact
This project is important because we are trying to tear down walls.  We are trying to do what no other bands are not really doing.Adults are the creators of the children's music genre.  However, we've found, through countless observation & research that children enjoy what their parents like.  For example, if a child sees their parents dance to a song, most likely, that will prompt the children to follow.We are making a grand attempt, and we believe we've succeeded in drawing the line that separates children music & adult-like music.  Throughout the entire writing process, we've made sure to hover right over that line, to create an album that equally appeals to both children and parents. We want to inspire families to get up and dance together

Risks & Challenges
Creating an album with limited-no finances is difficult and a bit soul crushing, however, when you have a tightly knit family that surrounds you, nothing can stand in your way.We've struggled and have had to cut corners, but we're doing our very best to let our creativity speak and sing for us.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you're not able to support our vibrations financially, no worries; we will always love you!
If you'd like to help us out, please share the word about our vibration, our music & our campaign.

story:
Following a dream can seem impossible.  But great things happen when we decide that impossible is not a part of our lives!  That is what I decided.  For so many years, I sang with all the passion of my heart.  But I felt that no one could hear me.  Raising my lovely daughter alone was a struggle, and I did not have the time or finances to commit myself to the dream I have had since I was a little girl:  To record and sing for the world.

Then a friend told me about this wonderful site, IndieGoGo...  A place that helps the dreams of new artists come true!  And now, with the help of all my lovely friends and fans, I can finally devote myself to the completion of my first album, "Naty Susana."

God bless you all for taking the time, and giving generously, to help me.  Even if you cannot afford to donate, you can help me SO MUCH just by forwarding this project to your friends on Facebook and Twitter!  :)  I am overwhelmed with the love and support I feel in these days!  Muah!

 

Después de un sueño pueden parecer imposible.  Pero grandes cosas suceden cuando decidamos que imposible no es parte de nuestras vidas!  Eso es lo que decidí.  Durante muchos años, canté con toda la pasión de mi corazón.  Pero sentí que no podía oírme.  Elevando mi encantadora hija solo era una lucha, y no tengo el tiempo ni las finanzas para comprometerme para el sueño que he tenido desde que era una niña: grabar y cantar para el mundo.

 

Entonces un amigo me dijo sobre este maravilloso sitio, IndieGoGo...  Un lugar que ayuda a los sueños de nuevos artistas en realidad!  Y ahora, con la ayuda de todos mis encantadores amigos y fans, yo puedo finalmente dedicarme a la terminación de mi primer álbum, "Naty Susana."

Dios los bendiga por tomarse el tiempo y dando generosamente, que me ayude.  Incluso si usted no puede permitirse donar, me puede ayudar tan solo enviando este proyecto a sus amigos en Facebook y Twitter!  :)  ¡Estoy abrumado por el amor y el apoyo que siento en estos días!  ¡Muah!

story:
Hello There. My name is Jonah Sun and I am an Artist/Producer based out of San Francisco, CA. I am currently finishing up my new album "Molecules and Dreams" and want you to be a part of it! Without a label backing it is expensive to put out music professionally these days. As an independent artist I have been struggling on my last few releases with getting the best production/mix/mastering, and marketing plan due to lack of a budget. It's really hard to make a push and get your name and music out there without it. That's where you come in! With your contributions I can give it a real go with this album and reach as many hearts and ears as possible, and produce the most heartfelt best sounding songs I possibly can.

 

Here is where your money will go :

Studio Time/Mixing and Mastering $3,000

CD pressing $500

Publicist/Promo 1,500

I'm not just asking for handouts.  There are some awesome perks available to you for helping. Including signed albums, T-shirts, stickers, personalized songs, etc.  Go check them out!

Most of this album is already done as far as writing and tracking so the only thing left is everything else (which is the part that costs a lot).  Seriously, if I didn't crowdfund this, this album won't get done or it will not be given the full technical polish that happens in the studio that it deserves.  Music is one of the only things that can truly move people, and that is what I have set out to do with my life.  Come be a small part of it :)

Thank You!

Don't have any money? Me either... That's OK... You can still help by sharing this on your social media platform of choice, or telling a friend with deep pockets who supports the arts :)

story:
20 YEARS OF MUSIC!

In 1997, we released our first album, "Birth," in conjunction with the birth of our first child, Russell. It was the launch of our music career, our ministry, and our little family. Because of the stunningly warm reception for "Birth," we became connected with so many amazing people. Twenty years, eight albums and four babies later, the same folks who encouraged us at that beginning are cheering us on today. We still have fans come to shows asking for songs from way back in our archives. We feel incredibly fortunate to have been able to make music for this long, and it is all because of our fans, friends, and supporters. To every person who has bought a cd (or tape!), sung one of our songs in church, passed around one of our chord charts, showed up to a concert, hosted a house show, downloaded an mp3, told their friends about us and supported us in any way...we want to say thank you.

We want to record an album that will mean something really special to our outstanding fan base. We want to re-record your favorites (polls are coming) and fill your ears with a few new Barry & Michelle sounds. We want you to remember what a song meant to you and experience it all over again. We want to say thank you by paying homage to songs that you have loved for years. We want to give them to you again, to fold into the days you are living now. Make sure to read to the end because there is an easy way you can earn a digital copy of this album for free!

LET'S MAKE AN AMAZING ALBUM!

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT IT'S FOR

We need to raise $9,000.00 to record this album.  Here is the breakdown for the funding:

*3,500-tracking and production

*4,000-mixing and mastering

*400-physical duplication

*400-reward fulfillment costs (t-shirts, USBs)

*200-administrative production fees

*500-graphic art

If we exceed our goal, we will put the extra funds toward the live taping of a 20-Year Commemorative Barry & Michelle concert. (Doesn't that sound like fun?!)

WANT TO BE IN OUR COMMERCIAL?

Just like everything we do, this album's promo will be a grassroots, word-of-mouth endeavor. We need YOU to be the promo for this project by telling the interwebs why YOU are excited about this album and what our music means to YOU. One of the most valuable things you could do for us would require NO money from you!

HOW TO EARN A FREE DIGITAL DOWNLOAD OF THIS ALBUM!!

We will send you a FREE DIGITAL DOWNLOAD if you make a short video saying what a particular Barry & Michelle song means to you and post it, along with our Indiegogo project link. Here's how you do it:

1) Record a 30-second video in which you:
- say what B&M song/album means the most to you & why
-tell folks about the new project                                                                                                                   
2) Post your video online, along with this link:

https://igg.me/at/barryandmichelle

3) Tag us and send your video to barryandmichellepatterson@gmail.com so we can post it, too.

Here are some of our other available rewards:

t-shirts

CDs

custom usb drives

handwritten lyrics

online music lesson

tickets to a meet-and-greet and private concert in DFW

house shows with or without omelettes and waffles made and served by Barry & Michelle

 

THIS WILL BE OUR FAVORITE ALBUM TO DATE

For us, this album is our celebration of YOU. We want to honor YOU for making it possible for us to still be making music after 20 years. We want to hear from YOU about it, record the songs YOU want to hear, and make an album with YOU that will be a part of YOUR musical history.

Thank you!

Barry & Michelle

story:
The story so far

Welcome to the highlight of my life! This is the passion, obsession and love that is my music. I'm Anni M Fables from Tasmania, Australia. After my classical music studies I began seeking a way of expressing myself that would allow me to be authentic, engaging and meaningful. I crafted songs for many years before listening to people telling me to record an album. 

The 11 tracks for Space (Luck) Sphere were refined, recorded and mixed in Vancouver, BC, Canada during the past 3 years with musicians: Blake McKay, Nathan Turner, Blake McAndless, Justine Apostolopoulos, Jenna Materi, Sabrina Robson, Logan Thackray, Jennifer Charters, Joseph Abbott, Mary Matheson, Shannon Marie, Thalia Apostolopoulos, Emma Law, Brendan Steele, Ryan Trigg, Tynan Rampling, Nadine Pluzak, Stuart McGinley, Wes Coderre & Paul Connell. The process was a wild rollercoaster of learning curves, leaps and loops. The results are greater than I imagined possible and I'm so proud of the ear magic my dear friends and I have conjured up! The first single from the album, Endless, was released in April. You can listen to it here.

Four fantastic pieces of artwork are complete. There are 2 paintings by artist Meli Rose (my sister!) and some magical photography by Mary Matheson. The elements are all ready to see the light! I'm seeking your support to help with the final costs of mixing, mastering, CD replication, distribution and promotion. In gratitude I would love for you to become a part of the package.

 

 

What happens next

To be more specific, I am raising these funds for:

  • Mixing - the mixing so far has been completed by my wonderful and talented friend Blake McKay at Adanac Sound in Vancouver, BC, Canada
  • Mastering 
  • Online distribution & publishing - All online stores
  • CD pressing - 500 high quality CD's with a poster booklet including 36x36cm cover artwork and lyric sheet
  • Download cards 
  • Promotion - I'm hoping to distribute a tailored press release to reach the kinds of people in the world who are likely to love my music!

If you can contribute towards these costs I will be forever grateful! These are some ways I have devised to express my thanks for your generosity and also to enable your participation in the launch process: 

  • A free album download
  • A signed CD
  • A high quality 8x10 print of a piece of the artwork
  • Your name sung at the album launch!
  • Your name printed in the CD booklet (real or alias, you choose)
  • A brand new song written for any theme(s) you want. It might even make it onto the next album!
  • A house show! I would love to come and serenade you and your friends with a live looping performance. Please note, however, this is dependent on us arranging the appropriate time & location. Unless you are also willing to purchase my airfare! 
  • A guest appearance in the music video for one of the songs on Space (Luck) Sphere! Also dependent on location.
  • A year of music mentorship, either over skype or in person (depending on location)

 

​

 

The bottom line

I've poured every aspect of my being into this project for the past few years. It has felt like the most valuable thing I've ever chosen to apply myself to. I believe that music can be a gift of inspiration, insight and happiness. I want this to be my gift to my world!

 

Challenges

Even though this album was recorded with number of other musicians, it is essentially a solo project. At times it can be difficult to maintain the self-motivation to research my options, devise strategies, make necessary decisions and carry out the actions required to pull together a project like this.

Luckily I'm obsessed. I have discovered more gumption and resolve for this project than I knew I had. The issues that have already been solved along this journey so far give me confidence for overcoming any future obstacles. Most importantly I have an incredible support network with whom I am constantly sharing my ideas, sprouting new ones and gaining perspective. My gratitude to you all.

I see producing 500 CD's as a solid commitment. I know musicians who have boxes of CD's gathering dust in storage. So this is a risk. To meet it I intend to promote my music online to reach my full audience for distribution, as well as continuing to share my music in person wherever I go.

 

Don't have any $$'s?

Don't fret if you find your pockets empty. Please give generously with your actions in these free ways!

  • Make contact. All comments and encouragement will be wholeheartedly appreciated! Comment via this campaign or message me through my Facebook page (please like on your way through!)
  • Listen to the music! My first single Endless is available on my website. If you enjoy it then please share it with others who might too.
  • Share this campaign with all of your rich friends!! You can use Indiegogo's share tools or get creative!

 

Thank you!!!

 

 

All photographs on this page (c) Mary Matheson. Watercolour images "Alice" & "I'm on my way" (c) Meli Rose Art. Campaign video by Sebastian Kay.

story:
Short Summary

I've made music all my life, and this is the first time I've made something of this magnitude to share. Help me get it to you!

I've recorded my first, full length album, "Many Waters." Its eleven, original songs are just a few steps away from CD release day! I'm raising funds to mix, master, duplicate, and promote my album, so it will reach more people and better platforms.

I made "Many Waters" in true farm to studio fashion. I spent the past nine months driving between Vermont and A Happy Farm in New Hampshire, exchanging farm work for recording time. My friend Amber Martin, a farmer and sound engineer, needed help on her farm and had access to Musician's Mission Recording Studio in Dublin, NH; it was perfect! So, I spent half my time camped out in the field, rebuilding the greenhouse and working the rows, and the other half working on my songs in the studio. The result has me covered in dirt and over the moon! I am so grateful to have found this organic route to my record, in line with the natural sounds and feelings of "Many Waters."

Your contributions make it all possible: an album of my original songs, packaged in my original art, ready to take on tour! 

Where Your Money Goes

Your contributions fund:

  • Mixing/Mastering - $1,000
  • Duplication + Shipping - $1,400
  • Promotion - $1,000
  • Merchandise- $1,500
  • Music Videos - $1,500
  • Post CD Release tour - $1,600
  • Total - $8,000

I've got some pretty sweet incentives for those who donate!

Many contributors will receive an original postcard or sticker, digital download or physical copy of "Many Waters." 

Larger contributions come with hand painted art, some pretty ridiculous outtakes from my Indiegogo video, or even a personalized song! And a boat load more!

**Make sure to check out the full list of incentives on the right of this page**

The Impact

  • I want to share my music. Music is meant to be heard, participated in, and contributed to. This project enters my songs into the larger, musical conversation; it makes it possible for me to continue making music, full time.
  • I've made demo CD's with my own equipment and recycled calendar pages for packaging. I've recorded EPs in professional recording studios and made them accessible online. But this is the first time I have the whole package: a full length album, in physical form and in cyberspace, complete with my original art!
  • I am pursuing singing and songwriting full time; a great record opens all the right doors. I can't wait to take "Many Waters" on the road and into the online community!

Risks & Challenges

While rewarding, this process had its share obstacles. We had everything from a broken guitar on recording day to a chimney fire on the farm. We did all the recording with just one sound engineer and one musician, working through each obstacle as it arose. Creating all the art by hand, for the album packaging and promotion, has proved quite the endeavor as well! As well as designing, painting, and filming my indiegogo video!

But! It all makes "Many Waters" more meaningful. The hard work on the farm put me in the right mindset for the studio. The hard work creating the visual art for this album produces something that is wholly me.

Before this campaign is over, I'll create, and then graphically design, the artwork for the album's packaging. I'll create the artwork for promotional t-shirts, posters, stickers, and online advertising. I'll also host a CD release event. I'll start work on promotional music videos. I'll book and promote the shows for a "Many Waters" tour!

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't make a donation? You can still help!

  • Spread the word: You can make a huge impact just by sharing my campaign video on social media. Every time you share, my album's reach widens exponentially. 
  • Tell your friends! Tell your mom! Get the word out to those who aren't on social media!
  • Come to a show: It's all about playing music. And I wouldn't have come this far without your amazing support at live performances!
story_txt:
Short Summary
I've made music all my life, and this is the first time I've made something of this magnitude to share. Help me get it to you!
I've recorded my first, full length album, "Many Waters." Its eleven, original songs are just a few steps away from CD release day! I'm raising funds to mix, master, duplicate, and promote my album, so it will reach more people and better platforms.
I made "Many Waters" in true farm to studio fashion. I spent the past nine months driving between Vermont and A Happy Farm in New Hampshire, exchanging farm work for recording time. My friend Amber Martin, a farmer and sound engineer, needed help on her farm and had access to Musician's Mission Recording Studio in Dublin, NH; it was perfect! So, I spent half my time camped out in the field, rebuilding the greenhouse and working the rows, and the other half working on my songs in the studio. The result has me covered in dirt and over the moon! I am so grateful to have found this organic route to my record, in line with the natural sounds and feelings of "Many Waters."
Your contributions make it all possible: an album of my original songs, packaged in my original art, ready to take on tour!

Mixing/Mastering - $1,000

Promotion - $1,000

story: We LOVE music! Our dream is to be able to quit our day jobs and focus solely on writing, recording & performing. How does one get there? By doing the damn thing. Part of 'doing the damn thing' includes recording... and it's not cheap to work with an amazing producer who really knows their stuff. That's where you guys come in. Even donating $1 will go a long way. If you can't contribute (and that's totally okay), please share this campaign & our music!

story:
Jessica Pearson and the East Wind

We are a Folk Canadiana Trio hailing from Ottawa Canada! Taking inspiration from our heritage we create music with a celtic, east coast feel and bring Acadian and folk traditional songs back to life!

  • Created by Jessica Pearson (vocals, guitar, bohdran), Maddy O'Regan (vocals, fiddle) and Pat Bigelow (vocals, double bass)

" Jessica Pearson and the East Wind’s dynamic live shows take you on a journey through their lives with heartwarming harmonies, the liveliness of maritime kitchen parties, and intimate traditional melodies"

We have been working hard on creating music that tells a story and makes you laugh, cry and dance! We want to share our music with you and we want YOU to be a part of the making of this EP! This EP will allow us to share our music with you all and will be a milestone in our musical journey!

 

What We Need & What You Get

For us to create this, we need your help! All of your donations will be going towards the creation and recording of this EP. Here is a quick break down of expenses:

  • Recording studio time in Ottawa at Audio Valley Recording Studio
  • Our lovely Producer Tara Shannon and our Engineer!
  • Any equipment we need to rent for the production of the EP
  • Mixing and Mastering of the finished songs
  • Physical creation of the EP and copies of the EP for distribution to you lovely fans!

 

We have taken time to create some very special perks for you all when you donate! We have stickers, physical signed EP's out of the first batch, t-shirts, personal individual videos and behind the scenes footage of creating the EP, house concerts and MarkHunt original Cigar-Box Guitars! We cannot thank you enough for donating and becoming part of this musical journey with us! This EP means so much to us and we cannot wait to share everything we have created with you!

 

Join our musical Journey!

 

There are so many ways you can be a part of the making of this EP! 

  • Every donation counts!
  • Buy one of our perks that we have created especially for YOU
  • Share our Indigogo link with your friends and family! Get the word out!
  • Share our campaign on your social media sites!

Thank you all so much for all of your ongoing support and love you send us! We cannot do this without you and we cannot wait to share our music with you all!

cheers,

- Jessica Pearson and the East Wind

story:
Jason Springs and Matt Crowder are up and coming regional artists/songwriters based in Danville, VA, and they want to record an album WITH YOU!

  • Since releasing his debut album in late 2016, Jason has received critical praise, comparing him to the likes of Steve Earle, John Moreland, and Jason Isbell. In addition to opening for notable artists including Ward Davis, American  Aquarium, Yarn, and upcoming with Reckless Kelly, he performed at Rooster Walk the last two years, and is currently writing songs for his sophomore album.

  • Matt has been performing in bands and as a solo artist over the past 3 years culminating in over 750 show dates! Writing songs between performances, Crowder has amassed quite a regional following, an impressive catalog of original material, and is currently working on his first full length solo studio album.  

What Is This & Why Am I Here?

Essentially, we're planning a live concert atmosphere, showcasing new material that we've both been working on and recording it as live albums. Instead of going to normal route of hitting a studio for days with a full band, we decided that we'd first share these songs with you in a different format, and offer a chance to not only be at this show, but help us record this thing WITH YOU.

We're offering a UNIQUE event unlike any other in this region. We intend to put on this EXCLUSIVE live show with your help and have it recorded, mixed, mastered, and released on CD/digital media!

We see this performance/recording as a way of creating an unforgettable, interactive shared experience with the listener, and we want to be able to do this with YOU! 

The recording show will be hosted at Daily Grind in Martinsville, VA, offering not only food, but 90+ different craft beers, 20+ different wines, and numerous award winning coffee brews

What We Need & What You Get

Since we decided to go this live performance route instead of shacking up in a studio, we now have to bring the studio to US to get this thing recorded properly. We've already hired an audio professional to come in and help us record. We'll get the songs, simple and broken down, the way that we wrote them, and we'll be able to record the audience at the same time with mics placed strategically throughout the venue. This means YOU GET TO BE A PART OF THESE ALBUMS... if you're there. ;) 

We're offering a SUPER LIMITED NUMBER OF TICKETS (50) to this special performance, and asking that you help us make funding this thing a little easier by simply pre-ordering the albums that we plan to release from the show. This helps us TREMENDOUSLY, because it puts much less of a burden on us to have to provide funds up front to try to get these songs available to you. 

We've set a flexible goal of $2,000.
This will cover:

  • Cost of the venue

  • Hiring a professional engineer to record, mix, and master the audio

  • CD design, artwork, and production, as well as exclusive t-shirts

  • Promotion, travel, and project finalization

We're offering many different pre-order packages to campaign supporters. These include anything from: 

  • An EXCLUSIVE limited number of TICKETS to the recording show
  • Digital media (albums in both MP3 and WAV listening formats)
  • Physical CD copies
  • EXCLUSIVE t-shirts specific to the live recording show
  • Signed set lists from both artists on the night of the recording show

...And even a private, in-home performance! 

 

Now, Here's Why We Need Your Help

We're both completely INDEPENDENT artists. We don't have the backing of some record label throwing money at us. We don't have managers, or booking agents, or ANYONE putting in the leg work for us. We simply put in the time. But, we can't do it all by ourselves, and that's where you come in. 

Let's face it, recording quality music is expensive. We've written songs that we're proud of, songs that tell stories about our lives, our experiences, and those around us, and we want to share them with you. There is no extra "pocket money" that we're taking home at the end of this. No matter how much we're able to raise, every penny goes into these projects.

Every concert ticket we're able to sell, that $15 gets put towards making these albums happen, and that's a super intimate live show that the listener gets to experience. Not only that, but they have the ability to OWN the recording from that night, from the concert that THEY ATTENDED, and relive that setting whenever they want.  Every CD pre-ordered adds a little bit more to our budget, and helps us fund this thing a little easier. And as soon as production is finished we'll have your CD in the mail to YOU, right TO YOUR DOOR STEP!

We're creating a new kind of relationship with YOU, the listener. We're moving outside of the box, and setting a new precedent in how music can be shared and experienced with others, and we're pretty dang excited about it. 

We're asking you to come join us on September 21st. Come live this thing out with us, and help us fund these projects by pre-ordering the music we're going to showcase!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute, but if you'd still like to help, you can do so by sharing our campaign to help us get the word out! Share it with your friends on social media, AND via word of mouth to the music lovers in your life.

We greatly appreciate your help, and we can't wait until September 21st! Hope to see you there with us!

THANK YOU!

story:
Who We Are, Where We're Going

627 Stomp originated several years ago as an idea by Amanda Bernice to instruct people in vernacular dance styles. Taking its name from the Pete Johnson composition and the local musicians' union, its very foundation intended to harness the spirit of Kansas City style jazz. To this effect, it has experienced modest success, including weekly Lindy Hop classes at City in Motion studios, gigs performing choreography at Union Station, and even establishing a three-day dance event known as Kansas City Stomp. Over the years, and through frequent interaction with the local community, it has become apparent that there is much more to the city's jazz heritage than the act of dancing itself. Proud of what our history has given us, and reflecting on the current state of progress in chronicling said history, it became apparent that we too could take an active role in keeping the tradition alive by bringing a fresh perspective of young dancers - a lens that is presently overlooked and undervalued.

627 Stomp seeks to reach a place where it can execute its new core values. Paramount among them are:

  • Producing academic-quality research into Kansas City jazz culture - music, lifestyle, and dance - resulting in articles, performances, interviews, and other digestible media.
  • Providing free access and expertise on vernacular dance to disadvantaged communities who are unable to actively participate in the collective Kansas City jazz world.
    • Working closely with other local non-profits to perform acts of charitable service to the less-fortunate of Kansas City.
  • Partnering with other historical jazz-oriented organizations, as well as leveraging our positive working relationships with local musicians, to effectively promote Kansas City as a jazz capital on a regional and national level.
  • Teaching weekly vernacular dance lessons, paired with historical background on the instructed-upon dances.
  • Creating unique, immersive events with local partners that seize upon the spirit of Kansas City jazz within the context of Prohibition.

Give a Little, Get a Little

Unfortunately, we cannot make the transition to 501(c)(3) status alone. We need the help of our community to assist in achieving this milestone:

  • Based on our estimates to incorporate, file applicable fees as well as the application itself to become a non-profit, we are looking to raise $1,600 to achieve our goals. Any money that remains after paperwork is filed and status is approved will immediately be reinvested into our general community fund.
  • In return for the vote of confidence shown in our mission, 627 Stomp is offering the gamut of thank yous upon completion of the campaign, including, but not limited to, free private dance lessons, vintage fashion accessories crafted by members of our dance community, and free performances at your next special event.
  • If we do not reach the goal that is set for us, we will work with what we have been given, and determine alternate means to arrive at the benchmark we have set. In the spirit of transparency, we will keep all donors informed of any success or ground covered outside of this initial campaign.

The Impact

We cannot express the enormous difference that you will be making by helping us reach our fundraising goal, and what that will ultimately mean for the stakeholders in the Kansas City community, whether its the part dedicated to jazz, or to the city at large:

  • Obtaining non-profit status puts the organization into position to apply for and receive important arts and research grants, allowing us to produce academic works on Kansas City jazz history, as well as offering greater educational dance experiences through lessons and public events.
  • Coordinating and planning community-enhancing events with other Kansas City jazz non-profits, offering a fresh, viable voice of organized young dancers and other jazz enthusiasts.
  • Allowing for the community, in turn, to have a direct and unencumbered ability to participate in the organization by creating annual donation-based memberships - whether it's a more laid-back approach of simply helping to steer us in the direction of desired monthly dance series, or being more immersive by lending your voice to board meetings.

It's Not All About the Money!

We understand that life can set unexpected challenges ahead of us, and that now might not be a good time to contribute financially. However, the spirit of community is what drives the vehicle of this endeavor. You can still help us in other ways:

  • Word of mouth is huge in Kansas City! Let people know about this fundraising campaign by sharing on Facebook, Instagram, and other social media! And for the more traditional among us, drop a word about us in face-to-face conversation.
  • Volunteer at 627 Stomp events! Monthly "rent parties" are being held with live music and refreshments, for example, and it is always appreciated to have extra hands on deck to help set-up, break-down, and clean-up before and after our guests leave.

story:
Sorrow Estate Strikes Again with The Happy EP!

One year ago Sorrow Estate raised $5,000 to support the creation of their first album which can be found here. Since then Laura has been writing and working on another full-length album which is set to drop January 2018. However, that album is a bit heavy (focusing on themes of womanhood, abuse, and mental health...yikes!) so she decided to put out an EP of happy songs at the end of this summer. This campaign will fund the making of The Happy EP! The six song EP will include Sorrow Estate classics such as "Blood Red Sunsets" and "Tandem". 
It focuses on the beauty of relationship, love, and nature. 

 

In just one month...

We will record, mix, master, and release this EP. Yup. Everything is happening this month in real time. It's going to be a bumpy ride, but we're in for it!

 

The T-shirt and Poster Design...

As a songwriter, I collect blessings and challenges along my path and hope to make them into something beautiful. All I can do is offer it saying, "here, I got these for you".

This has been the goal of Sorrow Estate since the beginning: to gather together the thistles and the weeds; to share, beautify, and redeem.

This illustration designed by Kari Hillman is available on posters and t-shirts in the perks. The posters have a glossy finish. The t-shirts range from size XS-3X. If you do not see an option for your size, just notate which size you would like in the comment section.  The t-shirts are Gildan Softstyle Jersey T-shirt. 

They are...

-4.5 oz. 100% pre-shrunk ringspun cotton jersey; Heather colors are poly/cotton blends

-Double-needle stitched for durability

-Soft, lightweight cotton fabric

-They run small

 

The budget is broken down like this:

My team for this project includes...

Chelsea Lee, harmony extraordinaire, who will be gracing the EP with her angelic oohs.

James Johnson, my youngest brother, who played bass on the last album. This time around he is acting as my producer and audio engineer.

The talented, Scott Long, who engineered the last album is switching roles and will mix and master The Happy EP.  

Kari Hillman, my birthday twin, is the best designer I know. She graciously designed our t-shirt and poster.

 

Sorrow Estate is....

the independent folk project of Laura Beth Johnson, a 22-year-old  from Upstate New York. It has been described as, "Poetic lyrics and haunting melodies meandering through a unique blend of folk, rock, and jazz."

The band name comes from a Bright Eyes song titled, "Laura Laurent". The song opens with the line, "Laura, are you still living there in your estate of sorrows?" The speaker reaches out to this character, Laura, who seems to feel imprisoned by her sufferings. He then relates to her by revealing his own self-doubt and failures ending with this sentiment, "You should never be embarrassed by your trouble with living. Because it's the ones with the sorest throats, Laura, who have done the most singing." In this way, the speaker comforts her from his own sorrow estate. I'd argue he is only able to because of it.

 

Can't buy things because you're a college student and money is hard?

No worries! I get you. I do.

Luckily being short on cash doesn't mean you can't help. My marketing plan as of now relies heavily on the interaction and engagement of people on social media. You can find us on Instagram and Facebook. Following us there and sharing this page on those platforms helps spread the word!

Instagram: @sorrowestate

Facebook:  facebook.com/sorrowestate

 

Thank you all in advance for your love and support!

I can be contacted at sorrowestate@gmail.com.

 

-Laura

story:
Project Summary

Hey folks! Thank you for checking out our EP crowdfunding project.

We're Paris Plan, a 4-piece alternative soul/RnB band based in Melbourne, Australia. We are Lauren Boomgardt (vocals), Benjamin Walters (guitar), Nathan Price (bass), and Chelsea Allen (drums). We're often joined onstage by our beautiful friend and superlative muso, Phoebe Elsworth (keys). We've had an extremely busy first year as a band - playing a bunch of great gigs, writing heaps of original music, and recording a couple of singles which we released digitally.

The aim of our crowdfunding project is to help us raise funds to produce our DEBUT studio EP (extended play) recording, which will be available as a CD and for digital download.

We're deeply passionate about our music, and we hope to produce something that our friends, families, and fans will love to listen to and be a part of. Because that's what we're creating - crowdfunded, people-powered music!

What We Need & What You Get

We're organised, motivated and ready to record!

We've raised $1500 ourselves, and we need a further $6000 to cover the costs of engineering/tracking the EP in a professional studio, as well as mixing, and mastering costs. Here's how these costs breakdown:

  • Tracking and mixing costs in studio: $5500
  • Mastering costs: $700
  • EP artwork: $200
  • Distribution, promotion, and printing costs: $1100


PERKS, GUYS!

The beauty of crowdfunding is that it's not all about us! In exchange for your donation to our campaign, we'll be rewarding YOU with a range of PERKS, including copies of the EP itself, launch gig tickets, our forthcoming 7" vinyl single, cool Paris Plan merchandise like t-shirts and tote bags, executive producer credits on the EP (your name in the liner notes!), a CONCERT BY US AT YOUR PLACE, and even HUGS from the tallest, good-lookin'est member of the band! When you're ready to donate, you can check out the range of rewards on offer, with love from us to you.

What if we don't hit the target?

One of the benefits of using the Indiegogo platform to crowdfund an art project is their flexible funding model - that is, if we don't hit our target of $6000, we are able to keep whatever funds are partially raised. Although we're positive thinkers, and sure we'll hit our target, we do have a plan for how to use any partial funds raised. We have the ability to record fewer EP tracks (3-4), and work with our engineer on a tighter budget and to tighter timeframes. We'll need to be organised and well-rehearsed, but that's a given for us anyway.

Risks & Challenges

There are inherent risks in any creative project, but these can be minimised by ensuring we're working with the right people, and that we're well organised and prepared. We have set a timeframe of several days in the studio, but sometimes delays are inevitable due to sickness, family issues, technical issues, etc. To combat this, we have scheduled our studio time months in advance, and have a second contingency recording period planned, in the event of any delays. Our chosen studio recording engineer is also a friend and mentor to us, so there is a certain degree of flexibility in our recording schedule. We intend to post regular updates about our recording, so you can keep up to date with our progress!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute money to our project - no worries! Life is tough and money is tight, as we well know. But that doesn't mean that you can't help, and that we won't love your guts for any support you can give. You can still get the word out to people you might know who might be interested and able to support, or to like and share our promotional video and campaign on all the forms of social media. Help us make some NOISE! The Indiegogo share tools are an awesome way to share our project, especially on Facebook and via email.

That's all folks!

We're Paris Plan, and we'd be grateful for your support - directly, it'll help the music and arts scene in Melbourne thrive and flourish, and you can be proud of your contribution! With your help, we hope to contribute a collection of music that is empowered, creative, beautiful, and hopeful, with a side of ass-shaking goodness.

story:
Shipping NOW!    

((( EMAIL FOR SHIPPING QUOTE TO HAWAII AND ALASKA BEFORE ORDERING.))

                                                      bill@rtguitar.com

 

Several Patents and Trade Marks Protect Our Technology

and Inovations.

Passion and Commitment to accomplish  

​* Clarity 
* Sustain                                           ​
* ​Balance 
* Instrument Stability

I’ve seen this before…

You may be saying, “Yeah, I’ve seen that on an archtop” or maybe on a very old Gibson. While the Reverse Tension strings going to the tail of the guitar may look familiar, you actually have not ever seen this before. On those other guitars the playing strings extend over the saddle and continue to a tailpiece that holds the strings in place. This is really not a friend of tone. Much of the energy in the vibrating strings is not forced into the top and continues traveling to the tailpiece adding no tonal value to the instrument.

Our playing strings terminate right behind the saddle, just like most other acoustic guitars. You can use any standard guitar strings you prefer. The separate Reverse Tension strings start in front of and continue over the saddle to the tail. Tightening our Reverse Tension tail strings to relieve the pressure of the playing strings frees the top and also applies more down pressure on the saddle. The string energy is forced into the top more efficiently. More string energy and less bracing = Volume, Sustain, Balance and Tone. There are several potential warranty issues solved by the Reverse Tension system as the top of the instrument has been stabilized and cannot pull up nor can the bridge pull off the instrument as has happened to many guitars from the past after years of the 170 to 200 pounds of forward pull from the playing strings.

Luthier - Bill Martin

       RT Guitars wants to put a great guitar at an affordable price into the hands of every player. 

 With your help, this can become a reality and you save more than 55% ($500.00) on a new RT Guitars 430 series guitar and get FREE B-BAND electronics for being a part of this campaign and hopefully sharing this opportunity.

YOU PAY $399.00 including electronics. Regular price is $899.00

 

RT Guitars is the only company in the world licensed to use the Reverse Tension Bridge and Soundboard patents. The Reverse Tension system and soundboard bracing pattern gives our guitars superior balance and a clear voice with more volume and sustain.

 

RT Guitars started as a custom built guitar shop, but that cost thousands of dollars. This limited the number of customers who can get an RT Guitar. Many players wanted an RT Guitar but couldn't afford the price of a custom built instrument.

This put Luthier Bill Martin on a 3 year journey to find the perfect manufacturer that had the appropriate factory, knowledge, and precision to perfect and build the Reverse Tension Guitar line at a price point most anyone could afford.

Our manufacturer is a 30 year + instrument builder and this is his 20th year owning his own China instrument manufacturing company. He is truly a Master Guitar Builder taking great pride in providing a high quality product. (The picture below is his craftsmanship on our Flagship Guitar the 930 series. WOW! We are in awe!)

 

 

Comfort Edge

The Comfort Edge is an exciting new feature added to the entire RT Guitars line. You can play for hours with no discomfort. Just imagine how nice it will feel not to have the binding edge cutting into your arm.

The selected manufacturer built 51 guitars for us as we perfected the instruments over the past several years. We now have over 100 guitars in stock and have delivered 150 plus guitars from our first prototype shipment with 100% Satisfaction from our customers. Proving we are ready to offer this new innovation to the acoustic guitar world.

Set up

Each Guitar is inspected and set up by Luthier Bill Martin before shipped to you.

Take advantage of this low price limited offer RT Guitars is providing in order to put these exciting quality instruments into your hands as a way to share the experience with you and others. That's what this campaign is all about!

The 430 series is unmatched at the price $399, so take advantage of this Indiegogo campaign. You'll be glad you did! And if you share it with your friends they will be happy too!!!

Visit the RT Guitars website to see the full line of Reverse Tension Instruments. There are many more pictures of each specific model:

Instrument  Measurements

                              SJ Models

                                 

                                     D Models

 

                                        OM Models

Make your instrument choice and become a part of the Reverse Tension Revolution today!

http://www.rtguitar.com

Also, like us on Facebook for exciting news coming soon!

https://www.facebook.com/RTGuitar

Thank you,

Bill Martin and the RT Guitar Team

http://www.rtguitar.com

Thank you,
Bill Martin and the RT Guitar Team

story:
Getting Right To It.

Hello, we are Wicked Aura.


From the streets, where our humble beginnings as a Batucada band fired off, on the tiny island of Singapore in 2004, our love and passion for percussion and drums drew all of us together to pioneer a movement unlike any, on this little red dot. Our vision spanning 12 years has culminated in a brand new album, 6 years in the making.

Today, we embark on a new dream, a new journey, with you. 
We bring you BEGINNING THE END. 

We need a minimum of 25,000 USD to get this off the ground, and expect to work on this together with you. We ask that you help us raise 14,000 USD as a minimum goal, and we would do the rest.

But if you do help us reach 25,000 USD we have some more cool stuff to share with you. 

And if you help us go even further, we will add more perks for all backers thereafter!!


Beginning The End. 

For the past 6 years, the band have worked long and hard on this album. We plunged headlong into the deconstruction of percussion rhythms, mixing them up in a musical genre blender just to see what comes out. The end product of our musical and pretty emotional journey resulted in a collection of songs that make up our second full length album entitled "Beginning The End". 

We are so proud to have worked with some of music's best talents on Beginning The End. The album was recorded in Singapore at 32Bit Recording Studio, before bringing the stems to Signature Sound Studio in San Diego where the vocals were finalized by band leader, Budi and mixed with Chris Cummings (Icona Pop, Avicii). Michael Patterson (for an alternate mix of the single My Aura is Wicked). The album was mastered with Gavin Lurssen of Lurssen Mastering Inc, LA, California, USA. Adam Wang (Dem), whose part of Singapore's urban art collectives RSCLS and TAC, took on the challenge and responsibility of designing and the layout of Wicked Aura’s Beginning The End. 

The entire album has been recorded, mixed and mastered with our own money. We stand by it, we believe in it, and now we want you to have it in your hands!

It is finally ready and the band wants to get the music out to YOU, and to the world!


It's In Your Hands.

Its up to you, we want it in your hands. And here are some goodies you'll can get in exchange of supporting this campaign. 

In this campaign, you'd find a Limited Edition "Beginning The End" Double LP Vinyl, a Indiegogo-only Commemorative Coffee Table Book specially designed in the spirit of combining music and the arts, The "Frontman Bundle", Special Events Bundle, T-Shirts, Wicked Aura stickers and many more!

  • The glorious Beginning The End Double LP Vinyl, which is exclusive to this campaign only. Its one you won't want to miss! Adam Wang (DEM), part of Singapore's urban art collectives RSCLS and TAC, took on the challenge and responsibility of design of vinyl. 

  • In the spirit of making music and art, we hope to bring you a beautifully designed Commemorative Coffee Table Book to complement those glorious vinyls.  This project represents a collection of art from visual artist both local and international (such as Stefano Centonze from Rome and our very own Sam Lo and Dawn Chua) whose creative expression of "Beginning The End" seeks to thrill evoke, charge, arouse and life one through life's journey. The art computed serves as an extension of the musical journey brought to you by Wicked Aura who holds art very dearly and close to their heart. 

    This is available only via our INDIEGOGO campaign

  • Indiegogo Only Perks

    1. 1st 100 Vinyl 2LP will be handwritten serialised, and signed by the band.

    2. Coffee Table Book - specially designed in the spirit of combining music and the arts. Done by visual artist from all over the world + some cool old photos.

    3. The Frontman Bundle (Budi Kilt and shirt)

    4. Wicked Aura Special Backers T-Shirt

    Want to dress like frontman, Budi? Well, now you can! The Frontman bundle includes Budi's kilt and shirt that he wears for most of Wicked Aura's shows as seen in the image below! (We will get you new ones we promise... unless you're really after his sweat and If thats your thing... cool!)



  • Indiegogo-Only Special Event Bundles

1. 1-on-1 Workshops with Wicked Aura senior percussionists! 

2. Corporate Workshops

3. Book Us for Our Percussion or Live Shows at a special discount!

4. Special Pre-release listening session + Hangout with the band + Surprise

 


We really need your support to help us make all of these beautiful art and music come alive! 


Where The Money Flows

To date, we've spent over SGD 70000 on 2 re-recordings, producer fees, mixing fees, flights and accommodation to USA and also for producers to fly in to Singapore, etc.

But note that none of your contributions here, are going to pay for what we've already invested. 

Here's how we intend to use the money. We're going forward and funding: 

1. 2LP Gatefold 180gm Vinyl Production - SGD 16000
2. Shipping - SGD 1000 (min)
3. Merch Production -  SGD 8000
4. Ticketed Launch Event - SGD 12000
5. Organize a Pre-Listening Event - SGD 1000
6. Pay the visual artists a portion of the receipts for their contributions
7. Pay the wonderful contributors, The Basement, Hosni, Asmat who helped us make the videos you see on our youtube these next 6 weeks! - SGD 3000


Stretch Goals!

If we hit 25000 USD 

- You've hit our true funding goal, and that means we can scale up our launch event and throw in a surprise!

If we hit 50000 USD 

- We will get our asses to Australia on our own accord and organize a (free) show there for you in Summer 2016/2017! 

-We will also Survey and Hire a hotshot PR team for 3 x 4 month campaign in AUS, US and UK/DE/FR respectively. We want to make sure the music gets heard.


Thank You!

We would like to thank Brasilando.SG for helping us sound good with the high quality percussions that we've been rocking with this past year!. 

Hosni, Asmat, The Basement, Bedsty Artist Management, Adam Wang (DEM)... and EACH AND EVERY ONE OF YOU WHO CONTRIBUTED!


Other Ways You Can Help

Every bit of help counts. Help us spread the word!

  • Share this on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram!
