The end product of our musical and pretty emotional journey resulted in a collection of songs that make up our second full length album entitled "Beginning The End". 

We are so proud to have worked with some of music's best talents on Beginning The End. The album was recorded in Singapore at 32Bit Recording Studio, before bringing the stems to Signature Sound Studio in San Diego where the vocals were finalized by band leader, Budi and mixed with Chris Cummings (Icona Pop, Avicii). Michael Patterson (for an alternate mix of the single My Aura is Wicked). The album was mastered with Gavin Lurssen of Lurssen Mastering Inc, LA, California, USA. Adam Wang (Dem), whose part of Singapore's urban art collectives RSCLS and TAC, took on the challenge and responsibility of designing and the layout of Wicked Aura’s Beginning The End. 

The entire album has been recorded, mixed and mastered with our own money. We stand by it, we believe in it, and now we want you to have it in your hands!
It is finally ready and the band wants to get the music out to YOU, and to the world!


It's In Your Hands.

Its up to you, we want it in your hands. And here are some goodies you'll can get in exchange of supporting this campaign. 

In this campaign, you'd find a Limited Edition "Beginning The End" Double LP Vinyl, a Indiegogo-only Commemorative Coffee Table Book specially designed in the spirit of combining music and the arts, The "Frontman Bundle", Special Events Bundle, T-Shirts, Wicked Aura stickers and many more!

The glorious Beginning The End Double LP Vinyl, which is exclusive to this campaign only. Its one you won't want to miss! Adam Wang (DEM), part of Singapore's urban art collectives RSCLS and TAC, took on the challenge and responsibility of design of vinyl. 

In the spirit of making music and art, we hope to bring you a beautifully designed Commemorative Coffee Table Book to complement those glorious vinyls.  This project represents a collection of art from visual artist both local and international (such as Stefano Centonze from Rome and our very own Sam Lo and Dawn Chua) whose creative expression of "Beginning The End" seeks to thrill evoke, charge, arouse and life one through life's journey. The art computed serves as an extension of the musical journey brought to you by Wicked Aura who holds art very dearly and close to their heart. This is available only via our INDIEGOGO campaign





Indiegogo Only Perks
1. 1st 100 Vinyl 2LP will be handwritten serialised, and signed by the band.
2. Coffee Table Book - specially designed in the spirit of combining music and the arts. Done by visual artist from all over the world + some cool old photos.
3. The Frontman Bundle (Budi Kilt and shirt)
4. Wicked Aura Special Backers T-Shirt
Want to dress like frontman, Budi? Well, now you can! The Frontman bundle includes Budi's kilt and shirt that he wears for most of Wicked Aura's shows as seen in the image below! (We will get you new ones we promise... unless you're really after his sweat and If thats your thing... cool!)







Indiegogo-Only Special Event Bundles



1. 1-on-1 Workshops with Wicked Aura senior percussionists! 
2. Corporate Workshops
3. Book Us for Our Percussion or Live Shows at a special discount!
4. Special Pre-release listening session + Hangout with the band + Surprise
 

We really need your support to help us make all of these beautiful art and music come alive! 



Where The Money Flows
To date, we've spent over SGD 70000 on 2 re-recordings, producer fees, mixing fees, flights and accommodation to USA and also for producers to fly in to Singapore, etc.
But note that none of your contributions here, are going to pay for what we've already invested. 
Here's how we intend to use the money. We're going forward and funding: 
1. 2LP Gatefold 180gm Vinyl Production - SGD 160002. Shipping - SGD 1000 (min)3. Merch Production -  SGD 80004. Ticketed Launch Event - SGD 120005. Organize a Pre-Listening Event - SGD 10006. Pay the visual artists a portion of the receipts for their contributions7. Pay the wonderful contributors, The Basement, Hosni, Asmat who helped us make the videos you see on our youtube these next 6 weeks! - SGD 3000


Stretch Goals!

If we hit 25000 USD 
- You've hit our true funding goal, and that means we can scale up our launch event and throw in a surprise!
If we hit 50000 USD 
- We will get our asses to Australia on our own accord and organize a (free) show there for you in Summer 2016/2017! 
-We will also Survey and Hire a hotshot PR team for 3 x 4 month campaign in AUS, US and UK/DE/FR respectively. We want to make sure the music gets heard.


Thank You!

We would like to thank Brasilando.SG for helping us sound good with the high quality percussions that we've been rocking with this past year!. 
Hosni, Asmat, The Basement, Bedsty Artist Management, Adam Wang (DEM)... and EACH AND EVERY ONE OF YOU WHO CONTRIBUTED!


Other Ways You Can Help Every bit of help counts. Help us spread the word!  Share this on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram!

story:
Thank you for stopping by my Indiegogo Page!  This campaign is simple: it's about releasing my first record by YOU pre-ordering it ahead of time!  It's no different than buying it at a record store or on iTunes, just that you are reserving your copy ahead of time so that I can finish it, package it, promote it, and make it even more amazing.


The release of this initial EP (short record) is following an incredibly beautiful ride I've had over the last few months, creating and releasing my first self-produced and self-directed single and music video for my song "desirable".  You can check out the gorgeous video my team and I were able to make here, thanks to a successful Kickstarter campaign last summer:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yKR_nWsCeYc.  We were able to do a lot on a $5,000 budget.  So much, actually, that both OUT.com  (OUT magazine) and EQmusicblog.com premiered the video for me and interviewed me about it, which was awesome.

OUT magazine premiere (and interview): http://www.out.com/music/2015/3/17/exclusive-ja...

EQmusicblog premiere (and interview): http://eqmusicblog.com/premiere-watch-desirable...

I'm really excited to release my debut EP as James Panther.  I've been a singer/songwriter for 13 years, and this will be the first record I'll be publicizing.  It is really important for me to have a release out so that anyone can have copies of the songs I've worked so hard to record and produce the way I want.  Some of them have been waiting for 3 years to be released!  Having the record on iTunes and other digital downloading platforms and on CD, as well as getting press out in the world is the next crucial step forward for me.


What I Need & What You Get

I need $5,000 to get YOU and the world my music, and the money will be allocated for the following (from highest priority onward):

  • additional mixing and mastering 
  • graphic design for album cover
  • pressing CDs
  • digital distribution for album
  • publicity
  • remixes of "Desirable" (so the empowering track can live in the clubs!)
  • cheap, reliable car for tour 
For those who go above and beyond a pre-order, I have cool perks, like my first batch of Merch (stickers, buttons, T-shirts), guerilla serenades, astrology readings, voice or piano lessons, private concerts, and more!  Check them out!


The Impact

As I mentioned above, this is the next crucial step for me to emerge as a more "legit" artist in the eyes and ears of the music industry, not to mention listeners like YOU.  I'm playing live shows now and have no CDs to sell, which is making it hard to move forward.  People have been asking me where my CD is for months (even years) as I've been playing out while recording and wanting to finalize these tracks, and it's time for me to deliver them to walk my talk as a recording artist.  This is so much of what I'm here to do; make records and play shows, play shows and have records to sell to people who connect with the music!  An artist with a record out also has many more opportunities for publicity, getting reviews, getting tracks licensed for commercial use, and this is a great time to release this work, as I'm coming off of a good amount of press from my music video release.    

On a more spiritual note, I care so deeply about the health and wellness of the planet, and specifically the LGBT community, and even more specifically LGBT youth.  The more exposure I get as an artist and the more my music is out and visible, AND the more I keep going sustaining myself with record sales, the more I can grow into a leadership role for these kids and use my voice to make a difference in the world with music as my platform.  Without a record out, it's hard to do that.  

As I also mentioned above, I have a successful track record with implementing funds in a good way.  It was kind of amazing, surprising, and a big deal that my first music video (which i created using this Kickstarter): https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/jamespanth... got picked up by OUT.com and EQmusicblog.com, and now I just want to keep going.  I want to release this music, make more videos, write more songs, and grow my presence in the world for the benefit of all. 


Risks & Challenges

Honestly, what is amazing about this platform is that it's low risk for me.  To juxtapose this platform with something else, I'd like to share something with you.  Last month, I launched my second Kickstarter to raise money for me to go on a national tour and partner with big LGBT rights organizations in addition to releasing this EP.  I asked for $15,000 so i could do a huge, radically LGBT-youth-centered national tour, organizing all ages shows and playing anywhere in the country that would have me.  

After about a week, I realized I didn't have the energy to raise the funds for and promote something that big by myself, and so I chose to let it go.  I realized that I made a Kickstarter for one of my overarching life goals, and bit off more than I can chew right for this summer.  Combining the high monetary goal with Kickstarter's all-or-nothing model made the pressure overwhelming.  I've since gone inside myself and had a strong insight that it's best for me to stay close to home in the Pacific Northwest at this stage, release this record, generate more exposure, and continue playing in my bio-region, adding members to my live show setup, and generating some new live video content for youtube.  

So all that said, I can honestly say that everything is set up to have a simple and successful release if and when I raise these funds!  The record is mostly recorded and just needs some final mixing and mastering, the engineers are lined up and ready to go, as are my publicist, booking agent, and distribution platforms and CD pressers.  


Additional Ways You Can Help

If you could get the word out via social media, word of mouth, or email about my campaign I'd really appreciate it.  What's cool about this campaign is it's kind of like my own personal record store.  If you've EVER heard my music, or have time to check it out and have 5 bucks to get yourself a digital copy, that goes a long way if 1,000 people like it too!  You can hear some of the tracks at soundcloud.com/jamespanther.


Thanks for reading and for your support, and for helping change the way new music is released.  I truly appreciate your generosity.

story:
About Me.

Hi! My name is Shea. I am an R&B/Soul singer,songwriter, and recording artist. I am from Lake Ozark, Missouri and currently reside in Temecula, California. I have decided to start my own Indiegogo campaign in order to raise money and support for the new Electronic Press Kit that I am working on in order to better brand myself and my music. I am working on this particular project because I feel that it will give me a better edge and help me stand out professionally as a singer and songwriter.  I was very hesitant, and still am in some ways, about starting a campaign like this, but decided to try it out anyways. I figure that sometimes the things that make you a little uncomfortable just may be some of the best things for you. 
Get to know me:
 While growing up, I was constantly learning how to sculpt my craft and solidifying more about who I wanted to be as an individual, artistically and personally. I learned quickly that music was a strong passion for me even before I had learned how to share it openly with others. Because my mom was a singer as well, I was able to experience many of her shows in an up close and personal way at a very young age.  My mom pushed us to learn how to be comfortable in front of people we didn't know when we would perform together for different events. Performing for others can be a difficult task on its own, but try performing alongside your family members when dressed up as an elf, reindeer, and Mrs. Claus with sets of jingle bells in both hands. Needless to say, I was not allowed to be shy.
  We grew up listening to all different musical genres, however, R&B and Soul have definitely been my favorites consistently. I started playing piano when I was about 7 years old and after a couple of years of lessons I started testing my luck at learning how to play piano by ear. Playing by ear helped me push to experiment with songwriting. I was involved heavily with choir and band throughout my years in high school. Even though I was also involved in sports and other activities, I'd have to say that I was quite the music nerd and I'm dang proud of it!
After graduating high school, I pushed toward my degree at the University of Missouri in Columbia, Missouri.  Although Speech Pathology is an unbelievably worthwhile and meaningful career path, my passion has still maintained to be within my music. Ultimately, I have all these original ideas that I would love to share with the world through my songs. I have a unique style and a free mind that keeps me from being scared to create something a little bit different from the current norms. My music is typically very positive and mellow with a soulful edge. 
 The most difficult part is that many times my passion also comes with a cost. If you are choosing to help me fund this project, you are essentially helping me to place my passion first as a career path and showing the additional support that I need as an independent artist.  I truly appreciate those of you that choose to be a part of this journey with me even if you are not able to contribute financially!


The SHEA Project & What You Get Back.

I am looking to create a 6 or 7 song EPK ( Electronic Press Kit) album in order to present myself in more of an appropriate way to record label representatives, as well as to the general public. The album will be released to iTunes when completed! In a lot of ways, this project is meant to re-brand myself as an artist or at least polish what I already have in the works. Also, I'm looking to put the project out within the next 6 months! This project includes:

-Studio and Recording Expenses (Recording, Mixing, Mastering, Etc.): $500-$700 per song

-Photography (Album Art, Website Photography, Etc.): $200-$800

-Videography (Professional music video for at least one of the songs off of the album):$600-$2500

-Copywriting expenses: $200-$450

-iTunes Registration: $35-$250


These are some basic cost ranges and estimations for some of the processes involved in this project. I have not set my goal at the actual amount that it will take for the full project, but rather at closer to 50 percent of what I will actually need. Even if I do not reach my entire goal for this fundraiser the money raised will still be put toward these costs for the project. 

If you donate I will be sending you thank you gifts as soon as the campaign ends! Please check out the list of perks for more information!


Risks & Challenges.

There is a lot of risk putting together a fundraiser as such because you are definitely putting yourself out on the line. It's difficult to ask people for money, especially when everyone has their own daily struggles, and it is not something I typically allow myself to do. Please do not donate if you are in a financial struggle of your own and your contribution to my project would further that burden! There are plenty of other ways you can show your support that don't involve money!

-You can like my Facebook Artist page!   

    https://www.facebook.com/aehs.hannavas

-You can subscribe or follow me on other social media accounts!

    ReverbNation: https://www.reverbnation.com/shea3

    SoundCloud: https://www.soundcloud.com/shea-37

    YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/savannahSHEAgivens

    Twitter: https://www.twitter.com/_shea_my_name

    Instagram: @_shea_my_name

-You can check out my website! 

     sheamyname.com

-If you have $0.99 you can purchase my single "InVerse" on iTunes!

    https://itun.es/us/Tp9e4

-You can like, share, and post about my music and project to help spread the word! Social media is an awesome way to help me share my music with people all over the world!

    https://www.facebook.com/aehs.hannavas
-You can subscribe or follow me on other social media accounts!
    ReverbNation: https://www.reverbnation.com/shea3
    SoundCloud: https://www.soundcloud.com/shea-37
    YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/savannahSHEAgivens
    Twitter: https://www.twitter.com/_shea_my_name
    Instagram: @_shea_my_name
-You can check out my website!

story:
Save Our Songbook

Technology has transformed the world and our culture, allowing instantaneous communication, real-time news and information of all sorts, from every possible viewpoint.  But there is one important area where the promise of technology remains unfulfilled, and that is in allowing free access to the vast archive of recorded music, shows and performances from the inception of recorded sound to today.  Even worse, since the invention of recording, America has adopted this technology to the exclusion of all else, so that recordings are the only archival historical resource that remains relevant, and unfortunately, those recordings are locked up, with some available to those who can afford to purchase them, but most gathering dust in a vault. 

Our culture is literally buried in a Time Capsule.

About a year ago, American Songbook Preservation Society set out to build a digital repository to make these precious resources available to anyone, for free.  What we found is reminiscent of a post-apocalyptic science fiction movie, with a barren landscape dominated by warring factions.  Being the plucky anti-heroes that we are, we are wading into this quagmire and are asking you to join us, not to defeat some evil empire, but to save a bunch of great music from irrelevance and create a new space in American culture for pop music that is past its popularity, and too good to be consigned to the cultural trash heap. 

And so we present to you - the Great American Songbook. 

The period from 1920 to 1960 represents the apex of American popular music, that produced a treasure trove of talented musicians the likes of which the world has never known before or since.  From vocalists like Frank Sinatra and Ella Fitzgerald and composers/lyricists such as George and Ira Gershwin and Irving Berlin, America gifted the world with music of a higher caliber, but today that music has all but disappeared from the cultural landscape.

The Great American Songbook is a body of music that is lauded the world over for representing the zenith of American culture and songwriting at its best.  And it has never before been so important to take action to preserve and restore this vital cultural resource and access to it.  With vinyl and compact disc recordings quickly becoming a distant memory, record stores disappearing and live performance dwindling, there is a very real danger that this music will be lost to future generations.  Perhaps Tony Bennett put it best when he said, “This is America’s classical music.”

As you might imagine, bringing this vast resource to a place where anyone can access it, for free, is going to be a huge undertaking that will require lots and lots of money.  But we are two guys, who don't have millions to throw down, so we beginning with much more humble goals.

Cataloging/Preservation/Education

We have established a wiki at www.greatamericansongbook.org/wiki to catalog and link to existing performances around the Internet and also to serve as a repository for recordings and educational materials developed by American Songbook Preservation Society.  We will need a small army of volunteer contributors and moderators to keep the information up to date as new resources become available and others vanish.  Our immediate goal for this part of the project is to determine what is out there with a much better degree of certainty than is possible at the present.  As this effort gains momentum, we look toward establishing an Oral History Project, creating original multimedia resources and engaging in advocacy aimed at resolving copyright restrictions that currently make our goal of free access prohibitively expensive.

Performance

We want to host an Inaugural Gala Concert as a way of promoting the music, giving opportunities for singers and musicians to practice their craft.  On July 4, 2016, we want to put on the biggest concert we can afford, based on the level of donations received, to promote the Great American Songbook to an ever-widening group of advocates who will attend, volunteer and help fund more concerts in areas throughout the country.

Team

Ronald S. Kaplan

Ron Kaplan is a singer who has focused his career on continuing the tradition of performing songs from the Popular and Jazz Standards of the Great American Songbook. He performs regularly, and has released nine albums, including his most recent, a career retrospective that was released in 2014.  In addition to his career as a concert performer and recording artist, Ron Kaplan also is the founder and executive director of American Songbook Preservation Society, which for twelve years has been pursuing the goal of preserving the cultural resource known as the Great American Songbook.

Stuart I. McCammon

Stuart I. McCammon has enjoyed a long career in the nonprofit sector, including stints at Boys & Girls Clubs of America, University of Southern California and Children's Hospital Foundation of Orange County.  He is a nonprofit serial entrepreneur, building successful programs from scratch, and has been fortunate to work alongside many experts in a variety of areas including website development, video production, nonprofit management, event marketing, direct mail, annual giving, nonprofit law, corporate/foundation relations, major and planned gifts, cause-related marketing and school/governmental agency collaborations.

Funding/Rewards

Our goal for this Indiegogo project is $50,000.  With that, we feel like we can get the wiki started off successfully and throw one heck of a party/concert on July 4, 2016.  But more importantly, we want to engage people - as many as we possibly can, because that is what is going to breathe life into this music.  We figure there will be a whole bunch of people who get excited about the Great American Songbook and decide to support one of the many other groups that are working on different aspects of this music, and that is OK.  We also hope that many, many people will rediscover these performances and decide not to wait for our digital repository to be built, and just go ahead and buy recordings for their personal enjoyment, and that is OK too.  And if we don't raise the $50,000 that is also OK.  We have already put up the wiki, and will still host a concert at whatever level is possible with the donations received.  The concert will be located in the Aptos, California area, and all tickets are for admission only, and do not include any travel to or from the concert venue.

Amount/Reward

$1/ASPS membership

$25 /ASPS Sticker

$50/ Inaugural Gala Concert - one General Admission ticket.

$75 /American Songbook Preservation Society - Singing The Great American Songbook CD

$100/American Songbook Preservation Society 52 min. Documentary film DVD

$150 /Gold Circle Inaugural Gala Concert - one Gold Circle ticket.

$200/American Songbook Preservation Society  117 min. Concert DVD

$250 /VIP Inaugural Gala Concert - one VIP ticket, including admission to pre-concert VIP reception.

$500 /VIP Inaugural Gala Concert Experience - one VIP ticket, including admission to exclusive pre-concert VIP reception  and after-party attended by concert performers, musicians and media.

$1,000/Great American Songbook Wiki Partner - "Partner" name identification on the Great American Songbook Wiki, located at www.greatamericansongbook.org/wiki

$2,500/Great American Songbook Wiki Supporter - "Supporter" featured name identification on the Great American Songbook Wiki, located at www.greatamericansongbook.org/wiki

$5,000/Great American Songbook Wiki Presenter - "Presented by" featured name and logo identification on the Great American Songbook Wiki, located at www.greatamericansongbook.org/wiki

$10,000/Associate Producer - "Associate Producer" name and logo identification in all concert advertising, program and promotional materials, Ten VIP Inaugural Gala Concert tickets, Ten pre-concert VIP reception tickets, Ten VIP after-party tickets, One autographed Inaugural Gala Concert CD, One autographed Inaugural Gala concert DVD

$25,000/Producer - "Producer" name and logo identification in all concert advertising, program and promotional materials, Limited edition personal recognition artwork, Ten VIP Inaugural Gala Concert tickets, Ten pre-concert VIP reception tickets, Ten VIP after-party tickets, One autographed Inaugural Gala Concert CD, One autographed Inaugural Gala concert DVD

$50,000/Executive Producer - "Executive Producer" name and logo identification in all concert advertising, program and promotional materials, Limited edition personal recognition artwork, Ten VIP Inaugural Gala Concert tickets, Ten pre-concert VIP reception tickets, Ten VIP after-party tickets, One autographed Inaugural Gala Concert CD, One autographed Inaugural Gala concert DVD

$100,000/Master of Ceremonies - "Presented by" name and logo identification in all concert advertising, program and promotional materials, Opportunity for one person to be the Honorary M.C. and participate in the stage show, Limited edition personal recognition artwork, Ten VIP Inaugural Gala Concert tickets, Ten pre-concert VIP reception tickets, Ten VIP after-party tickets, One autographed Inaugural Gala Concert CD, One autographed Inaugural Gala concert DVD

Impact

We see a future where schools can access free sheet music and arrangements of Great American Songbook music, where singers and musicians have a rich, vibrant array of opportunities to perform this music for others, where legions of fans can access archival footage of old performances and appreciate new, talented singers and musicians that are keeping the flame alive.  This music is too good to consign to a museum - it needs to be seen, heard and performed, and this Indiegogo Project is just a humble beginning of a huge vision to preserve and protect a uniquely American cultural treasure.

Risks and Challenges

We have dealt with all of those along the way to conceptualizing the Indiegogo Project you see today.  We set out a year ago to establish the digital repository, and found that copyright holders want huge sums to access their assets, that video copyright is still prohibitively expensive and oriented more toward showing in movie theaters than on the Internet, and that very little of these performances are even available.  We would like to address all of these issues as we raise funds, engage in advocacy and establish relationships with copyright holders, but for now, this project is viable and free from the obstacles that led us to this path.

Other Ways You Can Help

Anything you can do to promote  this project to your friends is appreciated - we are aggressively pursuing interview opportunities and free advertisements in all media, and when it gets down to it, we are a nonprofit.  Join the American Songbook Preservation Society.  Contact us if you want to start a chapter - we haven't gone there yet, but would love to see this effort go all grassroots on us.  Have a carwash, start a memorial fund for a loved one, tell your friends to send us money instead of wedding presents - the possibilities are limited only by your imagination.  And we can't do it without you.
story_txt:
Save Our Songbook
Technology has transformed the world and our culture, allowing
instantaneous communication, real-time news and information of all sorts, from
every possible viewpoint.  But there is
one important area where the promise of technology remains unfulfilled, and
that is in allowing free access to the vast archive of recorded music, shows
and performances from the inception of recorded sound to today.  Even worse, since the invention of recording,
America has adopted this technology to the exclusion of all else, so that
recordings are the only archival historical resource that remains relevant, and
unfortunately, those recordings are locked up, with some available to those who
can afford to purchase them, but most gathering dust in a vault.  
Our culture is literally buried in a Time Capsule.
About a year ago, American Songbook Preservation Society set
out to build a digital repository to make these precious resources available to
anyone, for free.  What we found is
reminiscent of a post-apocalyptic science fiction movie, with a barren landscape dominated
by warring factions.  Being the plucky
anti-heroes that we are, we are wading into this quagmire and are asking you to
join us, not to defeat some evil empire, but to save a bunch of great music
from irrelevance and create a new space in American culture for pop music that
is past its popularity, and too good to be consigned to the cultural trash
heap.  
And so we present to you - the Great American Songbook.  
The period from 1920 to 1960 represents the apex of American
popular music, that produced a treasure trove of talented musicians the likes
of which the world has never known before or since.  From vocalists like Frank Sinatra and Ella
Fitzgerald and composers/lyricists such as George and Ira Gershwin and Irving
Berlin, America gifted the world with music of a higher caliber, but today that
music has all but disappeared from the cultural landscape.
The Great American Songbook is a body of music that is lauded
the world over for representing the zenith of American culture and songwriting
at its best.  And it has never before
been so important to take action to preserve and restore this vital cultural resource
and access to it.  With vinyl and compact
disc recordings quickly becoming a distant memory, record stores disappearing
and live performance dwindling, there is a very real danger that this music
will be lost to future generations. 
Perhaps Tony Bennett put it best when he said, “This is America’s
classical music.”
As you might imagine, bringing this vast resource to a place
where anyone can access it, for free, is going to be a huge undertaking that
will require lots and lots of money.  But
we are two guys, who don't have millions to throw down, so we beginning with
much more humble goals.
Cataloging/Preservation/Education
We have established a wiki at
www.greatamericansongbook.org/wiki to catalog and link to existing performances
around the Internet and also to serve as a repository for recordings and
educational materials developed by American Songbook Preservation Society.  We will need a small army of volunteer
contributors and moderators to keep the information up to date as new resources
become available and others vanish.  Our immediate
goal for this part of the project is to determine what is out there with a much
better degree of certainty than is possible at the present.  As this effort gains momentum, we look toward
establishing an Oral History Project, creating original multimedia resources
and engaging in advocacy aimed at resolving copyright restrictions that
currently make our goal of free access prohibitively expensive.
Performance
We want to host an Inaugural Gala Concert as a way of promoting
the music, giving opportunities for singers and musicians to practice their
craft.  On July 4, 2016, we want to put
on the biggest concert we can afford, based on the level of donations received,
to promote the Great American Songbook to an ever-widening group of advocates
who will attend, volunteer and help fund more concerts in areas throughout the
country. 
Team
Ronald S. Kaplan
Ron Kaplan is a singer who has focused his career on continuing
the tradition of performing songs from the Popular and Jazz Standards of the
Great American Songbook. He performs regularly, and has released nine albums,
including his most recent, a career retrospective that was released in 2014.  In addition to his career as a
concert performer and recording artist, Ron Kaplan also is the founder and
executive director of American Songbook Preservation Society, which for twelve years has been pursuing the goal of
preserving the cultural resource known as the Great American Songbook.
Stuart I. McCammon
Stuart I. McCammon has enjoyed a long career in the nonprofit
sector, including stints at Boys & Girls Clubs of America, University of
Southern California and Children's Hospital Foundation of Orange County.  He is a nonprofit serial entrepreneur, building
successful programs from scratch, and has been fortunate to work alongside many
experts in a variety of areas including website development, video production,
nonprofit management, event marketing, direct mail, annual giving, nonprofit
law, corporate/foundation relations, major and planned gifts, cause-related
marketing and school/governmental agency collaborations.
Funding/Rewards
Our goal for this Indiegogo project is $50,000.  With that, we feel like we can get the wiki
started off successfully and throw one heck of a party/concert on July 4,
2016.  But more importantly, we want to
engage people - as many as we possibly can, because that is what is going to
breathe life into this music.  We figure
there will be a whole bunch of people who get excited about the Great American
Songbook and decide to support one of the many other groups that are working on
different aspects of this music, and that is OK.  We also hope that many, many people will
rediscover these performances and decide not to wait for our digital repository
to be built, and just go ahead and buy recordings for their personal enjoyment,
and that is OK too.  And if we don't
raise the $50,000 that is also OK.  We
have already put up the wiki, and will still host a concert at whatever
level is possible with the donations received.  The concert will be located in the Aptos, California area, and all tickets are for admission only, and do not include any travel to or from the concert venue.

ticket.

Great American Songbook CD

story:
When you help me in Japanese, please look at the Motion Gallery website.

日本語での支援をご希望の方は、以下のリンクから応援をお願い致します。

MotionGallery web site

This project for “A Chain Rapture Tour” include J-Pop Summit Festival and making a new CD！


[Project Concept]

It's been 5 years since we played our very first show overseas. And we keep playing overseas too now. It means so much. We are greatly grateful for your continuous attentions and many loves to our band and music.

We are a unsigned band. We have been working on tour arrangements and promotions by ourselves so far, being helped by many people who supports us. And this year, our band will be 10 years old in August. This is amazing! But we also feel we need to do something new now to grow our band bigger, like to find sponsors, bookers, recording labels, etc. Financial issues are now getting bigger to us these years.

Fortunately, we've got several official invitations and slots to play shows from some music events from many other countries. But we had to give up some of those opportunities for high travel expenses. We are facing a problem. We have been managing our band expenses by engaging in our daily jobs. But now, we need to fix our whole band business, especially financial. We need to catch up with expanding our own band activities to hand our music to the world.

Your kind considerations and helps here will bring the band good exposure. J-Pop Summit Festival that we are attending is getting bigger. We believe it could be a great chance for our promotion. And your supports here also make us able to reach the east coast to hand our latest album that we launched last summer. We couldn't make it to the east coast last year.

Please get the band out to the tour!

Your helps will make the band better!!

We are now making new songs and special limited tees and bandanas only for this project!


[About "A Chain Rapture Tour 2015"]



This coming summer, The Akabane Vulgars On Strong Bypass is having shows at J-pop Summit Festival again. Then they are going to run up to NYC after J-pop and going to tour about a dozen of cities in east coast.



[A Chain Rapture" Tour 2015 Dates]

August 7-9th- Fort Mason Center and union Square

J-Pop Summit Festival- San Francisco, California-All Ages

http://www.j-pop.com/

August 11th- Everybody Hits- Philadelphia-All Ages
http://everybodyhitsphila.com/
August 12th- 1984- Wilmington, Delaware -21+
http://www.1984wilmington.com/
August 13th- The Crown Red- Baltimore, Maryland-18+
http://thecrownbaltimore.tumblr.com/
August 14th- The Metropolitan Kitchen -Annapolis, Maryland -18+
http://metropolitanannapolis.com/
August 15th- Bathtub Republic -Washington, D.C.-18+
https://www.facebook.com/bathtubrepublic?fref=ts
August 16th- Banditos- Richmond, Virginia-18+
http://banditosburritolounge.com/
August 17th- The Saint-Asbury Park-New Jersey-18+

http://www.thesaintnj.com/

*NOTE-More dates may be added Official Web Site


[About New Album]


SAMPLE

We released this album last year! Listen here↓

Soundcloud


New Album will...

Include 3 studio recording trucks and 3~4 live recording trucks

Recorded July 10th

Released by August 2nd


[Returen]


Your name on our Official Web Site as SPECIAL THANKS

Supporter's name will on our Official Web Site

A postcard

design of “A Chain Rapture Tour 2015” poster
include member’s handwritten autograph



New CD's data and Jacket image data

MP3 data of song trucks by whole new album
and JPEG data of new album’s jacket and card

to your E-mail!!
You would be the first listener of the new album!

(Image)



Limited design Bandana (All Hand Printed)

Limited design for our 10th anniversary and "A Chain Rapture Tour 2015"
ALL HAND PRINT by silkscreen on bandana!!

Limited design T-shirt (All Hand Printed)

Limited design for our 10th anniversary and "A Chain Rapture Tour 2015"
ALL HAND PRINT by silkscreen on bandana!!
You can choice your size!
(S, M, L, XL, XXL, XXXL)

(Image)



Tour video data of behind the scene of A Chain Rapture Tour 2015

The video data which took when we did shopping, sleeping, eating, or spending time on the road during “A Chain Rapture Tour 2015”.

(Image)


Video data of the new song (Studio practice Ver.)

The video data which took when we did practice in a rehearsal studio. 

(Image)


Original Wood print by Kei (Drummer of the band)

Include Kei’s handwritten autograph and limited caption
Send as a postcard (about 5’×6’)
The material to use is sumi, paper, aqueous paint

(Image)


Original Drawing by Miki (Bassist of the band)

Include Miki’s handwritten autograph and caption
Send as a postcard (about 5’×6’ or more bigger we guess)
The material to use is some pens, paper

(Image)



[Band BIO]


[Band formation]

In 2005, Miki Uchizono (the bassist of the band) started to form a band; The Akabane Vulgars on Strong Bypass. She got her sister, Yumi Uchizono, for a guitarist and vocalist, and also got Kei Sofue for a drummer. After a month later from their gathering, they had their first show. They just played covers. It was august, 2005, Miki and Kei still were senior high school students. After played covers from Japanese garage rocks over a year, the band started making their own songs.


[Strong motivation for playing shows]

Since their gathering, they have been very strenuous to play shows. They did about 5 shows a month tops. The band mentioned about this that, we feel there are numerous things happening during a show, which tells us so many.  That's why we think we need to be on stage. Experienced many shows, the band produced 3 DYI albums by
Kei Sofue(Dr.)  Yumi Uchizono(Gt.Vo.)  Miki Uchizono(Ba.) 2011. Then, in 2012, their energy for shows jumped out of Japan.


[Music and concepts]

They call themselves a punk band. Their thoughts for indifference to discriminations, and their anger for things unenlightened causing
“AEON”
Jul 2014
“Proclamation”
Jun 2013
“Live in Brooklyn“
Jun 2013 discriminations, those in their minds made their songs strongly spirited and unique. And being genuine is a their motto. Excessive rejection to acting like a imitation rock musician, which give unique fierceness and passion to their performance. Literally, hundreds of shows grew the band. 


[Tours and Festivals so far]

2012

SXSW (Show case, Japan Nite)
North America Tour (J-Pop Summit Festival)
30shows

2013

North America Tour (J-Pop Summit Festival)
50 shows

2014

North America West Coast Tour
(J-Pop Summit Festival)
U.K. And Northern Ireland Tour
(Sun Flower Festival)


[Risks & Challenges]

We'll continue this project if it does not reach its goal!!
And we are sure return will sent to you if it does not reach its goal!!

story:
Hear Josée Vaillancourt sing  Unde Quocumque, (Hildegard von Bingen, composer).

Your donation will allow The Manitoba Early Music & Arts Festival, Inc. to record and produce a CD of Canadian composer Constantine Caravassilis' new work. Five songs will be recorded as part of this new song cycle scored for

baroque soprano voice : Josée Vaillancourt
2 violins : Boyd MacKenzie & Barb Gilroy
viola : Katherine Bonness
cello : Desirée Abbey
bass : Stan Label 
baroque oboe : Joël Verkaik
baroque guitar : Terry McKenna
viol da gamba : Felix Deak
harpsichord : Eric Lussier

The lyrics come from chosen epigrams by French Renaissance poet Pernette du Guillet who died in 1545  at the tender age of 25 years..

Epigram VIII - excerpt

''En mon esprit me faict appercevoir

Ce, que mes yeulx ne sceurent oncques veoir.''

(He helps me to perceive within my mind

That to which my eyes were ever blind.)

As we already have secured public funding  for part of the project, your donation will contribute to the following recording budget costs :

Recording engineer & producer : $3,000

Mixing (6 days @ $500) : $3,000

Mastering (2 days @ $500) : $1,000

Photography, Art Work & Design : $1,000

300 CD units Printing & Packaging : $2,000 

Hear an excerpt from  one of Constantine's previous compositions : 


This new work will be premiered in a concert on September 20th, 2015, in Winnipeg, at the St. Norbert Catholic Church. Be a part of this great venture, find out what new music sounds like on ancient instruments, and contribute to the birth of an amazing new creation in Canadian music.

Five songs will be recorded as part of this new song cycle scored for

story:
Hi I'm Jules! / Hola soy Jules!

 
I'm a Music Business Consultant from SAE Institute and an events manager. Find out more about me clicking here Soy graduada de Music Business de SAE Institute y soy productora de eventos. Para conocer más de mí, haz click aquí
The Project / El Proyecto
I want to be a Tour Manager, but I've heard it's tough out there on the road for a girl.

Fortunately I've been given a scholarship to attend CATO Academy, a training program in London to learn everything there is to know about the touring side of the music industry.

What I want to do is create a web series  to share my own experience attending CATO and also find other women who are already working as Tour Managers, Stage Managers, Roadies, Sound Engineers, and other live music related professions.		 Mi meta es ser Tour Manager, pero he escuchado que este un trabajo difícil para una mujer.

He tenido la fortuna de recibir una beca para asistir a CATO Academy, un programa de formación en Londres para aprender todo lo relacionado con la industria de la música en directo y las giras.

Me propongo crear una web serie para documentar mi propia experiencia como estudiante de CATO y también me propongo conectar con otras mujeres que ya están trabajando como Tour Managers, Stage Managers, Roadies, Ingenieros de Sonido, etc.

My goal is to bring these women forward and share their stories, so we can create a HUB OF INFORMATION for other women that might be interested in making a career in live music, but don't even know where to start!


Mi objetivo es compartir estas historias, de estas mujeres y la mía propia, y crear un Centro de Información digital para otras mujeres que pudiesen estar interesadas en esta carrera pero quizás no saben por donde empezar


The timeline would be as follows:
- August-November 2015: CATO Course in London - Research and Interviews.
- December 2015: Going to New York City to find more women!
- January-February 2016: Editing of all the footage.
- March 2016: Launch of the Web Series.
El programa del proyecto sería:
- Agosto-Noviembre 2015: CATO Academy en Londres - Investigación y entrevistas.
- Diciembre 2015: New York - Investigación y entrevistas.
- Enero - Febrero 2016: Edición del material.
- Marzo 2016: Lanzamiento de la Web Serie.

What I'm most excited about is being able to show other women what's out there and make them aware of all the challenges and opportunities that they might find while breaking into this profession. 
We'll do it together!


Lo que más me emociona del proyecto es poder mostrar de primera mano todas las oportunidades y retos que existen para las mujeres que quisieran empezar esta carrera.


What you're getting for your support 
¿Qué obtienes por tu apoyo?
Apart from participating in an awesome project, you'll get to be featured as Executive Producer of the series, and be a proud supporter of significant future changes in the music industry. You will also get early access to the finished materials and other exciting perks.
Serás acreditado como Productor Ejecutivo de la serie, recibirás el material terminado de forma exclusiva por adelantado y podrás contribuir activamente en un proyecto que puede significar un primer paso hacia grandes cambios en la industria de la música. También hay otras recompensas muy guapas!


What the funding is for / ¿Para qué son los fondos?

All the funding that I receive will be broken down into:
- The rest of the course's tuition fees not covered by the scholarship (1000 GBP).
- Living costs while in London: Flights & Visa Costs, Housing, Food, Transport, Internet.
- Production costs: Filming Equipment, External HD, Post Production.

Todos los fondos serán utilizados para lo siguiente:
- La parte restante de la matrícula del curso no cubierta por la beca (1000 GBP).
- Manutención en Londres por 3 meses: Billetes de avión, alojamiento, alimentación, transporte e internet.
- Costos de Producción: Equipos de filmación, disco duro externo, post-producción y edición.


I believe this is important. Do you?

It is not a secret that female representation in the music industry is significantly less compared to men and this is something that can and should change. And I also believe that one of the reasons for this is the lack of resources and information.

So that's why I believe that sharing my own journey and those of other women who are killing it  in the music business will serve as  great inspiration for a  NEW GENERATION OF FEMALE LEADERS IN THE MUSIC INDUSTRY.


¿Crees que es un tema importante?

Para nadie es un secreto que la representación femenina en la industria de la música es considerablemente menor a la masculina, y creo que uno de los motivos para esto es la falta de información y recursos disponibles. 

Por ello creo que compartir mi propia experiencia así como la de otras mujeres que ya lo están haciendo servirá de inspiración para una NUEVA GENERACIÓN DE LÍDERES FEMENINAS EN LA INDUSTRIA DE LA MÚSICA.


SO, GO AHEAD, MAKE MY DAY! :)

SUPPORT THIS PROJECT NOW AND BE PART OF SOMETHING THAT CAN BRING POSITIVE CHANGES IN THE MUSIC INDUSTRY TODAY


APOYA ESTE PROYECTO Y SÉ PARTE DE UNA INICIATIVA QUE PUEDE TRAER CAMBIOS MUY POSITIVOS EN LA INDUSTRIA DE LA MÚSICA 


Sharing is Caring!! / COMPÁRTELO!

Remember, you can also support this project by sharing it with your friends!  So hit that SHARE button right now! It is as good as contributing and it helps A LOT! 

You can follow me on Twitter @jules_ruza to receive updates on the project even if you don't put any money into it!

RECUERDA COMPARTIR ESTE PROYECTO CON TUS AMIGOS Y SÍGUEME EN TWITTER PARA CONOCER LOS AVANCES DEL PROYECTO @jules_ruza 

______________________________________________________

*Special thanks to Alejandro Rojas from TKSH Films and Leo Aldrey from Audiobend for helping with the video :)

*Agradecimiento especial a Alejandro Rojas de TKSH Films y Leo Aldrey de Audiobend por su ayuda con el video :)

story:
Summary

Music is a Gift, inc is a Non-Profit organization striving to solve the problem of division. We do this by enabling people to share joy and sorrow in the language of music. Music is the language of our 'Being', and transcends whom we materialistically appear to be. As we gift our love for others in the language of music, the world, we believe, can be less divided.  

With your contribution, we will finish our web-based platform where people share their story of love and care for others. We will turn those stories into incredibly creative musical presentations, and gift them to the 'Lovees', the people in the stories. Each presentation will be broadcast live on our website for 'shared enjoyment', the deepest form of human happiness. As we enjoy these moments together, the division among us will gradually fade away. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are raising $30,000. 2/3 will be used for completing our web-based platform, which includes live-broadcasting functionality among others. The rest will be used for our very first Gift Project, which is scheduled to take place in the 4th quarter of 2015.

Our financial statements will be visible to everyone on our website, and updated frequently to be 100% transparent with our finances. 

As a 501(c)3 organization, your contributions will be tax deductible, and we will provide the necessary paperwork so you can benefit from it.

We came up with some ideas to express our gratitude for your contributions including T-Shirts, VIP invitations to our MiG Music Awards, and so on. Please refer to the perks page for details. 

Regardless of the amount, every donor will be our Angel Member. Angel members will have access to many of our operations and projects that public will not have access to. It may include access to the backstage, brainstorming sessions for Gift Projects, and so on. 

The Impact

The problem of division is ubiquitous, and getting worse every single moment. Politics and religions have their rolls, but we believe that the cure is found within us. We may look different, and use different languages, but we all become true to ourselves in music. As Bob Marley said, "we can cure hate by injecting music and love into people's lives." 

Please help us build the platform of sharing love in music. As we march forward with this mission, our world will become more fun and happier place to be. 

The Gift Projects will take place anywhere in the world. When we visit where you are, please come out and celebrate with us. Angel Members will have advance notice to our plans and schedules. 

Other Ways You Can Help

As you can imagine, our operation will require tremendous amount of manpower and creative minds. We are looking for people with talents in virtually every field - media, web, project management, choreography, recording, lighting, sound systems, accounting, logistics, writing, and so on. If you want to contribute to our audacious mission with your talents, please don't hesitate to contact us at operations@musicisagift.org. Someone from our organization will be in contact with you!

Also, please share this campaign with your friends and family to spread the words. 

Thanks in advance for your support!!

Sincerely,

Team Music is a Gift

story:
Who is Crystal Rose?

A singer-songwriter based in Kansas City, Mo. I’ve been singing for as long as I can remember and started performing at age 12. Started with the radio, then choir and now coffee shops and gigs. Believe me, I love the coffee shop setting and honesty, as it allows for an almost uncomfortable amount of intimacy with listeners. BUT free shows can only get you so far. This is a passion project that I’m finally ready to pursue. Passion precedes project because passion is what keeps me going. Singing is something that I have to do and shouldn’t waste my time doing without passion. I fully believe in doing things with excellence and that’s why I’m doing this kickstarter. 


What I Need & What You Get

It turns out passion can't fully fuel an EP…You also need funds and some friendly support doesn’t hurt either. This summer, I’ll be working hard in KCMO with some talented people at JTL group to make this dream a reality. We will be producing and writing to make sure that this EP is top quality, showcases my best talent while staying true to me. The Goal for this music is to be sent out and showcased to representatives.

There are many aspects that go into recording and making an EP. I need $5,000 to make this thing happen. All the funds raised will directly go to Recording, Mixing and Mastering 3 songs.

•  Studio Time - Hired Musicians - Producing - Mastering


Perks

Every donor gets a thank you card or letter :)

•  A house/garden show for you & all of your friends

•  I’ll be your singing gram 

•  I’ll perform acoustic covers at your dinner party

•  My vocal support on your single!

•  Vocal lessons

and more Check out right side of webpage!


Risks & Challenges

This is not an easy task. At first I thought not raising my goal was the biggest risk and challenge but it’s not. The hard part is setting aside my fears and choosing vulnerability. Choosing to show you where I am at but also where I could and wish to be.  I’m choosing to not just be a dreamer but to be a doer as well.

*If I don't reach my goal, I will have to work with what I've raised and produce less...Maybe one or two songs instead of three.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can’t support me financially?  Share some love by posting and sharing this kickstarter on all of your social media platforms. Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, MySpace [if for some odd reason you still use your profile] am I missing any? Oh, also make sure to mass email your family with this link as well. You can also just bring it up in conversation. I appreciate your participation big or small, Thank You!

Stay Connected

Make sure to follow me on social media for updates on this journey.

Facebook: www.facebook.com/CrystalRoseMusic

 Twitter: @RoseyClutch

Instagram: CrystalRosekc

 Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC78QmGjVdUgq5iwJqpsafOg


Thanks and Much Love to:

Brooke Roach for helping kick this thing off, sharing your creative brain and your time.

Lance Flores for the beautiful photos and your time.

Nathan Happer for whipping my video together and your time.

Zane Callister for your time and lending me your  track "1558" from your All Creation Waits album.

Love Ya'll -Teamwork makes the dream work!

story:
Summer music? Yes please!

The Stinson Community Association has been proudly supporting "Songs from the Bishop" in Bishop's Park for 4 years! It is one of our longest running programs and one we'd love to keep running indefinitely. A small, intimate setting, local musicians & singer-songwriters play to small audiences of no more than 50, with both sides of the stage enjoying the benefits of up-close interaction.

Sadly, our funding has been stretched past the limit this year, forcing events such as our local 100in1 Day events, "Art in The Park" and "Fireflies in the Night", being funded out-of-pocket by our passionate members, who still want to keep wonderful things happening in Hamilton. 

We want to pay our artists...

Previous Songs events have been run with token payments to performers, borrowed equipment, and time hacked out of already overloaded schedules. But the first place your funding will go to is increasing the amounts we can afford to pay performers a more competitive rate. They love playing for us. It breaks our hearts to be unable to properly compensate them, and for them to have to say no to be fair to other festivals paying regular rates.

Any funding not used to pay artists will be used to upgrade equipment, going to assist in the costs of cable replacement, speakers, and possibly some infrastructure to make the performance area safer and easier to see.  

It's not just a guy with a guitar.

We're asking you to help keep Songs going.  Keep our children dancing, and our friends and neighbors having a great way to enjoy a summer evening in the park together. It's one of the Community Association/Planning Team's primary events, and hopefully this year, we can strengthen our outreach to residents in our divided community.

For the many patients in our area's numerous Residential Care Facilities, this is the only time they see live music, and we frequently have folks dancing with walkers in the square!

Free means FREE

 We want to keep this going. We NEVER want to charge admission. We don't want to make anyone feel unwelcome by putting a price on participating. But without funding, all we can do is let it end. 
 

We don't want to stop the Songs. Please help.

If you can't donate, just share. Spread the word.

If you know of funding opportunities we might take advantage of, email info@StinsonCommunity.ca  and we'll get to work.

 Previous Songs events have been run with token payments to performers, borrowed equipment, and time hacked out of already overloaded schedules. But the first place your funding will go to is increasing the amounts we can afford to pay performers a more competitive rate. They love playing for us. It breaks our hearts to be unable to properly compensate them, and for them to have to say no to be fair to other festivals paying regular rates.Any funding not used to pay artists will be used to upgrade equipment, going to assist in the costs of cable replacement, speakers, and possibly some infrastructure to make the performance area safer and easier to see.     It's not just a guy with a guitar. We're asking you to help keep Songs going.  Keep our children dancing, and our friends and neighbors having a great way to enjoy a summer evening in the park together. It's one of the Community Association/Planning Team's primary events, and hopefully this year, we can strengthen our outreach to residents in our divided community.For the many patients in our area's numerous Residential Care Facilities, this is the only time they see live music, and we frequently have folks dancing with walkers in the square!   Free means FREE  We want to keep this going. We NEVER want to charge admission. We don't want to make anyone feel unwelcome by putting a price on participating. But without funding, all we can do is let it end.    We don't want to stop the Songs. Please help. If you can't donate, just share. Spread the word. If you know of funding opportunities we might take advantage of, email info@StinsonCommunity.ca  and we'll get to work.

story:
Deltacappella loves meeting new audiences and sharing our diverse Memphis roots "a cappella style." Nothing comes close to the feeling we have while you, our fans, share our music with whistles, yells, and standing ovations.

That's what happened recently at the prestigious vocal competition VoiceJam 2015--the crowd was amazingly enthusiastic, as were the judges. Our 12-man vocal band took first place and was awarded the chance to go to Shanghai, China, to lead masterclasses and to perform at the hugely important a cappella festival VocalAsia, August 5-10.

That's the awesome news. The not-so-awesome reality is that the grand prize includes a travel subsidy of only $5,000. Once we arrive in China, our meals and lodging will be taken care of by our hosts. But first, we have to get there. If you'd like to help us buy 11 round trip tickets, it will enable us to introduce our uniquely Memphis vocal band to audiences in Shanghai.

We're seeking $19,000, which when combined with the $5,000 prize, will cover 12 airfares at approximately $2,000 each. (Current airfares are fluctuating between $1,850 and $2,050 each.)

We are grateful for your help. When we return, we will host a "Homecoming Celebration" concert. And you're invited.

Visit our website www.deltacappella.com and listen to samples of our music on Tunes!

story:
Here's the Story!


Hello Family! Saudia Young actress/singer/waitress is here back in the funding saddle again!
  • I have a few Big Wig Gigs coming up and I really could use that classic 'Little Black Dress and Heels' to fit the bill!
  • If you add to the cash You will help me through the front door instead of the back one, at the swanky events, so I can Blow their Socks off and snag some more well paying gigs and opportunities in the future!


We Need 500 Euros for Saudia's new Betty Page Dress & Riccardo Cartillone shoes!


  • Betty Page dress is 180 Euros
  • The shoes are 300
  • Dress is priority because I can probably pull it off with shoes that I have already but you know what they say. 'The Shoes Make The Woman' !

History & Back Story & ... the Future

  • The idea was prescribed by my friend & confidence Doctor:  Laura Johnson AKA Lady L.
  • Past funding stats: I successfully raised funds and produced 2 EPs.
  • This action is virtually re-opening the Pandora's Artist Funding box for me  because I am madly writing a new album as you read this. Stay tuned for that fundraiser. It will be a Kicker.

Risks & Challenges

Transparency. .

  • I am very qualified to spend your money on pretty things that I will prance around the stage in.
  • Any extra money raised will be used for Rice, Beans & 

    Crémant

    (Champagne)

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please discretely  get the word out and make some noise  to a few friends who you think would dig it.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you for your time and money! Love Saudia

story:
ENGLISH

We are BLOW and we're starting a crowdfunding project to record a CD and DVD.

We started playing in the streets, and since then we've played a lot of stages and clubs. A lot of people have asked us to record our music, and now the time has come! We've worked hard, played hard, and gathered a lot of facebook fans from all over the world - thank you for liking our page - and now we need your support more than ever.

Recording and filming costs a lot of money, and we'll be needing a lot of stuff:

We have to rent:
- a studio
- an engineer
- mixing & mastering
- a camera crew
- a director
- ... (and everything else we'll be using in the video)
- we need artwork
- we have to print all that stuff onto a disk
- we're also designing t-shirts...
- et cetera et cetera

We're talking a lot of money, say 8500 euros / 6092 pounds / 9294 dollar / 1,12 million yen

We've done the math, and if every facebook liker donates one euro, the job is done! But, there's more: you can pre-order the CD+DVD, buy a t-shirt or invite us to play at your pool party!

We hope we can make this dream come true and we promise to make the best possible CD + DVD for you guys. The name of all contributers will be in the credits on the album!

In advance, thank you.


FRANCAIS

Nous sommes BLOW et nous avons monté un projet de financement participatif afin d'enregistrer un CD+DVD (2 en 1!).

Nous avons commencé par jouer dans la rue, mais depuis, nous avons joué sur pas mal de podiums et dans des clubs. Beaucoup de personnes nous ont demandé d'enregistrer notre musique. Et voilà: le moment est arrivé!
Nous avons bien travaillé et nous nous sommes bien amusé, en accueillant de plus en plus de fans sur facebook, de partout dans le monde - merci d'aimer notre page! Et aujourd'hui, nous avons besoin de votre soutien plus que jamais!

Enregistrer et filmer coûte cher et il nous faudra pas mal de trucs:

* Il faut louer:
- un studio- un ingénieur du son
- mixage et mastering
- une équipe de caméra
- un régisseur
- (et d'autres choses dont on aura besoin dans notre vidéo)

* Il faut faire le lay-out
* Il faut mettre tout sur le disque (évidemment)
* Nous concevrons aussi des T-shirts* etc, etc.

Nous parlons de beaucoup d'argent, disons 8500 euros.Nous avons fait le calcul, et si chacun qui nous like sur facebook donnait 1 euro, on y arriverait!

Mais ce n'est pas tout ! Vous pouvez pré-commander le CD+DVD, acheter un T-shirt ou nous inviter à jouer à votre fête!

Nous espérons pouvoir réaliser ce rêve et nous vous promettons de faire le meilleur CD+DVD possible pour vous! Les noms de tous les contributeurs seront dans les crédits sur l'album!

Nous vous remercions d'avance!

story:
9/11 Circle Wind Concert for Taylor Anderson

1) Hi, my name is Misayoshi Ebato, the Crowd Funding Manager for the 8th Annual 9/11 Circle Wind Concert, also a Base Member of Japan Choral Harmony (JCH) “TOMO,” hosting the Concert. I am very excited about us hosting this.

2) We have been sponsoring the Concert since its inception in 2011 for the Victims’ Families of the 9/11/2001 WTC Disaster, and 3/11/2011 Tohoku Earthquake & Tsunami Disaster as well.  And this year, we would love to dedicate the Concert to Ms. Taylor Anderson who was an American English teacher and who was lost after sending her children to safer places in the 3/11 Tsunami in Japan. She had told her friends that she hoped to be a Bridge between Japan and the U.S. 

3) A newly formed Choir after the Disaster, “Never Give Up Taylor’s Choir” from Ishino-maki/Higashi-Matsushima will be invited to New York and perform an original musical “100 Ways of Saying Thank You” at the Concert with great appreciation to American people for their support to recover from the 2011 devastation. The Choir consists of about 50 local residents, including several students who were taught English by Taylor. During the Concert, one of the ex-students will read a letter expressing her sincere appreciation to Taylor’s hard   work and great efforts for the improvement of their English conversation.

4) Also invited to the Concert will be the descendants of a Samurai delegation (1613 Keicho Mission), so-called “Japon-san” from Coria del Rio, Spain. After the 3/11 Big Earthquake & Tsunami, several Japon-sans read many Haiku's praying for the re-covery of their home Town in Japan. Those Haiku's were later presented to the Mayor of Ishinomaki in 2013. Lately those Japon-san read some Haiku dedicating to Taylor, and some of them will be recited by themselves during the Concert.

5) In the meantime, Mr. Kazusada Sumiyama, a father of one of the 9/11 victims wrote a new choral song “Orizuru no Tabi” (A Journey of a Folded Paper Crane) for the Concert.The song will be played by us JCH “Tomo” as a world premier at the Concert. As usual, Mr. & Mrs. Sumiyama will attend the Concert along with some U.S. & Japanese Families of  9/11 Victims.

6) The Concert Program consists of 2 major parts --- the 1st part is mainly played by the Manhattan Symphonie Orchestra (MSO) conducted by Gregory Singer, and the 2nd part played by JCH "Tomo" and "Never Give-up Taylor's Choir.  In the 1st part, MSO will introduce a new choral song "It is Meant to Be" dedicated to Taylor which is written by Gregory and is sung by JCH "Tomo."
Short Summary
Your contributions to this unique once in a life-time Concert will greatly help assist "Never Give-up Taylor's Choir" come to NY. We are passionate about hosting it, and we hope you will join us at the Concert. And if you cannot do so, please help us fund this Concert by donating through this crowd funding. Since we are an NPO registered as 501 (c) (3) in the U.S., any amount of your Donations will be Tax-Deductible.  The funds donated shall be directly paid 100% to the 9/11 Circle Wind Memorial Concert Corp (NPO) after 5% Fee paid to this sitesponsor IndieGoGo.com.
Thank you very much.

story:
We Are Just Like You

There's been a lull in the music scene around here. We've been sitting stagnant complaining about the same old venues. Missing the old days and our true roots. Stoked And Broke is a DIY entertainment collective with the goal of bringing a larger home to the local north jersey music scene. We are here asking for your help in renovating a warehouse to provide a community center for all the locals artists, musicians, skateboarders, BMX riders, photographers, video-graphers, and fans who have no where to go. 

What We Need & What You Get

We aren't asking for too much but we do need capital to get this project fully developed.  The Stoked And Broke team has already done an amazing job booking local shows at various locations and becoming a team the community can go to for their expressive needs.

So we are asking for $5,000 in donations to put towards:
  • New sound equipment
  • Construction for renovations
  • Zoning permits for the construction
  • Building a stage
  • Building ramps
  • Upgrading safety/security features

How you'll benefit:

  • Be able to attend a fun and safe venue
  • Be able to skate/bike at an indoor location
  • Be able to record/practice music
  • Be able to view/create art with local artists
  • Be involved in a positive community

The Impact

Needless to say this will change our area forever.  With today's modern age, social media can only connect us in certain ways.  This community center will be the structural foundation of connecting to one another.  Here we will have ability to do the things we love our own way.   And we say "we", which includes you, because everyone who comes to the warehouse is apart of it.  You can display your artwork, you can play your music, you can bring your skateboard or bike or whatever it is and we would never turn you away.

Risks & Challenges

Our challenges vary but we are an experienced and resilient group of individuals.  We may come into issues with noise complaints, permit issues, and zoning setbacks within the first year but we are ready to overcome our obstacles.  Our lawyers are ready to help us along the way.  And as long as you are here with us, nothing can stop us.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, you can still help!  Please follow our IG: @stokedandbrokeevents and like our facebook page facebook.com/stokedandbrokeevents then please kindly share this campaign with your friends and family!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Kurzbeschreibung

Privatinitiative von Werner & Ilona Lechner zur Unterstützung der

                                        Erwin Schrümpf

Griechenlandhilfe Österreich

Erwin Schrümpf betreibt seit ca. 2 Jahren erfolgreich den Verein

"griechenlandhilfe.at". Mit seinem Einsatz versorgt er notleidende Menschen in Griechenland. Damit, Ihre medizinische und humanitäre Versorgung gesichert ist. Die Lage wird immer schlimmer. Der Staat und auch andere Hilfsorganisationen sehen zu.

Unsere Ziele

Wir haben uns vorrangig das Ziel gesetzt die Griechenlandhilfe Österreich mit mehr Spenden zu versorgen damit Erwin noch effektiver und öfter helfen kann.

  • 15000€ Startup für die nächste Lieferung
  • Den Verein dauerhaft zu unterstützen durch Weiterführen der Kampagne
  • Für einen weiteren LKW zu sammeln um die Lieferkapazität zu erhöhen
  • Inbetriebnahme einer "Griechenland Österreich.at" Aussenstelle auf Kreta
  • Regelmässige Hilfsmaßnamen vorort

Für Eure Spenden senden wir euch kleine Geschenke der Dankbarkeit zu


Wo die Politik versagt, dort leiden die Menschen

Ich finde es beschämend, dass in unserer modernen Gesellschaft der Mensch so wenig zählt wie derzeit.
Politiker beraten wie Banken geretten werden können und Steuern erhöht werden und Pensionen gekürzt werden sollen. In den Medien bejubelt man, wenn die Kurse der Aktien wieder steigen (daneben ein Bild mit gefüllten Sektgläsern)

In einer deutschen Agenturmeldung der "Frankfuter Allgemeine" las ich folgende Mitteilung:
BERLIN (dpa-AFX) - Das Deutsche Rote Kreuz steht für humanitäre Nothilfe in Griechenland bereit. "Das gilt für den Fall, dass sich die Lage vor Ort weiter verschlimmern sollte", sagte DRK-Sprecher Dieter Schütz der Deutschen Presse-Agentur am Mittwoch. Konkrete Pläne für einen Einsatz in dem von der Staatspleite bedrohten Land gebe es aber nicht. Allerdings habe Griechenland bereits Probleme bei der medizinischen Versorgung. Dies bekämen vor allem Rentner, Arme, Kranke und Flüchtlinge zu spüren. Befürchtet werden auch Engpässe bei der Grundversorgung, sollte sich die finanzielle Lage zuspitzen.

Langzeitarbeitslosigkeit und Armut machen sich bereits bei den SOS Kinderdörfern in Griechenland bemerkbar. Zurzeit bitten fünfzigmal so viele Familien bei der Organisation um Hilfe wie noch vor der Krise, sagte der Leiter der dortigen Kinderdörfer, George Protopapas, dem "Redaktionsnetzwerk Deutschland". Viele Familien drohten auseinanderzubrechen./ggr/DP/fbr
???????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????

Auf was warten sie? Sie haben noch keine Pläne?????
In den täglichen Berichten zb.auf NTV sind immer die Banken und die Aktien im Focus, aber sogut wie nie "der Mensch", der darunter leidet was andere verbockt haben!!!!!
Liebe Politiker, vergesst nie wer der Staat ist. Nicht die Banken oder die Aktien, sondern das Volk.
Mein Motto ist: Geht es dem Volk gut, dann geht es dem Staat gut.

Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann

Dringend benötigtes

Angesichts der zunehmend schwieriger werdenden Lage brauchen wir dringend eure Unterstützung.

Am dringendsten gebraucht werden folgende medizinischen Hilfsmittel und Waren des täglichen Gebrauchs:

• Windeln in allen Größen
• Babyöl und Cremen
• Babynahrung
• Blutzuckerstäbchen
• Hustensaft für Kinder
• Fiebermesser
• Handschuhe in allen Größen
• OP-Masken
• Verbandsstoffe
• Scheren und Pinzetten
• Schienen und Gipsverbände

Wir freuen uns deshalb über jede Unterstützung mit Sachspenden (die auch über unsere Amazon-Wunschliste bestellt und direkt an unser Lager versendet werden können).

Kleiderspenden können wir leider nicht berücksichtigen, da diese beim Transport zu viel Platz benötigen würden, den wir für lebenswichtige Güter benötigen. Wir bitten um Verständnis!
